Reviews.Title: “Better Rating With WiFi”
Reviews.Author: aicwebmaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are here in Miami enjoying the Sony Ericsson. We usually stay in Coconut Grove when we come but since this trip was dedicated to the SEO we bought a package and chose this hotel. The staff is first rate! Helpful, attentive and security conscious. We had lunch at Catch and had a wonderful server named Lacy - fantastic introduction to this hotel. The rooms are nice, ours had been recently updated - but small. Being connected to the Doubletree and The Grand, there is a nice little shopping area separating the hotels that offers some fine shops, services and many restaurant choices. My only real gripe about this Marriott property is that there is no wifi throughout the hotel - being known as a hotel that caters to business, I find this unacceptable. I wouldn't mind a daily charge, but I hate being tethered when I'm in the room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to a Lot of Places”
Reviews.Author: Troyp28
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel three times now and each time has been great. The staff is great and the location to the port, South Beach and the Bayside area is great. Each morning our view of the bay was amazing. The restaurant was very good, but what you would expect. Nothing that overwhelmingly stood out. I think the greatest benefit for this hotel is the location, comfortable rooms and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not amazing, middle of the road Marriott”
Reviews.Author: CtHelsBells
Reviews.Content: Nice view from my balcony. Room is v clean and great sheets. Breakfast was very average. The coffee bar in the lobby is expensive & should be avoided, a small bottle of water cost $4 plus tax!! Easy drive across the bridge to Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overlook the Bay and Cruise ship Harbor”
Reviews.Author: SeaRay48
Reviews.Content: Near, everything, the arena, shopping, overlooking the bay, marina, pool was not great..but I would recommend, service good, rooms nice.

Reviews.Title: “First Marriott stay was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jill b
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay for a work conference. If I had selected this hotel by my own accord, I feel fairly certain I would have moved to other accommodations. When we arrived (at normal check-in time), our room was not ready. We decided to walk to get a bite to eat...except that there is very little in the way of selection within walking distance of this hotel. The hotel does connect to the Doubletree next door, via some shops and a restaurant or two, thankfully, but this "connection" area has a musty odor. As for the guest rooms, mine at least was extremely small. While there were a few different pillows to choose from, I found none of them to be satisfactory. Fortunately, the bed itself was mostly comfortable. In much of the conference areas, cell phone and Wi-Fi reception were virtually non-existant. For a traveling professional, this made things extremely difficult as we all know work does not stop just because you're away from your desk. I hate to be such a negative nelly, however, for my first stay at a Marriott property, I was quite disappointed. I would not return to this hotel if I were to visit Miami in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Internet otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: Sealboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine. Good service. Decent rooms. Internet speed is horrible and that's I major flaw

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Kiki555
Reviews.Content: I was a little put off by the fact that you had to pay for parking when I'm already paying to stay at the hotel, $26 or $30 for valet a day. We decided to pay for the valet parking and found it was well worth it. Louis the night supervisor was great. He was nice, helpful and dependable. What ever he said he followed through. The had the car nice and cool by the time we got down to pick it up before we left. Neal was also great. He went above and beyond to make sure we had what ever we needed.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Marriott on the system.”
Reviews.Author: Clublane
Reviews.Content: Generally I like Marrott hotel properties. This however is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Room was supposed to have been renovated, but the furniture looked like it was from the 80's and was filthy. The room smelled and was terribly laid out. Bathroom was not just small but almost unusable. They only dole out one towel per person. Forget about connecting rooms unless you're ready to hear every sound your neighbor makes. Bad, bad, bad!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ikndy
Reviews.Content: Here recently for business, and was very happy with the comfortable beds and clean rooms. Great views if you are Bayside. Decent food. Staff was very friendly and was very pleased with my stay. A great option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; great service; but no wifi”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: Wifi would have gotten this hotel 5 stars. In this day and age, it is inconceivable that a brand that built itself on the business traveler would not have wifi.There is a wired data connection in the room but that ties you to the desk. In addition it cost $12.95 a day. In the lobby, there is wifi - for the same $12.95 a day. Overall the hotel is very nice. The service is superb. One of the reasons I love Marriott is their focus on service. It starts with the valet and continues till you depart. When I arrived, the valet was smiling and helpful - explaining the various parking options. Self-park for $26 a day or valet for $30. At the desk, the representative was pleasant and quick. The bellhop was awesome, he gave me a great orientation of the local things to do and pointed out several low cost shuttle options to area shopping districts. He told me about the free shuttle to South Beach and pointed out the location and times of the restaurant. He discussed the other hotel amenities like the pool and fitness center and pointed out where the rooms hair dryer could be found. In the restaurant, the waitstaff was patient and smiling. Three separate staff members stopped by to check my satisfaction or refill my drinks. The food was delicious and almost reasonable for a hotel restaurant. Lunch was pulled pork and salad for $12. The hotel is 5 minutes from a nice shopping area. There is also a shuttle ($5 each way) to the area's outlet mall which is about 25 minutes from the hotel. Between that and the free shuttle to south beach, I needed a new suitcase to get home my purchases! The rooms are spacious and I love that Marriott room safes are large enough to hold my laptop. My room had a nice view of the harbor. There is a decent sized fitness room with a variety of equipment and an AWESOME view. Makes you look forward to a morning or sunset workout! The pool is a good size with ample seating and lounges. There is an outside bar as well. Close to the pool is a hot tub. There are two additional reasons I seek out Marriott when I travel: 1) towels/washcloths: there are always plenty - I don't have to beg for them and 2) Marriott is a 'pepsi' hotel. THANKFULLY. I tolerate coke products at other chains, so I appreciate the pepsi! Yes, I know, not a reason to book a hotel...but we all have our needs! The hotel is a nice value for the area. Many of the boutique hotels (and I have stayed in several) are not as well taken care of, don't provide the service and attention to detail, and are only slightly less expensive. This Marriott is a good option between the less expensive options and the very expensive high end options. You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TopDoc2010
Reviews.Content: Great location with great view. Some of the hallways smell like sewage. Concierge lounge had the same breakfast every day. Dinner snacks were fair to poor. Maids knock even when do not disturb on door.

Reviews.Title: “A Work in Progress”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette H
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, very comfy beds, pleasant atmosphere, good food in the restaurant, best breakfast room service we've ever had (eggs over easy were still hot and cooked to perfection! Particularly good hash browns, with onions). Happy hour was nice, with fried plaintains as the munchie. It seems the staff has all been recently re-trained in customer service, so all of the attention was a bit over the top, with lots of reassurances that if we needed anything to be sure to ask, but the actual execution was not quite up to snuff. Parking was extremely expensive, our full-size van wouldn't fit into their regular garage, so we had to valet it, which was $40/night, but it was just outside the lobby door so it was very convenient. The biggest problem, though, was on checkout, when we discovered the parking had been upped to almost $66/night, so BE SURE TO CHECK YOUR BILL CAREFULLY! They dropped it back immediately when we complained, but I'm sure many a business traveler wouldn't have been so diligent and they would've gotten away with it. They're obviously making an effort, they just haven't worked out all the kinks yet. Spectacular views if you're on the bayside, our room had a balcony with a table and chairs which was very nice. Pool was good, hot tub a bit too hot but agitated well. Pool bar was closed when we were there, but could be fun on a weekend. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great except the fire alarm going off in the early morning hours”
Reviews.Author: Luvmycat
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfortable, the staff was welcoming, and the breakfast at the hotel's restaurant was delicious, but the fire alarm went off three times in the early morning hours, and, upon making it down from the 31st floor, the staff was disorganized and somewhat unapologetic. It's also in an area where there isn't a whole lot nearby. Plan on taking transit or a cab, or renting a car to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Miami without the beach”
Reviews.Author: timelvis
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Miami Marriott at the end of February 2012. It's fairly close to the Miami Airport (about a $25-$30 cab ride). As most of the other reviews have noted, the hotel is located right on a Marina with a decent water view but there is no beach. It is very near the Port of Miami and I could see at least four cruise ships from my room. The lobby is attractive and modern. Check in was swift and painless. I was given a room on the 19th floor facing the marina and what I assume was an apartment building or condo. The room wasn't your typical box shaped. It had and odd curved shape because of the hotel architecture. It didn't bother me. There was a nice little balcony big enough for two small chairs and a side table. The bathroom was small, but nicely decorated and bright. The downside was that the door opened inward and nearly touched the toilet when opened. There was a combination shower/tub with a boring shower head with less than great water pressure. A nice sized flat screen HD television was attached to the wall. Next to is was a desk with multiple connections on the wall for your computer and other electronics. There is no wireless , but an Ethernet cable is provided. The trick is, you can't access the Internet via the plug in on the wall. The real connection is a small box under the desk. Be sure and turn off your wireless on your computer or you'll have difficulty connecting. The hotel also doesn't let you know that the room safe is located in the desk drawer and not in the closet like every other hotel you've ever been in. Fortunately, I'd read other reviewers warnings about this. I ordered room service the first night. The Customer Care people at the Marriott are excellent. My only complaint about room service was that the menu in the obligatory Hotel Services notebook was obsolete. You were supposed to use the room service menu provided in a separate card on the desk (with higher prices). Why they simply didn't remove the outdated room service information I don't know. The room service menu is fairly limited and pricey. But all of the items I had were well presented and tasty. The room service staff were friendly and swift. The first night I woke up at 3 a.m. to a loud party taking place at the apartment building across from the hotel. There was loud music blaring and people shouting from a veranda. Just when I was falling asleep again, a loud speaker within the hotel blared an announcement that there had been a false fire alarm and people could return to their rooms? I hadn't heard any alarm. The announcement was made several times. Another thing I need to note about the hotel room was that the carpet was filthy. My feet would be black on the bottom after walking around barefoot in the room. It was visibly dirty as well. Though housekeeping in general seemed fine and efficient. The Marriott is conveniently located near a peoplemover station. It is a short ride to the nearby Bayside Shopping complex with access to great restaurants and shopping. And it's free! There is also a small shopping center in the adjacent Doubletree Hotel that includes a few restaurants and shops as well as a small grocery/liquor store. That's about all there is within walking distance and Miami definitely isn't a pedestrian friendly city. The pool at the Marriott is very small and isn't heated. It was 82 degrees when I used it and it was freezing. There is a small bar at the pool where you can get limited food and beverage service. I did experience a few other oddities at the Marriott. There was someone staying on my floor that seemed to be practicing the trombone several hours a day. It was fairly loud in the hallway, but fortunately I couldn't hear it in my room. I also got stuck in the elevator one night when returning to my room. We used the intercom and were assured a building engineer would free us. In the meantime, one of the passengers forced open the door and we were able to use one of the other elevators. There is a nice business center where you can print boarding passes for free. Over all, the Miami Marriott was a pleasant place to stay for business.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami at the end of February 2012 for a 3-day international conference and stayed at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay. The common complaint was that there was no Wifi in the hotel, which was very inconvenient for professional business people away from their office. And the three nights I stayed the fire alarm went off, which was really annoying. It might have been due to the renovation going on to install Wifi!?! But besides these inconveniences, I enjoyed my stay at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay. Thereâ€™s a useful coffee shop onsite called Espressamente. You can grab a quick breakfast and lunch there. However, the sandwiches at lunch are sold out quickly. Catch is the restaurant onsite and has a nice bar and terrace with a nice view of the city. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with comfortable beds. Nice view of the boating dock but it can be noisy at night with the bridge nearby. Not ideal for light sleepers. The rooms facing the pool are quieter. The hotel has a nice pool area with a bar which is quite convenient. There is nothing much around the hotel except a great wine restaurant called Bin 8, which is 15 minutes away walking distance and a park by the water. Plan $20 per cab ride to South Beach. Only 5 minutes to public transportation to downtown Miami. 30 minutes from FLL airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: G G
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful, informed, staff. Very customer-oriented. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Breakfast, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 6 months ago, primarily because they had a great rate, and I was comfortable with the level of service you would expect from a full service marriott. I have to say, they lived up to their promise, automatically upgrading me to a oceanview room, and comping me a couple of days of parking because of a snafu at checkin. The restaurant serves up tasty breakfasts, and offers outdoor seating. This location isn't primo for vacationers but does have not-so-bad taxi cab service to miami beach and calle ocho areas. not really a lot of nearby options for walking distances. Also, there is a full service convenience mini-mall right next door which has lots of convenience items.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Manolo213
Reviews.Content: We first booked a regular guest room in this hotel. when we arrived there, we decided to pay extra to upgrade our room. The room was on the 25th floor facing south, and the view was incredible! The room was spacious and the bed was so soft and comfortable. There was also a Juliet balcony in which we love to get some warm breeze while watching the ocean, the bridges and the cruises. We also enjoy the pool very much. In terms of the location, you need a car to go to Miami beach, which is only 10 to 15 minutes drive. Parking is expensive. The hotel is very quiet at night Therefore a good sleep is always assured.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the ocean breeze from your balcony”
Reviews.Author: catholicgrl2
Reviews.Content: Like having a balcony that overlooks the ocean? I do! But I also like internet access... Let's start with the positive: I attended a conference at Miami's Marriott Biscayne Bay in February. It is a beautiful hotel with nice staff, comfy beds, Bath and Body Works products, and an Illy coffee bar and separate restaurant. But my favorite amenity was the accessibly balcony from my room with a decent view of the bay. When I had to work, it was a luxury to get to do so while enjoying the ocean breeze. Sine I rarely left the hotel on this visit, I experienced most of what they have to offer. The conference rooms were nice, and the catered food was decent. I ate at the restaurant "Catch" once for dinner and once for bfast. Breakfast was great - a tasty egg white omelet with avocado and fruit (I appreciated the fruit substitution for hash browns). A bfast buffet was available, but I didn't want that much food.Â  And now the less-than-positive: My dinner experience at "Catch" was average. The service that night was awful, cigar smoke overpowered the deck, and the chef refused any substitutions for my friend who drove an hour to Miami to see me. That said, my salmon was good. (For dinner, walk around the block for sushi at Nove instead of eating at " Catch.") In addition to my not- so-great dinner experience, my only other complaint is the horrible ( and I mean horrible) Internet and cell phone coverage at this hotel.during the conference, I rarely even had a 3G/cellular signal to get text messages, much less Internet access. For a working mom on a business trip, this was frustrating. Even in the lobby, where wifi was "free," I had to use my 3G access because the signal was so slow. In the rooms, Internet access is extra.Â  Marriott, it's time to catch up! All of this is to say, one deep breath from my balcony with the ocean view is all it took for my "Catch" and wifi troubles to just melt away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: scherzva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times before taking a cruise out of Miami. The cruise port is less than 10 minutes away. There are some dining options close by. The hotel was nicely updated in late 2010 and made the place even more enjoyable to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in order to be right at the pulse of the Miami Boat Show. At $400/night we were disappointed to say the least. While they were kind and friendly, the expediency of our requests were slow and lacking. The ice machine was not operating on our floor and at the request of ice and glasses each night (maid did not leave glasses two nights in a row), they took forever to respond. The did compensate us w/ a mini fridge during our stay, however, at that price...why wasn't there one in the room to begin with? We've decided that we will stay at the Doubletree next door, or on Miami Beach next time we visit the show.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsparis1
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend the day prior to our cruise in a nice hotel on Biscayne Bay and that's exactly what we got. Our room had a wonderful view which we enjoyed during the day and at night with all the city and bay lights. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. The front office was extremely helpful when we asked for directions to a local city center that had wonderful choices of food for dinner and even watched the Super Bowl at the Hard Rock Cafe. Also, the hotel recommended using the Metro to the center which was free and very direct to several locations. All in all we had a fun one day stay and really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: TabuJupiter
Reviews.Content: Marriott is normally great place to stay. Mixed review of this experience. Asked for an early ck in, on arrival told not quite ready but would call shortly ( 12:30p, finally we had to approach at 4:30. Breakfast we were asked which type toast to bring with oureggs then found extra charges for toast on the bill? Just minor annoyances with no justification. Nice lobby friendlystaff. On the bay, could do better in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a PreCruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: BSQ
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel fairly last minute via Priceline for one night prior to embarking on a cruise vacation. As with all downtown Miami hotels, parking is overpriced ($26-30 a night), I was going to be moving my car to an off site lot ($4.50 a night) after check in for the duration of my cruise. The Valets let me park my car off to the side out of the way while I checked in. I arrived at 5pm to a busy hotel, but check in was friendly, quick and efficient. I thought with my Priceline reservation Iâ€™d end up with the dregs of room location, but had a lovely marina view from the 23rd floor. The room was nicely appointed. The bed very comfortable though they had to have some of the smallest bed pillows Iâ€™ve seen in a long while. The toiletries were Bath and Body Works Ginger Orange â€“ a nice touch. The only negative to my room was the sliding glass door whistled when it was closed completely. I slept with it cracked open ever so slightly to stop the whistle. A couple things were easy to miss: the safe is located in the desk drawer, and a coffee maker was on the top shelf of the closet. Free Wi-Fi was available in the lobby. Attached to the hotel is a small mall-like area with shops and places to eat. In the morning a receipt for my stay was slipped under my door, check out via the TV was quick and painless. It was a $10 cab ride to the port in the morning. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great business trip”
Reviews.Author: beachbride0811
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean with a great view of the bay. About a 20 minute ride to Miami beach which is soo worth it. Had buffet breakfast in the hotel one morning and it was great. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Manatees!!”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: Never did I expect to see manatees in the wild! From my balcony way up high, I could see the piers off to my right. Much to my surprise, I saw what appeared to be manatees in the water. I couldn't believe it. I thought my eyes must have deceived me because I was so high. An hour later, I went out to the balcony again and noticed that the shapes that I was guessing were manatees had moved. Now, convinced, I headed downstairs, down along the water and out to the last pier, where I recalled seeing them. I didn't see them in the water until I was almost on top of them on the pier. I stood there for quite a while enjoying them. Two other people came out saying that they had also seen them from their balconies. It was truly exciting and memorable and this alone made my stay at the Marriott Biscayne Bay wonderful! Although not at South Beach, the hotel is convenient to the beaches and local sites, but far enough away, that it feels isolated. At night, you can sit outside the bar on benches and enjoy the breeze and a good cocktail --- this was in January when everyone at home was freezing. The pool isn't anything to write home about, but, it's adequate. There's a pool bar and fitness center and a friendly front desk staff. The pool also has a hot tub - yea! The only bad part of the experience is that there is no wireless internet in the rooms. It's bad enough that internet is not included in the room. But, wired. Only wired! WTH?! I brought my Kindle Fire and could not use it in my room. What a waste. How is this a modern hotel? I felt like I was in some third world country! There is wireless internet in the lobby. But, I didn't want to hang out in the lobby. Rooms are OK. A nice coffee shop in the lobby with brewed Illy espresso. Nice. Overall -- highly rated -- largely because of the manatees.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: newfrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre cruise.Speedy checkin and check out.Staff were friendly.lovely room.enjoyed the room service and cold beer in a bucket.very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “good way to start to the honneymoon”
Reviews.Author: Azulito_14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the usa for our honneymoon. We kicked off in Miami and stayed at this hotel for about 3 days. Everything was pre-payed for, so we didn't have any problems with checking in, or extra's that we had to pay for such as parking...The only thing that was not included was the roomservice, but we found the prices to be very reasonable. Our room had a nice view over the bay and we had a little balcony where we ate our breakfast in the morning. The room was very comfortable and clean. We had a kingsize bed that slept very wel!! The staff was very kind to us and even gave us a complementery bottle of champagne and chocolat covered strawberries for our honneymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bay Views”
Reviews.Author: DebFL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for 3 days while attending a conference.Unfortunately I have mixed reviews. The hotel is nicely located in Biscayne bay. Upon arrival we had some issues with checking in but management corrected the issue quickly. The hotel is fairly large with approx 26 floors. My room on the 7th floor was small but had 180 degree floor to ceiling views of the bay. I had a king bed room which faced this gorgeous view. Unfortunately, the walls are thin and the hotel restaurant bar extends outside with a live band on Thursday nights. I could hear very clearly and loudly every word, clap, laugh as well as the neighbors every loud sound. This would not have been an issue if I was on vacation and not attending a 7am conference. The hotel and rooms are nicely appointed and clean. The food supplied at the conference was somewhat disappointing. The hotel has an Illy coffee bar and a restaurant. I recommend the market deli next to the hotel. Great food, starbucks coffee, and snacks at a much more affordable price. We had drinks at our hotel restaurant and ate at Bleu Moon next door and had unfortunate experiences at both. The hotel also has a gym and an outdoor pool with a bar. The gym is very nice by hotel standards with plenty of equipment and great views of the bay. The pool is pretty small for a hotel of this size. The hotel is in walking distance of a dog friendly park and some restaurants. The hotel concierge also informed us of a free shuttle system which we did not have time to use. The parking for the hotel is $30 day for valet and $26 day for the garage. We parked in the hotel garage which was very convenient but beware the hotel adds the fee to your room. The assumption made by the hotel leads you to believe you must pay them for parking. This is a flat rate per day, but if you pay at the garage instead its based on hourly rates. I was over-charged by almost a full day. I spoke with management after my visit and they promptly credited my account. I was very impressed with Marriott's attention to customer satisfaction. I would definitely not choose to stay at this hotel on vacation as it is best suited for conferences and cruise guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: xIngrid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just amazing. Everything from the room - which had an amazing view of the bay and the greatest beds I've ever slept in - to the friendly and helpful staff. The location is also great, and the hotel is very close to the Port of Miami, which was ideal for us since our stay was pre-cruise. I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel. If you're looking for a place to stay in Miami, _stay at the Marriott_.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: rkecat
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on Priceline for a pre-cruise stay. Easy cab ride from the airport. Beautiful lobby and friendly front desk staff. Location felt secure and safe although we didn't venture out into the local neighborhood. There is a small shopping plaza between the hotel and the Doubletree next door with restaurants, wine shop, and a small convenience store. Our "city view" room actually had a nice view of the Bay off to the side. We had a corner room with a small balcony. The room was quite spacious and typical furnishings for remodeled Marriotts. Love the comfy beds! The location wouldn't be something I'd pick for a whole vacation in Miami since there's not much nearby, but it would be great for business downtown or a one or two night stay. Cab ride to the port was quick and easy the next morning. Only drawbacks seem to be no wi-fi in the roooms (it's free in the lobby) and that the restaurants seem overpriced - even for Miami. The ones next door are much more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jose C
Reviews.Content: I most say that is a great hotel, perfect rooms and fantastic location, However, the service just get better and better. I normally stay in this hotel " my home in Miami" around 6 times a year and the level of service is great. Last time Megan from front desk was very helpful, on some documents I needed, as well as Pedro or "Junior" from the valet, always available and willing to help with small details that make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: RollCaster
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception staff and a room with a slightly restricted but beautiful view of Biscayne Bay. The well equipped fitness center has a fabulous view of he Bay. Good restaurant in the hotel and several others in an adjacent shopping gallery. Huge lobby with a variety of places to meet, work or have coffee. The bedroom was medium sized but all the space I needed for a business trip where I do some work in the hotel room. Most important is that the A/C is central, so fairly quiet. And unlike so many Courtyard Marriots, it does not blast directly onto the desk area. Bathroom was decent size. For all this, the room rate ($249) was about the same as the overpriced downtown Courtyard where I usully stay. Areas where Marriott could improve this facility: the breakfast was way over-priced - $22 for oatmeal coffee & pastry! The corridor outside my room needed vacuuming when I arrived and was still dirty 30 hours later, despite my complaint. There was no list of TV channels in the Guest Services Directory and when I asked for a replacement I was first told they would send one up. 7 hours later they told me they are gradually removing all the directories from the rooms (!?) and guests can call the Front Desk to ask about individual channel numbers!

Reviews.Title: “Good but I expected better”
Reviews.Author: SalukiMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night; booked 2 rooms well in advance. Upon checking in, was told "rooms weren't ready yet". Ok- this was at 3pm. Upon returning at 5, was AGAIN told rooms were not ready! Uh, no- check in is 4pm, for starters... other people were checking in left & right... not to mention the fact I had my 80 year old father in law with us! After asking to speak to a manager... she said "No problem"... and *magically* 2 rooms were available! Staff about the hotel were friendly. GREAT view of the bay...the boats... Rooms were clean & comfortable. Be warned, this hotel is NOT within walking distance to most any "attractions".... Bayside Marketplace is a $7 cab ride away. All in all, eh....just ok- I would definately not give this Marriott another shot though... not at those prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise night for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: Patelius
Reviews.Content: After travelling 19 hours from northern Europe and excited about the following day's first ever cruise the competent check-in service was most soothing. Our luggage was out of the cab in no time by the valet and the actual check-in was equally effective and friendly. Our reservation was double and we were offered the choice of double king or two twins. We were happy to choose the latter in the 19th floor with spectalular view of the Port of Miami with Miami Beach in the background. What a way to start the cruise by waking up early in the morning with unobstructed views of your cruise ship! The price didn't include breakfast which we had anyway by choosing the excellent but somewhat pricy breakfast buffet. The location 2 miles from the port coudn't be better with cabs ready in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “poor management”
Reviews.Author: travelerBob33258
Reviews.Content: I stayed there Jan 15-17, 2012.....The first room smelled like a sewer. They moved us to another room where the toilet did not flush. When we checked out I left three new shirts in the room. we called the hotel the next day and they said they found no shirts. Two days later I called again from my cruise ship and demanded the manager. I insisted they look in the first room and, voila, they found the shirts......too late to use on the cruise, which is the reason I had bought them. So my overall opinion is that the hotel has lax management.

Reviews.Title: “lovely views”
Reviews.Author: expatinespana
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, lovely views. Rooms are spacious and clean . No beach but nice pol and right on the bay

Reviews.Title: “Nice Alternative to South Beach Hotels”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a one night trip to miami to see a NBA Miami Heat Game. Perfect location for just that. The American Airlines Arena was a two minute drive away. The bridge to South Beach was two minutes away as well. The hotel was nice and modern. The only complaint that I have it that the tv went out out during the 4th quarter of the NFC Title game so I didnt get to see the end. The hotel also has a little tunnel connected to it with a bar, restaurant and store that were very useful to me. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good View, the rest, eh.”
Reviews.Author: wrldxplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. We were greeted promptly, and off to our room we went. We had a room with a view and lovely balcony. Due to the balcony layouts, the rooms are oddly shaped. Pros-Great View -comfortable bed -stylish room Cons-small bathroom -no mini fridge -The Catch restaurant was pricey for dinner for the quality of the food we had -The Catch breakfast was mediocre, but our server was outstanding. We chose not to do the buffet (we would have enough of that on our cruise!!) Our general feeling is that we were just in and out. The staff didn't make us feel particularly special, just here is your room key, here is your dinner, here is your cab. goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised at View and Service”
Reviews.Author: TacomaGuys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for a conference being held in the same facility. Every employee I encountered was friendly and interested in making sure my guest needs were being met. King-bed room was of a generous size and included chair w/ ottoman and desk area. The bed didn't overwhelm the room. Balcony with bay view was appreciated. Blackout curtains worked well blocking the sunrise from south-facing wall of windows. Other amenities included big screen TV, in-room safe (hidden in work desk drawer) and coffee-maker (stored in closet). Bathroom was clean but on the smaller side. Standard bath goods included soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. Acceptable quality but not high-end. Ate at Catch one evening. Drank there a couple of nights. Great, friendly service and good selection of food and drink at fairly reasonable price (for being in the hotel). Room service breakfast delivered promptly and as ordered. Fitness center is on the 5th floor with great bay views. The center has an excellent selection of cardio (with built in tv monitors) and life fitness equipment... and VERY clean. Business center off the lobby provides free flight check-in and boarding pass printing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful bay view”
Reviews.Author: Grateful01
Reviews.Content: One does not hesitate to workout at this hotel. With a stellar view of South Beach and the bay,working out is a pleasure. The staff here is exceptional, and is willing to accommodate your needs. As a Chicagoan, it was delightful to grab a quick dinner at Catch, and enjoy the sultry view of the bay. As a business traveler, the lack of wireless Internet in the rooms was a shock....especially at a Marriott. My bay view room with a cute balcony helped me get over it!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: keschpo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a number of times and hesitated to write a review hoping I would like it more. The lobby and restaurant have been renovated however, the rooms need some help. Last stay my sliding door was broken and lots of snags in the carpet. This room while clean needed some TLC with lots plaster nicks. Like having the little balcony if you are Iucky to get a decent view. The restaurant is very nice and while you may be tempted to eat outside, skip it. You spend your meal shooing away the nasty birds the entire meal. Pool area is sub par and very small.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Hurls55
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stay hotel awaiting boarding for a cruise. The hotel was well-located near shopping and theatre and on the water. The food service in the hotel was exceptional - excellent food and tremendous service. The reception area was very welcoming and the staff wore attractive but casual attire that was quite noticeable. The rooms were a funky shape that was a little awkward. Also, the room amenities seemed to be less than one would expect in a very nice hotel. There was no apparent coffee maker. The towels were placed in locations that made finding them a little challenging. Beyond these very minor inconveniences, the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay was a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: NYC10023_88
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay for work right next to the Port (because the JW Marquis was too expensive); I was very pleasantly surprised - room was a good size, great view, nice little balcony. The outdoor bar was really nice too. My local colleagues commented that they did not know the hotel would be so nice. I had a very short time for lunch and the restaurant staff was very helpful in helping me select items that would be ready quickly so that I could be in and out in 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: shanskib
Reviews.Content: I travel often for work, and would highly recommend the Marriott Biscayne Bay to anyone. It is a short drive from the airport, and the hotel offers beautiful views of the city of Miami, as well as breathtaking views of the Biscayne Bay and Miami Beach. It is close to downtown Miami, and also a very short drive to Miami Beach (just across the bridge, and you are there!). The hotel staff, from the reception & reservation desk, conceirge lounge, housekeeping and room service, valet, coffee shop and restaurants, are all superior. Again, this is an excellent hotel, and again, great rooms, excellent service, and delicious restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: buddy_rotty
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying at the Marriott Biscayne Bay for a single night prior to a Cruise vacation. It is a very busy lobby area but check-in was simple and the staff very friendly. We had a beautiful view from our room, very nice bathroom, shower and I enjoyed the citrus bath products. We slept in the heavenly bed and got a great night's sleep. There is an IPOD docking station, small fridge and bathrobes in the room. I was able to secure a discounted rate at $88 for the night. My husband spent some time at the bar and was amused when a gentleman there who had too much to drink and was still demanding more (slamming his glass on the bar) and not speaking English, the young bartender was very distraught. She made a quick call and the Security staff magically appeared with a wheelcheer and wisked him off to his room (free shuttle service for the inebriated ;) I guess. It was a short cab ride over to the Ship's Port. I think it was a $12 fare. Checkout was a breeze. The hotel has plenty around it to roam around for a bite or coffee, shopping etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ct3408
Reviews.Content: Con enient for business, clean, friendly, welcoming. Good eateries with choices indoors and outdoors. My room had a gorgeous view, but was small with tight bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel0606
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay for a week before we cruised out of Fort Lauderdale. The location was excellent. Our room had a balcony overlooking the Bay in one direction and the city the other way. It was beautiful. We were very close to South Beach and many Miami attractions such as Jungle Island and the Miami Aquarium. Rental cars are available at the hotel. The rooms are roomy and the beds are very comfortable. We ate breakfast at the hotel because it was included in our room rate and the food and service was excellent. There was also an excellent deli in the same complex or we were a short distance to restaurants and free public transportation. Hotel also offered free shuttle to South beach but times it was available were limited.There is free Wi Fi in the lobby and concierge lounge. The newly renovated lobby is beautiful and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel but uncommon issue arose leading to low score”
Reviews.Author: Wonderbra_Star
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel overall and would be happy to give it another chance based on my experience. I also stayed pre cruise. I found concierge very helpful, I had a package delivered to the hotel prior to arrival and had no issues with that, found the shops and the Sports bar next door very convenient ( I don't know if they are part of the hotel but happy hour was great). I also spent some time in the ground floor bar and ordered some food and beers. Staff anf guest were real friendly, I has having a small issue with an over friendly, intoxicated guy who was promptly 'encouraged' to leave which was really great as a single female traveller. I had a couple of issues- firstly I placed a breakfast order using the room service card in the room. In the morning I woke up early so I called and asked for the breakfast to come early. They claimed not to have my order. On this occassion it was not a problem and I replaced the order however if I had woken up when expected then I would not have know the order was missing and would have waited around getting rather p'd off. Secondly, I took a lot of my things out of my bag and put them on the closet floor. I have no idea why buy when I woke up, the closet floor was soaking wet (and obviously so were all my clothes and boxes etc). Nothing inside my bag was wet and all my toilettories were in the bathroom so it was definately a malfunction of the strangest kind. Unfortunately a silk dress was caught in the crossfire and a couple of dry cleans later and the fabric is still stained and has gone crispy. There was nothign really that could be done at time of check out and I appreciate the room service charge being removed from my bill but I will be contacting the hotel for compensation of the dress- as this was one of 2 formal dresses I bought to cruise with, it definately left me short!

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice!! Over-priced..POOR customer service!”
Reviews.Author: SusanC924
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a cruise. Room was not ready...BE AWARE that check-in is NOT until 4pm. Also if you are staying as a family the suites only have 1 king size bed and an UNCOMFORTABLE sofa bed!!! The WORST thing besides the sofa bed, and waiting ALL Day for our room is that the ONLY way to use wi-fi is in the LOBBY!!! Not kidding...they have ethernet cords in the room...REALLY?? Even Holiday Inn Express has wi-fi in the rooms! Staff did not seem to care! Maybe they care more about pre-criuse passengers.... We will NOT be staying at this or ANY OTHER Marriott in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Renewed, without attaining the new feel”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheuniverse
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers little good, unless you need to dock the boat near the hotel, but they still dont offer wifi in the rooms, the pool area sucks, and the isolation between "bridged" rooms are awfull. Stay away, there are plenty of good Miami hotels with better room views, and far better location.

Reviews.Title: “Over-hyped, over-priced, and checking out...”
Reviews.Author: 29Teddy
Reviews.Content: I often rely on Tripadvisor when choosing a hotel, but this time, fellow travelers, you steered me wrong. I intended to stay at the Miami Marriot Biscayne Bay for 3 nights after Christmas, but bailed after one horrible night. My experience was as follows: 1) The view is so overhyped. I paid $228 a night ($300 with taxes and parking) for a bay view on a high floor. My bay view primarily looking into the windows of the condo high-rise next door, a nasty cell tower, and an industrial view of the port of Miami. Reviewers who think this is a magnificent view must really like industrial chic. 2) I upgraded to the so-called concierge level so I would have Internet access without the hassle of daily fees only to be informed that I had to pay for Internet access. After complaining, the front desk "comped" the Internet; which, by the way is not wireless. Hello, Marriott this is the 21st century! 3) The room was small and cramped and the only light was from one sliding glass door (forget about a balcony, even though the photos strongly suggest that there are balconies). A Parent Tip - the railing across sliding door when it is open can not possibly be current code, because the top of it barely came to my waist and it wouldn't be all that difficult to flip over the thing when you are standing on the sliding door track. The door was also difficult to open and must date back to when the place was built. This is relevant because at 2:00 am when the wind picked up, it made a loud high-pitched noise because of gaps in the door. It was so disturbing I had to open the door to stop the whistling noise. It was a warm night so this was OK except the traffic noise from the causeway is considerable and, although I live in an urban downtown area and am used to traffic noise, it was quite loud. 4) I wanted to chill a bottle of wine, but no rooms have bar refrigerators in them. (?!) 5) The bed was OK except for the very thin bed linens that would be more at home at a cut-rate, motel than an expensive hotel. It made me wish I had brought my Bed Sack! 6) To top it all off when I ran a bath (the morning after a rather sleepless night because of the problems above) there was hair (as in many - and someone elseâ€™s!) floating in the water. This was the last straw... I packed up and checked out. I am a Marriott frequent-flyer and this isn't what I expect from Marriott. I love the Edgewater-Wynwood neighborhood and (as one of my previous reviews relates) have had great stays at the Grand where I will be sure to book for future trips to Miami. Add note: One good thing about my stay ... in my rush to leave this hotel, I left my cell charger and 'jammies in the room. Housekeeping bagged and tagged them and I was able to get them back. Taking the extra time to do this was nice on the part of the housekeeping staff. :-)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with nice view”
Reviews.Author: zula44
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. We got a nice big room with king bed and balcony with a nice view of the bay. Sadly we could not see the cruiseships. The room was spacious and clean, nice bed. The bathroom was rather small but clean, so OK. We had breakfast included, which was very nice, lots of fruit, eggs cooked to order, different kinds of bread, ..... really nice, friendly service. We used the metro people mover to get around during daytime (downtown, bayfront shopping center), we felt very safe, it's free and clean. We had dinner at the chinese restaurant, Tony Chan, which had a kind of open kitchen (but with a glass wall) I had never seen this in a European chinese restaurant, you could see the cook at work. Reception and all other employees were very friendly and helpfull. Enjoyed very much drinking my glass of wine in one of the easy chairs on the outside of the bar, nice view of the bay (we had very nice weather). In short, we really enjoyed our stay and won't hesitate to book this hotel again. Yes, it was a bit more expensive than the other hotels we stayed before, but it was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay one night before a cruise. Although the hotel is a little out of the way, Bayside Marketplace was a $7 cab ride. Originally I booked a standard room but mentioned at check in that it was our anniversary and we were upgraded to a view of the Port of Miami which was a nice touch. Everyone was very nice and the hotel was very clean as well. We had breakfast included and was quite satisfied with the food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay before cruise ....”
Reviews.Author: luvsummers
Reviews.Content: Not the closest place to the airport but real handy for those taking cruises. It's about a $25.00 taxi ride from MIA and a $12.00 taxi ride to the cruise terminal. Other than that, not too much to do in the immediate area. Service is very good. Plenty of places to eat adjacent to the facility. Rooms are clean but smelled stale. Nice spot out back to sit and look at all the boats. I'll stay here again next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great View!”
Reviews.Author: boundlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. I am an elite member and this is a great hotel. The view is wonderful over the bay watching all of the boats. Rooms are spacious and clean. If I had to pick one downfall it would be no wireless internet in the rooms but other than that its a great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Dexter G
Reviews.Content: Gina Pitti who works at the Marriott Miami Biscayne Bay is a great asset to the Marriott organization. She really took the time to help us during our stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: ombrelle
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay for one night before our Cruise in November 2011. When we arrived from Montreal, at about 11 am, our room wasn't ready. We asked for a port view room to be told it was an extra 30$. We declined this. They took our suitcases to a locked room and off we went to visit the city. We walked about 5 minutes and took a train on elevated rails. The train was free and travelled the downtown area. We stopped at the Bayside Market Place for some lunch and shopping. We returned to the hotel at about 3:30 pm and lucky enough we had a port view on the 11 th floor. That evening for diner, we found the hotel prices a bit too much at 40$/adult so we used the free wifi on the lobby to find something close by. We ended walking to the Burger King about 5-10 minutes away. The service there was the worst. It's dirty, but it did the job. Room: Small but very comfortable beds, free safe, hair dryer, iron and board, lots of pillows. There is an outside pool, free gym, free lobby wifi. Breakfast was included for 2 adults other wise the price would have been 19$ for the buffet. Children under 10 (I think) was 5$. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel, then left at 10 am for our cruise and got there before the rush. It cost us about 15$ with tip for the taxi ride We were part of the first group on the boat and enjoyed our lunch there. This hotel is perfectly situated for a pre-cruise stay. I would return without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: QRrockin
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! From the moment I pulled into the driveway to the day I checked out was perfect. Friendly and knowledgeable staff, terrific cuisine in the restaurant and the views from my room were spectacular! The concierge lounge had appetizers, free internet, and a 360 view of South Beach and Biscayne Bay. I will definitely come back. This hotel was a perfect choice for my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Karpet28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the art week. We had 2 great rooms with a very nice view, a pleasure to wake up every morning, open the window and let the sun in your room before being inside the art fair the whole day. Every minor problem was solved within minutes. One thing that could improve is free internet in the room. In the lobby this is available. But there is a possibility to take wifi for 25$/month with an external company. There is also a special computer to check-in online and print your boarding pass. This is very convenient. Staff was always very friendly and helpful. Very comfortable beds. Thanks to the group discount also a very good price. I would definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Dannis Q
Reviews.Content: The location is the most tranquil around Miami and the hotel provided with the comfort it promises and the in-house dining is also of high level. Totally enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing, Wonderful Stay at the Marriott Biscayne Bay”
Reviews.Author: goodtoglow
Reviews.Content: My then-fiance & I stayed here for two nights October 27th & 28th, along with over 50 of our family & friends, prior to boarding a cruise ship for our wedding cruise. We were given a generous group discount and everyone had rooms with a view of the bay, on the higher floors (16th & up). From the moment we pulled up in our rental car, the hotel was outstanding. Valet parking was expected to be expensive, and it was, but as this was a special vacation we didn't mind the splurge. The bellhops unloaded our vehicle and brought all of our things to our room (and we had LOTS, including 3 huge boxes we had mailed to the hotel which contained our wedding favors!). The lobby is BEAUTIFUL! Being that we were the "leaders" of such a large group, we were upgraded to a Jr Suite - our room was 2102 and it was perfect. The view of the bay was gorgeous, our room was spacious, and served to be the perfect spot for us all to gather during our two nights there. The room only sleeps two with a king sized bed, but has a couch and plenty of room for cots. I had a chance to view some of the other rooms, which were all nice, clean, and average sized. Most of us ate at the restaurant for dinner, and some had breakfast. We all enjoyed our meals and found that surprisingly the restaurant had fair prices. The harbour view and accompanying ambiance was excellent. The staff at the hotel was amazing. Every time we needed to call the front desk (which was often when we needed to connect to others rooms) we were greeted warmly and they always congratulated us, calling us either the bride or the groom. We didn't walk around the surrounding area, but many of our friends did during the day time and we heard no complaints. Taxis to South Beach were under $15 and it was a short commute. We found it well worth the cost of the taxi to stay in a well priced, beautiful hotel like this (rather than pay more to stay on South Beach in a not-as-nice-hotel). Thank you sincerly to the staff at the Marriott - we hope management reads this and passes that on for us. We were so happy with our stay and couldn't have picked a better hotel. We would stay here hands down again, and so should you!

Reviews.Title: “Get a room over the bay”
Reviews.Author: Seat62A
Reviews.Content: This is not a 'walk to a restaurant' hotel. There is pretty much zero in the local area. The rooms are reasonable but below the normal Marriott standard, but if you get a view over Biscayne then it really doesn't matter, its a great view and its superb to wake up to. A good hotel in downtown Miami

Reviews.Title: “Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay - Impressions (2 Opportunities)”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_F_B_Monteiro
Reviews.Content: Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay - Impressions (2 Opportunities) Our experiences are based on 2 opportunities, 3 to 8 and 18 to 22 both on November-2011. The trip was a family vacation (2 adults and one 3 years old child). Before arriving at the hotel I was a bit concerned about the location, because few years ago Miami Downtown was decadent and beginning a renewal processâ€¦The renewal process is bringing a new reality to Miami Downtown, encouraging the hotels on Downtown. The hotel has a good structure and on a very good condition: nice lobby, good restaurant with reasonable breakfast (buffet), common parking is a bit expensive. The additional price for valet parking really is worth it, especially for those traveling with small children and of course a lot of baggage. I chosed valet almost everyday. The rooms: VIEW: Iâ€™ve stayed on a low floor with a terrible view on the first stay and on a high floor (25 floor), with a postcard bay view on the second stay. SIZE: Space is definitely not a problem for the rooms, we had lots of luggage and shopping bags, and it still feels comfortable. Equipments: Thereâ€™s NO refrigerator and NO microwave. The expensive Cable Internet requires the guest to go to down the comfortable lobby to use free internet wifi. Cleaning: the carpets can improve, the rest is ok The Service: For me it was what made â€œthe differenceâ€�! Usually hotelâ€™s staff (of this or higher category) are attentive to the customers needs, but Iâ€™ve on this case some positive remarks that I can not fail to mention and to congratulate: Alvaro (doorman): always ready to serve well, concerned with kidâ€™s safety, efficient, careful and agile. Clara (Catch and Grill): extremely helpful Of course there are others to tell good remarks also, but not to be unfairâ€¦. I prefer to mention these, and congratulate the manager for his staff. Conclusion: I definitely come back and recommend the Marriot Biscayne Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for the money”
Reviews.Author: Tyca41458
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff and welcoming lobby gave a great first impression of this hotel. That's where the compliments end. We tried checking in two hours after check in time (for 3 rooms) and only one room was ready. We had to wait until after 7pm for all three rooms to be ready. The elevators were so shaky we feared they would drop every time we stepped foot in them. The rooms were small and out dated. Water stains on the ceilings and the outside of the windows were extremely dirty. Would probably find another hotel if ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs urgent remodeling”
Reviews.Author: 859Kathy
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most disappointing Marriott I have ever stayed at. Rooms are very small and dated. We stayed here for one night before a cruise. For the price of this hotel you could probably find a much nicer hotel close by. There was a 15 minute wait for the breakfast buffet and we weren't even in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Biscayne Bay Beautiful Stay...”
Reviews.Author: stephen m
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night, Nov. 20th, pre-cruise. Used Marriott Reward points to book a basic room. I had originally booked us to stay at the Hotel Beaux Arts Marriott in downtown Miami, but some friends told us that the view at Biscayne Bay is much better. Explained to the manager, Ms. Ready, that my wife and I are celebrating our 15th Anniversary. We were complimentary upgraded to a corner jr. suite, room 1901 on 19th floor. PERFECT! Not too high, not too low, just right to see out into the bay, south beach area and all of the cruise ships. Quite amazing watching a heavy rain storm move over the bay towards us on Sunday afternoon. We have stayed at JW Marriott Resort properties in Palm Springs and Phoenix previously and the level of amenities and room decor is very similar. This corner suite view cannot be beat, the best view we have had in any upscale property. Food: Upon arrival we dined at the Catch Restaurant located on property. The breakfast buffet is served until 1pm, so I had that. Very good selection. Especially the chicken-apple sausage link. We called the front desk Sunday evening to get a local phone number to a Pizza Hut (chose not to use room service for pizza). Upon arrival the front desk called me to inform me that delivery persons are not allowed to go to rooms and I would have to come down and get my pizza. So, beware if you order any takeout to be delivered, DO NOT change into night clothes too soon! Bathroom: The toilet and bathtub/shower area are in a separate space that is very small compared to other Marriott properties, but then again you don't spend that much time in this space. The sink area has a single sink with large granite counter top. Dining area: Since this was a suite we had a nice dining area with a round table and 4 chairs. Surrounded by floor to ceiling glass windows. Seating area: This suite has a nice full size couch, 2 end tables, 2 chairs and a coffee table. There is a work desk provided with a nice, rolling desk chair. Internet: All rooms must be connected with the wired internet, meaning I could not sit on the bed and work on laptop. In today's time, this seems very dated. Balcony: There is no balcony in this room. You can open the sliding glass door to let the breeze in and the curtains blow in the wind, but there is only a small railing area. You cannot step out onto it. But again, with floor to ceiling windows wrapping around on 3 sides of this room who needs a balcony!!! Service: Everyone was very accommodating and attentive to customer needs. I do not have 1 negative experience to report. Area: I can't comment on the availability of night life since we were not here for that. I do know it is not within walking distance of South Beach or the Brickell area. You would need to take a cab for that. I had read previous reviews that the area seemed seedy or unsafe but we did not experience or see that. I think it is because it is a property that is between the DoubleTree on one side and a nice, beautiful old Episcopal Church on the other side, making it seem "stuffed" into the land. But once you get into your room and look at the view you will soon forget about all of that. The room did not contain a refrigerator or microwave. I was surprised to see incandescent bulbs still being used in the bedside lamps. Also, the wind blows all night and you can hear whistling through the sliding glass door. This can be annoying, so we turned the FAN part of the a/c system on HI to drown out that whistling. Hopefully management can have the weather stripping reinforced. Conclusion: We will definitely stay here again and will stay in a corner suite, upgrade or not. Go ahead and splurge and spend the extra, you will not regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one night here after returning from Key West and leaving the next morning to return home. Hotel bar was nice but a little expensive. Rooms were nice but relatively expensive compared to other properties. Short taxi ride to Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good room, perfect port view”
Reviews.Author: KCPrevatte
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 9 days in October for a business conference. CHECK-IN Originally they were going to put me on the 3rd floor, but I asked if they would bump me to a higher floor with a "nice view" since I was staying so many nights. The woman checking me in was friendly and very accommodating. I arrived at 3 PM and my room was ready. ROOM I had 1912 which had a perfect view of the cruise port so I could see the ships coming in and out. It had two queen beds, a sliding glass door. Linens were pretty standard (white duvet). Bathroom was fine (not overly impressive). Very clean. LOBBY To me, the lobby feels dated. I know they just updated it with the new Marriott "pods" (which are kind of cool, I admit) but overall I have seen a lot of nicer properties. RESTAURANT The lobby restaurant has good food but be prepared to wait. Service people are friendly but it takes a looooong time to be served. I ate quite a few meals there over my stay and it never got better. TIPPING NOTE: Miami restaurants appear to uniformly add the tip IN ADVANCE regardless of how many are in your party. I'm from DC and you don't see the tip added unless there are 6-8 or more in your party. In Miami, it appears to always be added up-front. I don't know why, but I accidentally double-tipped two or three times because I would forget and just add it without checking. We saw this at every single restaurant in South Beach, Brickell, and Miami downtown. At first I found it very annoying! LOCATION I was there for an onsite event, so that was fine. But honestly this place is a little removed from the action. It's nowhere near South Beach, it's a hike to Brickell area, the surrounding area didn't seem that walkable or exciting. There is a restaurant in walking distance called City Hall that was quite delish. HOUSEKEEPING Eh. It was fine but three days out of nine I had to call down to housekeeping (around 4ish) to make sure they were going to come change towels (etc). I had my do-not-disturb on my door in the mornings until 7ish and apparently that was late enough to take my room out of the regular rotation. Wasn't crazy about that. But I will say that the room was spotlessly clean. I was perplexed that on the first night I had three washcloths (and I use two daily for washing my face; one in the morning and one at night) and then for the rest of my stay they only supplied one washcloth per day. Odd. ROOM SERVICE Ordered it a few times. Service was prompt. Pizza was especially good. FINAL "SCORE" I felt like the hotel was a solid property that did a nice job catering to guests. Not perfect but a very good stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sitraveler_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through last minute travel. We made some requests, and all of them were granted, except for an upgrade to a bayview suite, once it was our wedding anniversary. The room given to us was nice, clean, well appointed. The king bed is excellent, very comfortable. The room is not very big, the bathroom is very small. But the lack of space is compensated by an excellent view (even though not the bay view we asked for), and also for a very nice (again narrow), balcony. Our rate included breakfast, and it was a very nice one. All sorts of food and drinks. The only problem I found is that, although the hotel is huge (many rooms), the breakfast area is small. Sometimes, you have to wait on a line to get a table, or you have to sit on a table which is far from the breakfast area, if you don't want to wait. The location is very nice, very close to downtown and the bayside market. As for the cons, for us the biggest flaw is not to offer complimentary wi-fi in the rooms. They offer it in the lobby, but nothing is better than to speak to you family through skype in the privacy of your room. Despite that, sometimes you have to fight for a space to sit in the lobby to comfortably use the wi fi connection in your device. Why not allow wi fi at the whole building? In the era we live in, it's a huge disappointment not to offer complimentary wi fi in the rooms. The parking is also extremely expensive, even for self parking. The first night we arrived, and surprise! There wasn't a single spot for us to park our car in the lot! We had to go all the way down again, talk to the person in charge for the lot, who told us to park our car in a space reserved for disabled people!! I think it is an absurd (the reserved area must be respected at all costs). The problem is that they shouldn't sell more parking spaces than they actually have to offer. But anyway, this happened only once, we warned the front desk, but let's face it, it could've been prevented. Lastly, we needed help from the concierge service for an urgent matter, but the concierge desk didn't help at all. Thank God google exists, and we found the help we needed and solved things ourselves. All in All, the hotel is very nice, and despite the few drawbacks I mentioned above, Marriott is always a reliable choice for staying.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service at Marriott convenient for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sailfishshooter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to extend a business trip to celebrate our anniversary. Our experience at Marriott Biscayne Bay exceeded our expectations. Not only did Naomi (front desk) upgrade our room to the 30th floor, but she surprised us with a bottle of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries. Our bellman spent ten minutes making sure we knew the layout of the hotel and answering our questions. When our room key didn't work at the Concierge Lounge on the 26th floor an assistant manager let us in and went down to the lobby to get replacement key cards. And, when the Concierge booked our dinner reservations she made sure they knew it was our anniversary so we were surprised with a special dessert. Every single member of the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure we had an exceptional experience. Marriott Biscayne Bay provides the most comprehensive, exceptional service I have experienced at a hotel. I recommend whether you are in Miami for business, pleasure, or travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you want to be in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: frugaltravelerDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during a recent work trip to Miami. The hotel is pretty neat with views of the bay from almost every room. Please note that this is NOT in South beach - this is the heart of the financial district. Parking is expensive - but there's a light rail/ pod station within walking distance. Breakfast was quite good, but expensive. There's an Enterprise car rental next door at the doubletree. Overall, decent choice for the business district, but if you are in Miami for fun, choose something in south beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - location is superb”
Reviews.Author: Zman73
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! The staff was extremely nice, helpful and friendly. Check in was easy and quick. The rooms were amazing with water views. The location is close to area restaurants, bars and the port of Miami. I am looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: MAamyp
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night coming from Key West and flying out of MIA the next day. Beautiful room with a view (bay room). The front desk woman was helpful in printing out our boarding passes. We had dinner downstairs and the food and service was really good. Hoping to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruising- Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MimiDiQT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and ameities* For the Elite members we had all day free snacks and drinks with a beautiful view of the ocean. Our room was facing the ocean* Gorgeous view*. The room was very clean and we had a balcony. Great breakfast delivered to the room! The downside was the recontruction of the parking lot and to check In the waiting time was unbelievable-Too much people! They should have a better way to set up in peak-travel season* The surroundings of the hotel and inside the hotel a lot of security and very safe* We stayed two nights the day before our cruise and the night after we arrived* I would stay again if I visited Miami*

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: BoneDaddyUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at he Marriott Biscayne Bay the night before embarking on a cruise (the hotel is just blocks from the Port), and received a group rate by booking through the cruise line. The room was large and comfortable, with a refrigerator included at no charge. A tiny balcony overlooking the bay was large enough for two to sit and enjoy the evening breeze, and the king-sized bed was chock full of pillows so that watching TV was comfortable in any position. A 12:00 noon checkout was late enough to allow for a room-service breakfast which is easily ordered by filling out a menu and hanging it on your door handle the night before. Our meal arrived exactly on time at 10:00 am, as we had requested and check-out was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “The welcoming staff and valet personnel 12 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: jackrabidx
Reviews.Content: Gina is the total package! She was extremely helpful and extremely warm! Promote above her peers! The valet staff were very helpful on directing lost people to the right location and very very friendly! Whenever I come back to beautiful Miami I will be coming to lay my head at the Marriott for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 5 but...”
Reviews.Author: RatherFlyThere
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, great view of the bay BUT...upon arrival, the desk receptionist was obviously not enjoying her job. The lobby area was bustling with people who were arriving for the Kiss Kruise and maybe she'd just had enough for one day. The carpet in our room had not been vacuumed--almost like the maid had dumped the vacuum bag on the floor or something. The bathtub had been resurfaced and chunks of it were flaking off...very unattractive. But the beds were very comfortable and when we asked for extra towels the staff was there within minutes. The restaurant/bar service was a bit slow but food was good.

Reviews.Title: “2 night post cruise”
Reviews.Author: rossa100
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, room with the bay view was beautiful, recieved excellent service from Jesse and lattitia at reception, Conciege was very informative and helpful. An airport shuttle would of been a nice addition but overall enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: ecas123
Reviews.Content: The weather was crappy the weekend I went but the hotel was nice that it made it up for it. Being that I used to live in Miami Beach, I knew how close this hotel is to South beach I wanted nice hotel but didn't want to pay South Beach/Miami Beach prices. This hotel is only a 10 minute drive to South Beach once you hit the causeway. There is a nice restaurant within a two minute walk, the continental breakfast is a full continental breakfast, the drinks at the bar are good and strong. Its definitely worth the stay and I will definitely be back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dee1903
Reviews.Content: This trip was intended to be a relaxing weekend in Miami, the hotel was ok,but the weather was not all good but that's miami in October! The room had an excellent view of the bay, it was a standard hotel room, the carpet was stained, old and it felt wet in some spots. The internet room which we needed to print a voucher was not working properly but we got charged by the minute for a computer which did not even work. The front desk staff allowed me to use a computer to print the voucher after I complained about the computers in the business centre not working properly. The hotel pool is located in the sixth floor and the room key is needed to access it. Our room key was not working,went downstairs to get them checked, when back to the pool area to try again, the key still did not work I tried calling the front desk and they told me they would sent a concierge to help me but he never arrived so we were not able to use the pool. Overall I don't think I would go back to this hotel as I did not like the overall service we received!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: expatsteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I weren't really knowledgeable about the Miami area, and only had a few days to visit. We rode down on a rental motorcycle and loved our time on Miami Beach. I knew we needed to find a hotel and I spent a little while looking for a good one. I called this Marriott and not only was the price great, but the staff was outstanding. I loved the room and the view, too. I would love to visit this hotel again, if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for perfect business or vocation”
Reviews.Author: Ivan T
Reviews.Content: Cozy interior and great room space in its category. Very friendly and attentive staff. Nice breakfast with a menu or a buffet option. The products are fresh and the quality is flawless. The rooms and the lobby were renovated last year. The design is dynamic, modern at the same time welcoming and ergonomic. There's a digital safe, an HD Flat screen TV-set with various interfaces such as VGA, Composite and HDMI + wireless keyboard for TV-internet browsing, High-speed Internet RJ-45 cable (for as low as $13 per day), a roomy closet with an iron and an ironing desk, several cabinets, a bedside table with an iPod docking FM-alarm clock inside each room. In the bathroom you'll find a magnificent large mirror with intense lighting that will please each lady who's keen on professional make up. I've stayed in this hotel 5 times already and I know that if i need to be sure in place to stay at in Miami there'll be only one option which is Marriott Biscayne Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and good value”
Reviews.Author: signe h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 3 children and had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your values”
Reviews.Author: Newtinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel per se is pretty much average. Breakfast is good. The rooms are a comfortable yet small. Self parking is difficult give the small numer of parking spots. WiFi did not work and there was no alternative. We decided for a room with view. Not bad but not wow. The balcony is way small. The downside is that I forgot my wallet at the safe, I was able to retrieve it but the cash was wiped out. No matter the corteous security gentleman said they would investigate I wind up with absolutely no answers.

Reviews.Title: “Hangin' with the "beautiful people"”
Reviews.Author: Genevax
