Reviews.Content: - 18th floor with a balconey overlooking part of Biscayne Bay, Normandy Isle Monument, marina and neighboring condos. - One of those hotels that charges for EVERYTHING. - Bed - medium/hard - pillows - plenty to choose from (yay!) - HD flat screen TV - auxiliary outlets for computers, dvd players, etc - $13/day for internet in room and $0.40/minute in the business center - Lotsa beautiful people - Connecting door to adjacent room is paper thin. I could hear EVERYTHING my neighbor was doing. Bring earplugs and turn up the fan - Nice airy-feeling room facing the west - No water, fridge or micro in room - Nice toiletries - Nice towels - Had to hunt for coffee maker and supplies and found in the closet After a long hot, sweaty day at work, I broke down on the last night and ordered room service. - 1/2 roasted chicken - asparagus - fried plantains - leche dulce cheesecake It was all excellent @ $45.00. I deserved it! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cariadon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay on business in mid-August. The views are not as good as those from the Hilton, but the hotel is comfortable, clean and reasonably well-equipped. The food is of high quality and the staff very helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: stephanie p
Reviews.Content: I booked this at the last minute for work and wasn't sure what to expect. The lobby is beautiful, the room had a beautiful view of the bay and a balcony and breakfast was included!

Reviews.Title: “Miami at its best”
Reviews.Author: Tallytraveler34
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Overlooks the Port of Miami, the Venetian and McArthur Causeways and is directly accross the bay from South Beach. The east and south-facing rooms are the best, most of which have balconies angled toward the Port. It's a beautiful view day or night. The restaurant has a very good lobster bisque and is fairly proced for the types of dishes served. The lobby adjoins the Doubletree next door, where there are shops, a salon, travel agent, and even a deli with hot foods, sandwiches and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “There is better”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2011 for a wedding. It's an old hotel that has been renovated in the last year or two. The lobby was nicely redone, but the rooms remain small and dark. Our bathroom was tiny, so was the closet and balcony. The pool deck was not redone and feels old. Really the nicest part of this hotel is the lobby, which was constantly busy with airline crews and cruise ship passengers. I visit Miami a lot and I only stayed here because of a wedding. In my opinion, there are many better options if you are looking for a place to stay near downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “"WE loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: J Bruce H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the feeling we received was we were at home. We were met by the staff who watched our car while we checked in and went to our room. The staff at the check in were like none I have experienced in all my years of travel. The room was great, clean and comfortable. The dinning room staff assisted us with our dinners and the breakfast and the morning staff just carried on with the exceptional staff that we had all ready met. Just an exceptional place to stay, they have added a shuttle to South Beach and a flat rate taxi service to to the airport. There is no better place to stay in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (watch parking cost)”
Reviews.Author: MarkWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Only half hour from airport, I stayed here 3 years ago when it was in the middle of a refurbisment and then it was a bit tacky. Now it is exellent. We drove straight in to the self park took a ticket and headed with bags and cases for the lobby. We were greeted by friendly hotel staff and check in was smooth, I wasn't told about car park cost or how to validate ticket etc (more on that later). The room was clean, well air conditioned and had a great view of the bay. Two queen beds for us (parents & two grown up daughters). It was a great place to do south beach, bayfront or travel up to The Dolphin Mall. Free shuttle bus to South Beach. Wi-Fi is chargeable I think $12.95 per day. Pool was good, plenty of room around the pool and upper decks. Restaurant was good ( a little expensive) but good. We recommend use of the shops, cafes and bars between this hotel and the Doubletree hotel for general, browse, coffee, breakfast, evening mojito. We were only here 3 days within our tour of South & Central Florida. Back to the car tickets. Each day when we took the car, I just popped in the ticket that the machine gives you on the way in and it charges you $18. I thought well this is cheaper than the $26 that the hotel would charge you (only good if you use the car once per day rather than multiple trips in and out of hotel). Having put my $20 in and had $2 change, foolishly I didn't get a reciept when requested.When I checked out the hotel chraged me $26 per day as well as me paying $18 per day, so $44 per day. When I said that this was not mentioned to me on check in, they said that I needed a reciept to verify that I did indeed pay myself. I can understand that but I don't see many people trying this on as a scam and would have liked the managed to take a view, but no...no receipt no refund. As a Marriott reward member it did leave me a little disappointed and put a blemish on an otherwise fantastic stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Normally not a fan of big chain hotels but this one had nice style”
Reviews.Author: NYCSPOON
Reviews.Content: Best Marriot I've ever stayed. Wonderful views of the bay. Great service. Wasn't crazy about location as I did not have a car and walked to Miami Beach which turns out to be a pretty good hike from this hotel. But with a car (as most sensible people seem to have in Miami) think it's a great place. The bartenders make awesome mojitos. Overall, a really nice place, fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Marriott, great price”
Reviews.Author: TinQC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. I took a chance because it was newly renovated and the price was right. I would definitely stay again. More details below: Pros: location/value -- much cheaper than South Beach, but right across the bridge so you have easy access (5 min drive) Very clean rooms that appear to have been newly renovated with contemporary decor Accommodating staff and Great valet service - we were there on a busy weekend but there wasn't a wait. I also switched up our room preferences right after checking in and they accommodated the change with no issues. Nice view of the bay. Cons: Not much within walking distance, parking is pricey, you're not right on the beach

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing find, especially at the rates they offer. I stayed there at 119 per night midweek. Because I am platinum with Marriott, I was upgraded to the concierge floor - 31. The views were stunning and the room was very nice. Probably one of the only hotels left that let's you go out onto the room's balcony which, at 31 stories up is pretty exciting in and of itself. The hotel is 10 minutes from downtown and 10 minutes from Miami beach, so definitely no lack of things to do. Parking is pretty expensive - 26 per day for self parking. All considered, I will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike1237
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the buffet that was served at breakfast (although it is almost 50$ for two people). Only thing is that they should offer More frequent shuttle service to and from south beach. Nice hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great and super helpful staff. LOVED IT AND WILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjm021772
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!!!! We always stay in Marriotts, but this was a total treat! The lobby was beautiful and the hotel staff very helpful. From the front office to the managers in the lobby greating arriving guests - everyone was super pleasant and always with a smile on their face. We are definietely coming back soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Rooms were super comfortable and the beds...........I have never slept this good!!! Loved the view and the size was just perfect for our family. Thank you for making our stay such a pleasure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great food and customer services”
Reviews.Author: olimpia v
Reviews.Content: I had a great dinner with my husband. The food was delicious!!! Our server gave us an excelent service!!! I can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: caligirl3
Reviews.Content: I would probably rate this Marriott with a 3.5 stars, but I didn't want to put only three, because they were a bit above average.. Overall this is a nice hotel with mostly friendly staff. However in my opinion, this hotel would be great (esp for travelers that want to experience south beach but they don't need to live on south beach) if: the hotel offered a shuttle that went to and from south beach at least every 2-4 hours a day.. I only stayed at this hotel because they offered a free shuttle to south beach daily (nice idea!).. But I think it would bring them excellent reviews and referrals for south beach visitors if they'd run a more regular shuttle schedule (they only offer the shuttle 4 times a day).. The ride over is only 10min or less (literally right over a little bridge).. When my boyfriend and I missed the shuttle we caught a cab for about $17 or took a bus for $2 (the bus is across the street and up a block from the hotel and its a 10 minute ride).. Other than a more frequent shuttle to SB, I only had one other real complaint about this hotel.. Our room was very large and pretty nice they even put us in a room with a nice view of the bay at no extra charge (thank you!).. But I'm very anal about cleanliness, and the bathroom had several random hairs on the floor and there were a few small stains on our sheets.. I asked the housecleaning to take care of these issues only to find, the job still hadn't been done thoroughly.. This is something that I've never had a problem with before at a Marriott.. So it was a bit disappointing.. But the restaurant has good food, too expensive but tasty, and there are a few other eateries right next door.. If they work on the thoroughness of the housecleaning; I think this hotel would be great instead of just good!

Reviews.Title: “Too big a business to make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Passaro_azul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel only because it had daily transfers to the Tennis Tournament that was happening in Miami at the time. I normally don't stay at big hotels because I prefer a more personal treatment. I made reservations through the agency responsible for selling the tickets for the tournament and specifically asked for a big room to accomodate a rollaway bed for my 15-year old tall son. Arriving there, tired, they gave me a small corner room (I was staying for 1 week!). Upon my complaint, they offered me another room to which we went carrying our own luggage (after having carried them down from the original room!!) because there was no bellboy available! (in a 500-room hotel!!!). We loved the new bigger room, only to discover that they had made another mistake and the room was already designated to another couple! After wandering about carrying 4 pieces of luggage and a jet lag, we decided to go back to our original room and stay there to avoid further problems, since they told us the hotel was fully booked. Already suffering with a headache, we decided to eat something but the only restaurant available at the hotel offered only fancy seafood and that was not what we were looking for! We wanted something simpler like pasta and salad but there was none. To our surprise, the room service offered the same food as the restaurant! Finally, the recepcionist suggested we went to a small italian restaurant situated in a gallery just outside the hotel. We started making our meals there. After the fisrt full day out, we arrived in our room and it had not been made! We had to call and ask for new towels and toilet paper. Shame, Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Miami's best kept secret. Shhhh”
Reviews.Author: Jm78837
Reviews.Content: Shhh. This is too good to keep a secret. Great room rate, nice rooms with awesome views of biscayne bay. The hotel has a illy coffee shop, a restaurant and bar with daily happy hour and a free shuttle to sobe! The night we were there they had live music on the terrace of Catch the hotel restaurant. It was a nice to have quality live music and price friendly drinks and snacks. It was a great way to start our trip

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florencia L
Reviews.Content: It was my second time at the Marriott Biscayne Bay Hotel. First time after the renovation ...WOW...the hotel looks beautiful and the customer service awesome. I love that they add a coffee boutique located at the lobby level. The coffee was delicious and more to say about the staff. Every morning my husband and I had a fresh coffee and the attendants received us with a BIG smile!!! We are ready to come back in December!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Goksun E
Reviews.Content: I am a local in miami. I had dinner at Catch restaurant. The food was amazing and the staff was really friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant. The Miami spice menu is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “All New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott P
Reviews.Content: I just revisited this hotel with my wife and children. It is totally new since my last visit. The lobby is modern and I love Illy coffee. Believe it or not in downtown Miami you can eat outside on the bay. The just opened restaurant "Catch" has someone special in the back. The food was outstanding and the service was spot on. I happened to see a rainbow and a manatee from the concierge lounge. No joke.... top 3 views in all of my travels from up there. The staff was helpful and engaging, even when my kids were melting down. I will definatly be back, but maybe with just my wife.... those views, and a nice bottle of wine?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beachblonde75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really pretty inside and the rooms and bathrooms ate spacious. We ordered roo service breakfast and it was pretty good and it came quickly. Breakfast in the hotel was good but the service lacked. It didn't seem to be able to handle a crowd so we ate at the bar which was not wise since we had to ask for silverware and drinks which took forever. The outside pool is nice, kind of blah and quiet. Cpuld use a little renovation anc there is a bar outside that serves fun drinks The location to south beach was great and they always had taxis waiting out front. I would stay here again. Check out tooooook fooooorrrreeeevvveeerrr. Thank goodness I didn't have a slew of kids with me bc I would have lost it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smarar
Reviews.Content: Loved how the hotel and the view we had was of Miami south beach, and the bay. It was a quick ride to south beach. The pool was a decent size and the amenities were first class. Loved our stay here. The stay went out of their way to make us feel very welcomed and helped us book all our tours.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pre cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaJurgensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before sailing on the Carnival LIberty. We requested a room with a view of the port and we sure got one. NEVER had a hotel in Miami with such a beautiful view! We were on the 25th floor. The "balcony" that our room was supposed to have though was more like a sliding door with about an 8" ledge and rail. Never seen a balcony like that before! Pulling up the hotel was impressive. It is nice because you can get in/out of your cab or whatever under cover and there is a man to take your luggage and a door man. All in all the stay was excellent and we will return. One thing I liked, if you ordered room service or at one point I needed extra towels, about 20 minutes after delivery someone calls just to verify you got what you wanted. The hotel is very near the port and also to the Bayside shopping center. We took a cab there for dinner for around $10. The hotel was clean and the staff excellent but my only complaints are that the coffee shop closes early - around 6:00 or 7:00 p.m. and I thought that was strange. I would have liked to have had a pre-bed cappuccino, but we had to have a latte from room service instead. (they don't have cappuccino for room service.) Too, the beds in our room were very uncomfortable! Lumpy and worn. The sheets were somewhat worn too and the non-feather pillows that I requested were really flat! The reason I will return to this hotel was because of the service and the amazing port view!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience! One to be repeated”
Reviews.Author: Porsche08
Reviews.Content: So I had to go for an interview in Miami and wanted to find a hotel which overlook the bay and this was just ideal for me. Spent three days there and I must say have one of the most professional Front office staff I have seen in a long time. Very efficient!, The room was excellent, clean and neatly arranged, the bed was so plush I did not want to get out, and the service of the room staff was also excellent , The only thing I did not like was the location of my balcony as I did not have a full view of the bay, but hey that is not their fault, I am thankful for the balcony. The morning staff of the restaurant could be improve. Apparent they had crew from the ship staying there and, the staff seem not to interested in offering the complimentary coffee or juice. They kept them waiting while they converse with other employees, Transport right outside and not to far from the shopping area.. The pool was an excellent relaxant. A great experience all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pteam2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after a one night stay in Ft. Lauderdale. This location was better and in close proximity to several venues. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the contact that we had with the staff was good. There is no free parking in the area, so prepare to pay to park. There are a couple of resturants connected to the hotel. Overall, good stay, would stay here again. Request a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, honest service”
Reviews.Author: MarceloSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good rates, premises are OK but the location - very close to McArthur causeway - and room views to the bay and port are excellent. Very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel033
Reviews.Content: You will want to know that parking in the garage is extra. The double bed room was comfortable and clean, but the balcony is very tiny. Although two chairs and a small table are on the balcony, they barely fit into the small space. No kitchen/kitchenette, microwave, or refrigerator was in the room The fitness center is awesome--best I've seen in a hotel. Kids under twelve were in the fitness center playing on the equipment. Hotel may want incorporate activities for the kids. The pool and courtyard are nice but in need of minor repairs. The location was good and the activities for the July 4, 2011 were appropriate for family members. Our family of four stayed for July 4, 2011 and the hotel itself was nice. During check-in, we encountered a rude front desk clerk named Gina and initially attributed the behavior to her having a bad day. She was curt and unhelpful from beginning of our check-in up until the end. However our second encounter with the same clerk was even worse than the first. We reserved through the Marriott's main reservation number for our second stay, before leaving Florida and this was one week later. We were told the room type was unavailable. It was clear this clerk did not belong in a front desk position. She was very abrupt when we made inquiries abt the reservation and the room's availability, to the point we were unable to complete the sentence. We specifically requested to see the hotel manager, and the clerk called the front desk manager. While she was apologetic for her staff members behavior, the room was still not ready for check-in. We later decided to cancel before the deadline mentioned by the Marriott reservation desk and stay elsewhere due to the confusion with the clerk, check-in and just bad customer service. Upon review of our bank statement, we found the hotel charged us for the stay. We contacted Marriott and the charge was promptly reversed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near the port and South Beach.”
Reviews.Author: usbrowns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip and would definitely come back. I wish I had planned to stay over the weekend with my wife. The room was very nice and the view spectacular. The hotel is also near many Miami attractions.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel. Best we've stayed in Miami yet.”
Reviews.Author: MamaParrotHead
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, especially for cruisers (request a room with a harbor view on a higher floor). Based on my request we were on the very top floor facing the harbor. Amazing view both day and night, we even saw a manatee swimming in the small harbor below (from the 29th floor). Hotel staff were friendly, hotel was clean, room was very comfortable, clean and large. Would love to stay here again and HIGHLY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraClezy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed on the 4th of july 2011. The meal and entertainment was excellent and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “this is why im a rewards member”
Reviews.Author: rao1
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed here on july 16.2011.the property is beautiful and the front desk was very helpful.room service was bending over backwards to accomendate our every need.balcony with full bayview made it extra special and plenty of shops including liquer store and deli right on the property.would diffenatly stay again.oh yes and paid $170.00 for the room,received a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful view I have ever seen....”
Reviews.Author: KarenC03
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to Miami...We were given a suite on the 23rd floor and all I was expecting was a regular King Room....and that was all I had paid for..when we were taken to this room and the door was opened we were all in awe....it was the most beautiful room with the most beautiful view I have even seen...it was a corner suite overlooking the Bay...we just wanted a room close to the Port as we were taking a cruise the next day...as excited as I was about taking my first cruise I did not even want to leave this room...the view was so magnificent we slept with all the curtains wide open......the service was great...all the staff was amazing and friendly..the food in the restaurant was great....the pool was beautiful...everything was just so convenient...the only reason I chose this hotel was because our son in law was getting a free pre-cruise room here with his Marriott rewards...I was really not familiar with Marriott hotels...I am a huge fan of theirs now....and the bed....oh sooooo comfortable...we have stayed at a couple of more hotels in the Marriott chain since this trip and although they were not as luxurious as our Miami stay they were extremely comfortable as well....Thank you Marriott for a vacation memory that my family will treasure forever...I just cannot say enough good things, and the pictures we took were beautiful but do not even do justice to the beauty of everything....

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel... Location not Good”
Reviews.Author: sdf1kks
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby... Bellman very good. Stayed here for business trip in May 2011. Stayed 4 days and as usual room key quit working after two days. Facilities were nice pool bar okay bartender was good. Rooms were average with nice amenities. Bed was very comfortable. I will say that the balcony on the 21st floor was very small as they all were but the railing shook slightly and was a little unsafe imo... Internet was extremely difficult to get on and was overpriced. The hotel was landlocked between major roads and it was difficyult to walk anywhere. I did like the marina directly behind the hotel as you could walk right out. Overall an okay place, not on a beach in Miami but for price I paid that is okay...

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice, but...get the guarantee.”
Reviews.Author: 1serendipity
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and arrived at 10 p.m. only to find that they had given our rooms away. I phoned earlier in the day to say that we would be arriving late. They said no problem. I had requested adjointing rooms, because we were traveling with children. They told me that my request was not guaranteed and next time ask for the room guarantee. Duh? They could only accommodate us on the same floor. My kids ended up being 8 rooms away down the hall and I found myself running up and down the hall to accommodate my kids. My husband and I were put right next to the gym. All morning and evening we could hear the treadmill going. How nice was that. Rooms were nice, but the room locations did not work out for me. Also, be aware of the $26.00 a day parking and $12.00 a day for internet use rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Absolutely loved it! We will be back next month!”
Reviews.Author: Lawlady1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott pre- and post- cruise on June 30th and July 4th. There were 26 of us in total. Everyone loved this hotel! The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We requested and received early check-in. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bay view is a must! The older people in our group were able to watch the fireworks from the balcony. The free wi-fi in the lobby is a bonus! The lobby is beautiful and we were able to enjoy Starbucks while enjoying a booth in the chic lobby. The location is perfect! We were minutes from both South Beach and Bayside! The staff was friendly and the bell men were very helpful and courteous. Although check-out was at noon, the hotel held our luggage in a hospitality room while we went to Bayside and awaited our shuttle to the airport. We were treated like five-star clients in a five-star hotel. We loved it. I am actually going back next month with a few friends and we are staying at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: nessz79
Reviews.Content: We had a great AAA rate on this hotel and it was totally worth it. We drove over a day before our cruise so that we wouldn't have to fight Miami Monday morning traffic (I get frenzied just thinking about it). Pros: AAA rate with breakfast was a great deal for a hotel like this. The breakfast was very good and fresh. Waffles, omelets, sausage, scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, along with continental type affair. Our room was very nice. I believe all rooms include a balcony. Our room was large with plenty of space for the 4 of us. Even though we were paying a discounted rate, we still had a partial view of the bay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very close to Bayside for shopping and eating. Very close to the port. There's a great place to get cheaper food in between this hotel and the DoubleTree. Free Wi-Fi, but only in certain areas of the lobby. Cons: Self-parking seemed a pain so we went with Valet. We would rather have done our own parking in hindsight as Valet is rather expensive. Food at the Marriott is expensive. My husband's parents room was small and oddly shaped. Since it was just the 2 of them in that room, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in the MIA”
Reviews.Author: Bfs84
Reviews.Content: We had the best room in 601. It was a corner room with an awesome view. Don't eat at the hotel it's way too expensive and the parking is also very expensive. Overall we got an awesome deal on priceline. Don't expect a microwave or fridge unless you get a suite. Next time we'll probably stay in downtown hollywood. Parking is more affordable and the beach is very laid back. I'll recommend it if you don't mind shelling out the dough.

Reviews.Title: “Room was good, customer service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: roxbren
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the 4th of July weekend. The room was good, you could tell that it had been updated. It was clean and a very good size. I would have rated higher, but the customer service was lacking. To be fair, it did seem like there were many employees who were trying their best to do a good job. There were a few though that seemed to be either overwhelmed or not really interested. Here's my story: Got to the hotel and hour before check-in. My room wasn't available yet, no big deal. The front desk girl asked if I wanted to be put on a list to get a call when my room was ready. I said yes and then mentioned that I'd hang out at the hotel cafe until the room was ready. She advised against this and stated that it could be a few hours before my room was ready. Really?? So, I left my bag at the hotel and went to walk around the city for awhile. I headed back to the hotel at 5:30 after never getting a call that my room was ready, thankfully it was (I was awake since 3:30am and had an early morning photo shoot scheduled for the next day). I ended up getting the same front desk person. She checked me in, gave me my keys and then just looked at me. I noticed that she was at least explaining where the hotel pool and elevators were to the other people, but not to me. It's not really easy to find the elevators or pool if you've never been to that hotel. She was probably just overwhelmed or something, but she wasn't very cordial. After that, I had to wait 15 minutes to get my bag. The issue was that the bellhop couldn't find my bag, but before he admitted that, he said, "We'll bring it up to your room." Glad I refused that and stayed in the lobby, otherwise it would have been even more of a hassle to get it. I had to go in to the luggage room and point out which one it was, even though there was a claim ticket on it. At check out, I tried to use the TV check out system, but could not find that option on the menu screen, so I was forced to check out at the front desk. Big mistake. It took a very long time and many of the other guests seemed to be annoyed. It seemed like there were some operational issues that prevented the staff from doing a good job (and there were some staff that seemed not to care too much, for example the girl who checked me in). The other things that would have been nice: a light blanket in addition to the sheet and heavy comforter, quieter air conditioning, free use of internet in the business center. So, the rooms are good, and seems to be a good location if you're going on a cruise. Since this hotel has gotten good reviews about customer service, my experience may be out of the norm. But I still wouldn't go back and probably would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Note to hotel staff who may read this: You'll see that I don't often give out bad reviews on this site, so I'm not just complaining to be annoying. And I am a very nice person and believe in giving respect to people, especially people who are helping me out. So this review was not written lightly. I mean every word of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetrnc
Reviews.Content: My daughter attends college at JWU so I visit Miami often. This time I opted to stay at this great hotel because the price was reasonable for peak season. I traveled in March for my spring break since it is when I can get away from my teaching duties at the college. I was very pleased with the hotel. The pool area is small but nice and clean. There is an area if you want some quiet time away from the pool. I would spend my morning there basking in the hot March sun. It is convenient for me since I do not drive. The Omni was right up the block so was the bus depot. I spent a week at this hotel and had a great time. The area was fine and well lit. I would come back late after spending day out or at bayside in the evenings. The place was renovated and it has a very fresh clean look to it. I had some minor issues with items I requested prior to arrival and that was settled. The breakfast buffet was good. I have paid more in other hotels for a buffet breakfast. The only minor detail was the service. Once you tell the waitress or waiter you are having buffet, they serve you coffee and you don't see them again. My child is a culinary major and these are the little things that can ruin a good place. The dining room staff has to be more attentive whether it is ala carte or buffet dining. The young man at the omelet station needed to smile instead of looking like he hates his job. I enjoyed the quiet time in the many cubicles in the lobby area. I would set up my laptop to do work or just sit among the cozy benches to read a book. I had a great view of the bay despite the mini balcony. I am visiting Miami in the next couple of weeks and am disappointed that the week I want to stay there is no availability. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel, we will never return.”
Reviews.Author: Graham-456789
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to our room with the bellman, there were huge wet spots on the beds and the chair/ottoman in the room. He called the maid service and they came to the room. Of course they did not speak English. He translated to us that the maid had sprayed room freshener and that's what the spots were. It looked more like they poured room freshener on the beds. Anyway, we were given a 'new' comforter for the one that looked the wettest. Then when we went into the bathroom... the toilet had hairs on the rim... there were no towels or washrags...the floor was filthy. I don't think the room had been cleaned in days. DISGUSTING. I called the front desk and they sent someone to clean the room, finally. We would not stay at this hotel again if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “we like it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Elaine46403
Reviews.Content: This Hotel the room was nice and comfortable and the workers were friendly

Reviews.Title: “What a great staff and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pdominie
Reviews.Content: Let's start with how we got to the Biscayne Bay site. Our group of (6) booked at another hotel on south beach, what a joke. After three bad days, and no cleaning of our rooms we left what was supposed to be relaxing paradise and when to paradise. The rooms where clean and up to date. The lobby(wow) and the extras blew our minds. Now we should talk about the best part, the staff. Naomi Augustin took time to help, play and truly show interest in our children. She also guided us to places of great fun! Jose Perez was so helpful and kind. The reason why the staff is the way they are starts with management, Angie Madura. She also took time to help us with having a wonderful stay. We can't wait to return. I travel a lot and stay at Marriott's almost exclusively and this was the best overall experience ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWABeachFamily
Reviews.Content: After spending a week in the Florida Keys, spent a night in Miami at the Marriott. Was very excited about the hotel as the location was excellent. The front desk was exceptional and the bellman who delivered our luggage was probably the best I've ever encountered after 20 years of traveling. Recommended a great restaurant and gave us some good shopping tips. The hotel is very clean but you can tell it is old and needs some renovation. Our room overlooked an apartment complex and parking lot with a slight view of the bay. The price was a little high due to the location and the fact it is in Miami. About a 10 minute drive to South Beach which was fun. Biggest drawback was there was a party on the 10th floor in which we stayed not more than a couple rooms down from us. After midnight, it was extremely loud and you could here music, people partying, and a lot of noise in the hallway.. Security came to their room 3 times before it actually calmed down around 3:30am. An exceptional part of the hotel stay was the valet service. Our car was always ready within 5 minutes of calling the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: slpond
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. If you want to be downtown, this is the hotel for you. Close to Bayside, the AA Arena and the Bay. Great views. Rooms - Very nice Marriott rooms, Flat screen tvs, many with balcony views of the city or bay. Double rooms tend to be bigger. Concierge was nice for appetizers and breakfast, fabulous view!! Housekeeping did a very good job. Room carpet is wearing down. Parking is $26, self parking fills quickly. Hotel connects to Doubletree via a small retail area, with a few shops, pharmacy and restaurants. Would definitely stay there again for its convenience on business. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkb5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise. It's a very nice hotel--clean room, clean public areas. It's in a pretty good location--a cheap taxi ride to the Port of Miami (about $10), a manageable walk to downtown. After walking downtown in the heat, we decided to take the Metromover, the free monorail system, back to the hotel. The station was only a block or so away, very convenient. A few complaints: One, our room wasn't ready when we arrived. The desk person took our cell number and said she'd call when it was ready. After getting a bite to eat and sitting in the lobby for an hour and 20 minutes and getting no call, I finally walked up to the desk and asked the clerk (a different one) if our room was ready. She said it wasn't, but would another room be OK? Why didn't the first clerk offer that and save us the waiting? Also, breakfast (which was included in our room rate, fortunately) was $44 for two of us. It was very good, and the orange juice was the best I've ever had, but not worth that much money. The room was very nice and comfortable. I read reviews about the noise coming through the balcony doors, and it's true. They are not very soundproof. But overall we enjoyed the room.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay saved our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: sobegirl611
Reviews.Content: What started out as a horrible honeymoon beginning in St. Thomas, ended with 3 glorious days at Miami Marriott. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Upon hearing our plight, we were given a wonderful room, champagne and strawberries, and other ammenities. Everyone was pleasant, smiling, all seemed to enjoy working there. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmsuckow
Reviews.Content: we traveled to miami for a long weekend and stayed at the marriott biscayne bay for 3 nights. when we first walked in the staff was very nice and friendly. we were one the 31th floor and had an amazing view of the bay. it was awesome to wake up every morining and see all the cruise ships that came in overnight. then watch them leave again in the afternoon. we ate at the their restraunt which was also very good. they have an excellent out side seating area with couches and chairs not just high bar tables that was perfect for cocktails in the evening. over all great experiance there very nice place great food and good people

Reviews.Title: “A good option well located in Miami, but watch for parking rate and breakfast cost”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay hotel with my wife for 3 nights in June as part of a longer vacation trip, returning from Hawaii to Brazil. I chose this hotel because it is well located (near Miami Beach, in a nice area), it is a Marriott brand and because the rate could be considered good. The service at the check-in is good, personnel is well-prepared and speak good English (something not so easy to get at the Miami area). The room I got was at the end of a corridor, in a corner of the hotel. So the room was not completely rectangular, and even though there was a lot of area, space was not so well utilized. However there were some large floor-to-ceiling windows with a partial view to the bay. However there are other buildings nearby, so curtains where closed most of the time for privacy. There was also a small balcony. TV was modern with lot's of channels. I had a negative surprise in discovering that there was no wifi at the rooms. The only internet available is with a cable, and it was paid. There is however free wifi at the hotel lobby, so you will find lot's of people with their equipment there. You can tell the room was recently renewed. The bathroom was really small, no space for 2 people at all in there. Shower in a tub, and a very low ceiling, as it is common in older facilities. Miami is a place hot and with humidity, so the hotel did a nice job trying to maintain the room without the feeling of humidity and its smells. However room carpet seemed like it needed to be washed, with some stains. You will find it hard to place in the room 2 large pieces of luggage (in my case there were more...). Parking is very expensive, even with self parking. Breakfast was not included in my rate and also very expensive. There is a coffee shop at the lobby where you will find an excellent espresso. But they don't sell sandwiches until 10.30, probably not to compete with the hotels breakfast. So overall, a better staff than you would find in other hotels in Miami area, a good location. But no wifi at the rooms (!!!) and some extra charges that can impact your budget in 30 or 40% of your rate (breakfast+parking).

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and High Prices”
Reviews.Author: Eric34328
Reviews.Content: This motel has great rooms and the amenities are many, however expect to pay a high price here for parking, food and internet access. The city view is wonderful especially at night. The front desk was more than willing the work with me and make sure you get the view/room that you like.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view of the port.”
Reviews.Author: dogtori
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay the night prior to leaving on a cruise. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. One wall was totally glass and looked out over the harbor and Port of Miami. The view was beautiful and the next morning we could see our ship waiting for us to board! Cabs were always out front and the people mover was in the next block. We ate at the breakfast buffet in the restaurant and were seated outside right on the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaFamily
Reviews.Content: good location and place. great value of money and room was on 25th floor with balcony facing south beach. room wasn't very spacious but clean and comfortable. only thing to keep in mind if yo book through third party make sure hotel don;t charge you twice that what to me, duplicate charge. overall great hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. The hotel has been completely updated. The rooms all have LCD TVs, new furniture, etc. My room had a balcony overlooking the bay, which was a nice surprise. However, my room was actually right next to the elevator bay. VERY noisy. If you are a light sleeper, you might want to request a room far away from the elevator. Again, this is an older hotel that has been redone. As such, the bathroom is a little small, with the vanity outside the toilet area. Overall, an above average marriott, especailly for the price in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Not just a new lobby !”
Reviews.Author: Allan8282526
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the newly renovated Biscayne Bay Marriott. I have stayed several times over the past decade and have always enjoyed the experience. Why am I writing a review about the hotel for the first time? The staff made a huge impact on me. I was greeted by everyone and they seemed really sincere. I know "it's their job", but there is a new life to the hotel. The staff were incredibly attentive and helpful. It was an awesome time from getting out of my car at the valet to a brief conversation with a maintenance guy. Great job to the team at the Biscayne Bay Marriott !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, well appointed rooms, but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Silkypaste
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel on the Friday of Easter weekend 2011. We had a garden view room on the fifth floor, which is ideal for children because they can access the pool directly from the patio door to the room. Everything was lovely except that the patio doors are old and heavy and make a lot of noise when opened in neighbouring rooms, which woke me up during the night. Everything else is fully renovated. I would add that the pool, despite hotel description, is not heated (the water was quite chilly actually). We had room service on our terrace for breakfast which was lovely but pricey. The lady who served us forgot to give us plates and enough jam, but all else was great. We also had a peek at the fitness room which was on our floor and it is lovely, overlooking the marina and bay. Only comment is that there is a hedge that completely blocks the view from the end of the terrace onto the bay. Why plant a hedge there???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruiser78_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise and was very pleased with the room and service. I would recommend this hotel to friends! I'm never disappointed with Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A few upgrades would rate it excellent...”
Reviews.Author: TheAccidentalTripper
Reviews.Content: Marriott Biscayne Bay is a good hotel, at good location. Althought you donÂ´t have many atractions in walking distance (except for AA Arena and theater hall, but you donÂ´t go to basketball games and opera evry day...), its access to go (by car) anywhere im Miami is very convenient. Rooms are very good, but bathrooms need some improvement. I didnÂ´t have breakfast included, but you can find good (and cheaper) breakfast right beside the hotel. Valet parking for $30 a day is not the "deal of the week", but itÂ´s ok comparing to Miami prices and offers a valuable service.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Start to a Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBlanks41611
Reviews.Content: We were married 4/16/2011 in Dayton, OH and traveled to Miami/South Beach for our honeymoon. The staff at this hotel (namely Naomi Augustin) created such a memorable experience for us, that we will remember this location as part of our honeymoon forever. Our original room wasn't "honeymoonish" enough for us. The front desk got it cleared for us to be upgraded through our Marriott Member status to a Junior Level Suite with an amazing view! We were then surprised with a complimentary romance tray later that night. The entire staff was cordial, welcoming, and attentive to excellent service. We weren't provided with just a hotel stay--we were provided with an AMAZING and MEMORABLE experience that we will never forget. We hope to celebrate yearly anniversaries at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Miami and pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: Tessa2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise. The location was just great. Just a short cab ride to great shopping and to the beaches. The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, and staff friendly and helpful. We had a gorgeous view out of our window over the Venetian causeway and over to South Beach. The room had sliding doors you could open with a tiny balcony and it was wonderful to have the ocean breeze and fun to watch the ships. We could look directly out at all the huge cruise ships in port. You can take their shuttle over to the cruise ships if you want, but we just took a cab and it was only 7 or 8 dollars and seemed more convenient then waiting in the long line for the shuttle. The breakfast buffet was well done. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel as a great place to base your explorations of Miami or for a stop over before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keke0207
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel and great location. I would stay at this hotel for both work and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Advised not to walk after sunset though”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel prior to a cruise with my family of four. We picked this hotel several months in advance and verbally confirmed a king + pullout. On arrival, we were assigned a king + rollaway which simply wasn't going to work for four of us. The front desk staff was very nice about it, and was able to upgrade us to a suite. The room was large and bright, and overlooked the cruise ship port which was fun for us to watch the ships come and go as the excitement built up for our own vacation. The outdoor pool area was nice, with lots of room to hang out in the sun or enjoy the pool. The poolside bar looked like the place where'd I'd likely spend my free time, but we didn't have much free time to be honest. When we asked where to go for dinner, the concierge advised us not to walk in the area at night which was a bit disconcerting. They instead recommended a cab to a nearby tourist area. I have to say that of the four or so cabs we had in Miami, they all convinced us that Miami cab drivers are probably the most aloof and rude that we've experienced. The next morning we discovered a small mall attached to the hotel with a few restaurants and shops that are a much more cost-effective option for a leisure trip. Be sure to check it out if you're looking for easy dinner or breakfast ideas, the hotel restaurants are incredibly overpriced. There is free wireless in the lobby, which we used to book a rental car via our iPad. The business center was challenging to use, as the locked-down computer systems weren't able to properly access our baggage tags to print from carnival.com. However the front desk helped us out by photocopying the tags for us. Overall we liked the Marriott and would likely stay there again, issues with the local area aside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: mandilynn317
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed here pre-cruise. The room was big enough and comfy for a one night stay. This hotel was a $15 taxi to the port (not bad for 5 people). I requested a high floor, extra pillow, extra towels and a cot. We didn't have extra towels and they were promptly brought to our room. Our room was on the 22nd floor, with a balcony and overlooked the Bay. In the morning we were able to see our cruise ship in the port. The hotel has been recently renovated and is beautiful. We walked down to the Bayside shopping and restraunt area for dinner for the evening, which was abut a 15-20 minute walk. This was a fun area with lots of shops and restraunts. We took advantage of the fittness area in the morning which was very nice and had plently of equiptment in it. Great one night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: johnstonsm
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as part of a birthday surprise for my birthday. I was a bit worried about some of the reviews here, but this hotel was a really great choice. The hotel, having undergone a renovation, is tastefully decorated and inviting. The room held two major highlights--the balcony and the wonderful views of the bay and the American Airlines Arena (which was part of the surprise). The staff at this hotel is really great! I'd arranged via the Marriott Concierge Service for sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries to be delivered to the room. It was nice to see the smile on the boyfriend's face when it was delivered and opened for us. I had also arranged for a Miami Bakery to deliver birthday cupcakes to the hotel. The bakery did so and the hotel held them until we arrived several hours later. The cupcakes were still fresh and were still yummy. All of the staff went above and beyond. I appreciated their help and kind attitudes. The rooms themselves have very comfortable king size beds, a large TV, and (again) beautiful views of the bay and downtown. The pool was a nice size though we didn't get to use it. The fitness room was nicely appointed and had the major staples one would find in the gym--mats, weights, tread, stepbikes, etc.. There is a restauarant and food on site though we didn't sample. The prices were reasonable to me. The boyfriend wanted a bit more variety. We were in close promixity to everything we needed including the American Airlines Arena. We took a cab to the Heat game (only because we were running a bit late) and it cost us a bit over $3. We walked back and didn't feel worried or uncomfortable at all. And the game was great!! Parking is not inexpensive. It's cheaper to self-park and we were lucky enough to get a spot right at the entrance. Overall, a great stay and a wonderful location. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for Me”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Miami on business, with meetings in both Coral Gables and South Beach. The location worked for us, and everything went smoothly with this hotel. My understanding is that it is a relatively recently renovated property. The rooms were comfortable, and the furnishings were standard for a Marriott. Reception was excellent. The staff were friendly, and efficient. Some of the rooms have nice views of the water. The fitness center has an odd layout and is a bit cramped. It can get crowded. The hotel/lobby bar is basic, nothing to write home about. Overall, a fine place to stay if you want good service and Marriott level comfort. There are nearby attractions, but the location is equally good if you need to be centrally located for getting to various parts of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable business stay. Beautiful views and great location”
Reviews.Author: sjf1972
Reviews.Content: I have been a Marriott Platinum member for 5 years and travel often to Miami. I have no idea how I could have missed such a jewel of a hotel. The views were breathtaking. When I am traveling for business, I prefer self-park, because I am frequently in and out of the hotel. Very few hotels in downtown offer self-park. This was an immediate plus when I arrived and saw the convenient parking. The front desk attendant was wonderful. I wish I could remember her name so I could give her props. She upgraded me to a beautiful panoramic room with amazing views of Biscayne Bay. The renovated rooms were clean and contemporary. The fitness center was also great. There is nothing like watching the sun rise over the bay while getting in your morning work-out. The conceirge staff was wonderful as well. My only complaint was with the hotel restaurant. "Catch". I am realy hoping that eventually get there act together, because the decour and vibe are great. The service was terrible and the food and wine were very disappointing. I am going to stay at the hotel again next month. I will probably give the restaurant one more chance to redeem themselves, everyone has a bad night. Perhaps they just have some kinks to work out. The waitress was sweet, but she was probably one of the worst servers I have ever had, so disorganized! There are also a few restaurants in the Gallery that were good and extremely convenient after a long day of work. The hotel was very busy for the Miami boat show, but it never became noisy. Very "boutique like " quality.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good except the bathroom (go figure)”
Reviews.Author: MarkPi
Reviews.Content: The view of the bay is awesome. Service was good. Not much around the hotel except a walk the bay which is not bad. Big flat screen TV but NO WIRELESS Internet.. The bathroom was a bit weak. The shower head was on SUPER SAVER water so I washed in a fine mist. No exhaust fan so steam was instant. The weird thing is that the builders removed a small tile in the shower and used that for your soap holder and that is all it holds. It does not hold the small shampoo, razor or shaving cream.

Reviews.Title: “The best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: BellinghamThane
Reviews.Content: with This is not my typical stay, I would usually pick a smaller boutique hotel but priceline came up with this before leaving for a cruise. Miami can be kind of dicey on the cheaper end of hotels so I opted to bid an a 4 star or better. This place has been ideal the best bed ever, large flat screen and a deck with a view of the bay. There is a coffee/tea maker in the room but no breakfast with this price. The hotel room service menu and breakfasts were both quite high so we found plenty of options close to the hotel. The free metro can get you in to the city center and cabs are at your door. All amenities were available but the free wifi was just in the large public area. There isn't a free shuttle here, but for my priceline bid of $115 I was amazed at the value I received.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: copahc
Reviews.Content: I think our stay was OK. My friend is very high tier Marriott rewards member so she used points and we stayed on the Concierge floor. The room was not very big though. You would think that an â€œupgraded roomâ€� would be nicer. I though the food in the concierge lounge was not very good. And they would take it away when people were still in there eating. You would think they would just leave it out longer.. all they do is throw it away anyway. The pool area was really not very impressive, and our room had no special view. The best part was the convenience.. we were there to attend a music festival at bicentennial park, and we could easily walk there. There was also some shops and restaurants right on the property so I was able to get my nails done at a little nail salon and we visited the sports bar to watch a game. The worst part howeverâ€¦ when we where checking out (well besides the fact it took forever because I think they were trying to overcharge my friend or something). There was a couple next to us trying to check in early and they told them they had to charge them something like $50 (possibly more, I donâ€™t remember) to check in early. Iâ€™ve never heard of this in my life. Every hotel where Iâ€™ve ever tried to check in early either happily allowed us to do it or told us they didnâ€™t have a room available yet. I canâ€™t believe this place had available rooms and were charging guests to check in early!!! Itâ€™s not like itâ€™s a bargain hotel or anything.. the rooms are way too expensive in my opinion and you can find better elsewhere. Oh.. and we also had lots of problems with the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A good night stay before our cruise on the next day”
Reviews.Author: SaugaBuds
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet downtown neighborhood. Location is ok but still requires transportation to go anywhere. The hotel staff was friendly and they were able to put us (2 rooms) side-by-side. We also travelled with our 2 year old son and so we got a crib at our request. No complain with its services at all. We got 2 balcony rooms with partial view to Port of Miami . We liked the balconies because we got to enjoy the Miami sun in the morning. The room itself was spacious but no free wifi though (they have wifi in the newly renovated lobby on the other hand). The king size bed was very comfortable and they have enough pillows which is what we truly enjoyed! Oh, we also like the big flat screen TV in the rooms. :) There were only 2 down sides staying at this hotel: 1) I thought this hotel is already located far from airport however I can still hear the air traffic noise even at midnight (and early in the morning like 6am). Maybe this is already better than all hotels around the airport but I have no comparison or previous experience here. 2) The taxi rides were just horrible. We had 6 people so they got us a van at the airport. At the end, the driver charged us $43 where I believe the ride should only be $24. And from hotel to Port of Miami , there was a driver who refused to put on his meter and requested for a flat rate of $15. We got another taxi afterward and it only cost us $10 (I gave $2 tips at the end and was very happy with the driver). These taxi rides certainly didnâ€™t give me a good impression about Miami ! But to be fair, these are not hotelâ€™s problem but rather general issues for staying close-by. In general, I like this hotelâ€™s services, its rooms and the newly renovated lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have been my first pick...”
Reviews.Author: lilcherub44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miami Biscayne Bay Hotel for a nursing conference 2 weeks ago. I had never traveled to Biscayne Bay, and truly looked forward to my stay in that area. As I prepared at home for my 2 day trip, I was quite impressed when I received an email from Marriott Concierge services about 4 days before. This email provided a link to website where I was able to request complimentary amenities for my room, such as newspaper, extra pillows/towels, and even exercise equipment!!! In addition, I was able to inform the Concierge service, that my flight was landing earlier than their designated check in time. I was so excited to head down there. Boy... was I disappointed...... When I landed in Miami, I immediately called the hotel, so that they can send a shuttle to pick me up. They were very quick to say that there was no shuttle service, and offered no other options. Now, it was my mistake to assume that they had shuttles (as every other hotel does), but suggesting safe options would have been appreciated. I ended up sharing a cab with a couple of people heading to the same hotel for the same conference. When I arrived at the hotel (10:30am), the woman at the front desk told me that there were no rooms available, and I would need to wait for a room to open up. She couldn't even give me an approximate time of when I should return. Trying to turn lemons into lemonnade, I took the opportunity to tour the neighborhood, and found that there was absolutely nothing for me to do... no stores to shop (the mall across the street was shut down), barely any restaurants, or even any scenic views. I actually had enough time to hop on the monorail (which was free.... but had no seats...), and met very "interesting" people. In the end... I waited for 4 HOURS for a room!! At this point, I was so exhausted... but I knew that I had to be at the conference, which was to start at 3pm. When I finally arrived in my room, I was not AT ALL impressed by the the horrible view of concrete, miniscule view of the Bay, and the bathroom which was so small that you couldn't turn or move without hitting your knee on the toilet!!!! If I ever go back to Miami Biscayne Bay, I will stay FAR away from the Marriott... It definitely wouldn't have been my first pick... or second!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, great views”
Reviews.Author: Rellybell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott before disembarking on a cruise. Hotel was great, clean, newly updated, beautiful views from the balconies and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindag717
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay prior to leaving on a Cruise. We had a room corner room overlooking the water. The room was fairly small due to the odd shape but it was big enough for what we needed. It was nice waking up in the morning and seeing our ship at the port. It's very convenient to the people mover and we used it to go to Bayside for a little shopping and dinner. There's also a shopping/restaurant area attached that would be very convenient also. There's a liquor store there for picking up last minute wine for the cruise. The lobby area was very nice with couches and tv's which were very nice for hanging out. We were with another couple so it was a great area fo relax and play cards.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Miami”
Reviews.Author: traveller65432107
Reviews.Content: We went there on an overnight layover. The roms are very clean. The situation is not the best, there's pratically nothing around the hotel. Your better bet is to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: lovekatz1975
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were extremely disappointed in our stay at this hotel. It was under renovation while we were there. There were only 2 elevators working. There was some sort of event happening that weekend and we had to wait at least 15 minutes to get an elevator to our room. When we got to the room, we found that the air conditioner was not working. We complained but were told that there weren't any other available rooms. My husband spoke to a manager who finally put us into another room. While we were packing up our bags to move to the new room, someone from the cleaning staff came to the old room to prepare it for another guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: elvanallen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Biscayne pre and post Christmas cruise. The view was spectacular, it's close to the cruise terminal and South Beach, and the lobby/valet staff had great customer service. The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. The mattresses need to be changed - as I slept in an indentation every nights (not very comfortable) The food was tastey - but pricey. Definitely go to the Doubletree mall next door and get your meals there, as they're much more reasonably priced. I'd stay there again, but recommend having a car to get around in as the neighborhood goes from ritzy to dicey pretty quickly on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Top Flight Hotel Minutes from South Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: This busy hotel is top flight is you want to be minutes from South Beach and just about everything in Miami including the off-beat Haulover Park beaches. Some reviewers say the rooms are small, but we got an upgrade from the awesome front desk staff to a wonderful huge room facing the bay with wall-to-wall glass. The room had no walls! It was 75% floor to ceiling windows. Of course the room had nice Marriott bedding and included a large dining room table, work desk, two end tables and a large dresser that doubled at a TV stand for the flat screen. Unfortunately, the flat screen didnâ€™t have the newer laptop plug-in box. Come one. Come all! The hotel has a nice concierge lounge. But over the holidays the breakfast can be a zoo. It was nice of Marriott to leave the door open for Platinum and Gold member to bring their entourage to the lounge to eat for free! And eat they did! They ran out of food, plates and utensil so fast people put scrambled eggs in coffee cups and ate them with spoons! We ate twice at the new upscale restaurant that -- $41 for two breakfast buffet and about $90 for a dinner -- very good food! You will need to park your car in the $26 a day lot. There is no street parking. Pay the $1.25 toll and drive to South Beach on the causeway directly in front of hotel. Youâ€™ll arrive in less than five minutes. Take route 1 when driving to North Miami. Save the toll and unnecessary route on 95 if youâ€™re heading up near the beaches. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel with a great staff and cool restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE and watch your charges\points”
Reviews.Author: dlee_salem
Reviews.Content: One month now since my stay and yet another charge!!!! I have been a Marriott fan for many years and always try to stay with this brand whenever possible. I am a member and vacation owner and had always been able recommend Marriott until now. Let's see, I was overcharged, my credit placed on hold (Causing me to miss out on some big-ticket items for holiday sales!!) They cancelled my rewards reservation then charged me for the night - a higher rate. A staff member came to my room after 9 pm - telling me they had my room listed as empty!!! (Wouldn't a call to the room suffice). Upon reversing their errors for cancelling my rewards reservation, they charged me more points that my original reservation. I now have yet another charge - 1 month later - yet I can't find out what it is until I call during business hours tomorrow. (No notification of what this new charge is for either) I have written to marriott only to be referred to the hotel manager. I had tried to call but she was unavailable. I hadn't followed up as I already know that this is one Marriott I will never return to. I have spent hours trying to sort through the issues this hotel has caused and can only say that I hope this is an isolated incident.... (Ft. Lauderdale and Orlando quality far more superior to this hotel... they should take some management lessons from them) Aside from all the billing and reservation issues, the only positive points I can make is the location and the bar staff. The room was a good side and the bedding good yet the carpeting had many "Sticky areas" so wear your slippers!!! The hotel is extremely crowded as many pre/post cruise travellers are constantly filling the lobby to elbow room only. The dining room is small and if your not ordering the buffet, expect a long wait (45 mins for yogurt and cereal) For dining, I would recommend going to the 1st level area under the adjoining Double Tree. They have dining areas (b-fast/lunch/dinner) with far better service\quality.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are Done”
Reviews.Author: Mooneydriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights toward the end of December. The renovations in the lobby are complete - everything looks sparkly clean and the lobby is fully operational. I understand the rooms were already renovated two years ago. The rooms are typical Marriott fare - relatively large rooms and relatively cramped bathrooms. If you get a room overlooking the Bay, the views are fantastic (see attached picture). The rooms are well-equipped with ample power outlets and a safe. Rooms are relatively quiet and provide for a comfortable sleep. My only complaints about the room are about the bathroom: no place to hang towels; not large enough for two people to occupy at the same time. The location provides easy access to major attractions and the beaches via 395, A1A, and 195 highways and causeways. The neighborhood is quite safe and pleasant. Negatives: 1) Concierge Lounge: limited breakfast options and maddening crowds in the morning (not sure how all those people manage to sneak in) and a surly, disinterested, and uninformed attendant in the evening hours. 2) Parking: the garage is small and the spaces are rather narrow - you may run out of luck if you arrive late. For $26/night, one expects a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lulli2010
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay with friends, family. Free internet at the lobby. Clean, friendly, excellent. The room is exactly the same as the foto in the website. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel under major renovations”
Reviews.Author: lorraine6225
Reviews.Content: Wow! The hotel is upside down under major renovations. That said, they are making the best of it. The rooms are done and are very nice. The staff is amazing. But be prepared for a disaster parking garage entrance, no lobby, it feels dangerous driving up the ramp to the temporary lobby. One restaurant, no pools or outdoor areas, very difficult to get a taxi. Overall I would wait until the renovations are done. But kudos to the staff, they really make the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: klotz80
Reviews.Content: Checked in with no trouble at all, was given a very nice room with a king bed and partial ocean view. Bed was so comfortable! Business center was nice but a little tucked away Restaurant food wasn't too badly priced. Despite the renovations the hotel seemed to be functioning quite well. Perfect location for a pre night cruise stay as it's very close to the pier. Short distance from Bay View Marketplace for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations end soon. New grand opening December 2010”
Reviews.Author: Tarawa
Reviews.Content: Property is wrapping up their renovations. Don't be scared by this. Your only inconveniences are parking and a longer wait for the elevator. Restaurants and lounges have relocated to smaller ball rooms on an upper floor. Rooms are still clean, comfortable and offer great water viewsof the east.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: macomber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before we went on our first cruise out of Miami. This hotel was very clean and comfortable. Even though they are remodeling the staff made check in very easy. We did have breakfast in their resturant and the food was good but quite expensive for a breakfast of $18 each. The bed was very comfortable and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackangus9
Reviews.Content: Great hotel even though they are doing a huge renovation. No noise on the weekend!! We stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise. As a Platinum member I was treated like royalty. My feeling is that everyone would be treated the same at this hotel. I can see that parking could be an issue as the enterance / arrival level is on the 3rd floor. They have a lot of staff that shuttle you from the 3rd level to the main level if you are walking, so it was NOT an issue. There are shops under the hotel but if you are looking for a grocery store, go out to the street level and go north 2 blocks and to the right 3 blocks. 10 minute walk at the most. They have everything!!! The store down below is VERY expensive. We took the mono-rail over to Bayside (free) and shopped and had something to eat. Very nice place to see and shop. Took a cab back to the hotel later that evening. Once the renovations are complete and things re-opened to the proper areas, it will be a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Niki090
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one night stay and positively loved this hotel! The staff was pleasant and very accommodating and were always happy to answer any of our questions. Yes, there is a renovation in progress but they have done a good job of keeping the mess contained. I certainly wasn't bothered by any construction activity. We had a room with a view of the bay and it was just breathtaking! The room is exactly as pictured on the Marriott website and the bath products were of high quality. They do charge a fee for internet access ($12.95), which I think is ridiculous in this day and age but it didn't bother me since I didn't pay for the service. The room was spotless and the a/c unit functioned really well and was not noisy. I took a peek at the fitness room and pool area before I left and was impressed with those as well. The pool is not very large but adequate and there is a jacuuzi as well. The fitness room is very well equipped and has very large windows that overlook the bay - a nice distraction while working out. We didn't dine at any of the restaurants as there is a deli and shopping center just downstairs that had great food not at "hotel" prices. The walkway is connected to the hotel so we didn't even have to walk outdoors to get there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! In fact, I have already booked another 2 night stay for the end of the month!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: isismommy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice although they are in the middle of a major remodel. (should be completed w/in a couple of months.) The room was very nice and on the 31st floor, with a balcony to see the amazing views of miami. Hotel was clean and up to date. Restaurants nearby and good location. Downside... The first two floors were unaccessible (due to remodel) and the parking garage was busy! It was difficult to find a spot and they even charged a fee for parking.. Overall, nice and clean hotel, would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby1957
Reviews.Content: I would have given the hotel an overall excellent, but they are under renovatioin due to be completed in Dec 2010. Currently the hotel restaurant is not a real restaurant but part of the temp lobby. The lobby bar is also not a real bar, just a room off the lobby. Once the renovations are done it will be excellent in all accord. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, trying to go out of thier way to assist. The hotel is only about a 10 min drive from the airport ($27 taxi ride). It is also near a free people mover that will take you all around downtown. Pool is very nice with a bar and the hotel is within walking distance to other restaurants that are very reasonable in proce. They have a very nice concierge lounge, though a tab bit skimpy on the offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night at this hotel after returning from a cruise - I have to say we could not fault this hotel even with renovations taking place. We arrived early and we were not expecting them to have a room ready for us, but yes they did which we were very happy about and was dying to have a decent shower after being on a boat with a very small shower. Staff could not be more pleasant and we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and if we ever returned to Miami there would be no reason for us to stay at this Marriott again - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlyoyo55
Reviews.Content: The room was large and had big windows and ample light during the day. The bathroom was splendid â€” it had a deep tub and a glassed-in television set on the wall adjacent to it, as well as a stand-up shower and two independent sinks. The room also had a 46-inch flat-screen Samsung LCD TV, a DVD player, an iPod station, a fax machine, Wi-Fi service and free international telephone calls using a VOIP Web service. ROOM SERVICE I asked room service to deliver some food at 11 p.m. since my wife and I arrived so late. The servers came on time, wearing fine clothing and speaking English. My wife tried a hamburger and fries and I ordered roasted organic chicken with root vegetables and truffled white potato. Both were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedYo
Reviews.Content: This place is immaculate. Our room was on the 28th floor with a balcony overlooking the bay. The room was everything it was made out to be. The hotel is connected to a small mall that made it easy to find dinner without having to drive. The hotel staff was friendly and everyone went our of their way to say hello and make you fell welcome. I only stayed one night before my cruise, but I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Nickelodeon Package Failure”
Reviews.Author: candfloyd
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night pre-cruise. Our son waited patiently for his Nickelodeon surprise at check in. I had promised him a surprise would be waiting for him at the hotel for his 9th birthday. The clerk handed me my room keys and to my son's disappointment, no gift bag. I had to ask for it. The clerk then left to go retrieve the gift bag. She returned with the bag, a pair of sunglasses, and a ball. Not exactly what I was expecting but alright. On our way out to dinner, I stopped at the front desk and spoke with the same clerk that checked us into the hotel.
