I requested that the Nickelodeon turndown service be completed before we returned from dinner. Unfortunately, it was not in our room when we got back from dinner appx 2 hours later. I called downstairs and was told that the turndown would occur between 6pm and 8pm. It was 7:30pm at that time. I waited until 8:15pm before calling again. We were told that they were on the way. Housekeeping showed up at 8:45 with the pillowcase and a tiny box of chocolates. Where was the bedtime story book? We were tired from traveling so I let the issue rest for the night. The next morning, I called the font desk to speak with the manager to complain. I waitied in the room for a few minutes but they did not call me back or leave a message for me on the hotel phone. I retirieved the Nickelodeon activity book from the front desk. Not a story book at all. And no apology either. Considering the extra amount of money I spent on the package, I expected to get what was advertised on Marriotts website. Marriott dropped the ball. Worst customer service ever. Did I mention the 20 minute wait to check in at the front desk?

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleverand
Reviews.Content: Obtained a room through Priceline. The check-in was located in an unusual area, but check in was a breeze and the front desk was very accomodating in regards to high floor request and was allowed to check in at 2:00 PM. The room was very clean and the view from the 30th floor overlooking the cruise port was outstanding. The sky walk to numerous shops and restaurants was very convenient. The pool area and workout room were exceptional. Would definitely stay at the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The views were very nice....but that's...”
Reviews.Author: BlissExplorer
Reviews.Content: The views were very nice....but that's all. Entry to the hotel is awkward and out of the way. The lobby is off the very old and poorly designed parking garage (that they charge $22 per day to use). The lobby and the path to the garage were also crowded every time we passed through. The buffet breakfast was terrible. The food was bland and cold. In the room, the bed was actually nice. Overall, I really couldn't believe there had been a major renovation recently because everything looked pretty old and outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you dont want South Beach!”
Reviews.Author: KayT28_10
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here rather than south beach, and were so glad we did! Although the Mariott is currenlty under construction you would never actually know! Staff were very helpful throughout our stay! Our room was on the 14 floor and we had an amazing view of downtown aswell as south beach! Taxi's to south beach were about $15 dollars, but worth it to escape the noise and lights of the bars and resturants! Amazing places to eat in south beach so definatly worth the trip every night! Once the facelift is complete this hotel will be amazing, we are glad we got such a great rate so we could experinece this hotel and location for cheaper! Resturant and shops underneath the hotel which adds convience! We also visited sawgrass mills outlet mall and the aventura mall - both amazing shopping locations recommended by the hotel! We also visited the Seaquarium which was cheaper and more intimate than seaworld! Also visit Bayside if you can (downtown area) as has great resturants and bars including Hooters, Chicargo Rock and Bubba Gumps! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The location was excellent! It allowed...”
Reviews.Author: Neca77
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent! It allowed me to enjoy downtown and was only a 5 minute drive across the causeway from the hustle and bustle of Sobe. Though it was under renovation, one would never know. We were not inconvenienced at all by that. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The only thing that I noticed is the rooms were a tad bit smaller than what I'm used to with Marriott but hey I was in town to enjoy the city. Already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaII
Reviews.Content: Another pleasurable stay. The positives: Rooms look exactly like the website Rooms are clean and refurbished The view of the bay is to die for Great value for the price we paid Staff friendly and accommodating There was construction going on but it did not interfer with the operations of the hotel a big plus for us. Problem free stay. Negative: Once again I had an issue with the quality of the bathroom linen, frayed and torn at the edges. I say once again, because this was the same problem I had with a previous stay in Fort Lauderdale. The top sheet on the bed was also torn at the edge. I didn't report any of this because we were barely in the room and only spent two nights. So it did not bother us, however it seems to be an issue. You may need to look into your quality checks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jusbeingme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre-cruise stay. This hotel was a good choice. Although we booked via priceline we were treated very well. The hotel lobby appears to always be busy so be prepared for a head spin. Once we located our room things were quite quiet and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a dump”
Reviews.Author: Scrawl
Reviews.Content: Renovations aside....and believe me....it is hellish. One small corridor through which everyone in the hotel has to pass......basically a bottleneck. Waiting for a taxi in a suit on that 3rd floor car-park lobby thing....the heat....the fumes...hell. But aside from all that. The room we had, a bay view updated room on a high floor was very disappointing. If that is as good as they get. It was tiny. Low ceiling. Small room. I know it's an older building but when they did the renovations they could have factored the room size into their choice of furniture. Oversized arm chairs, huge lamps, a gargantuan desk chair and a very cumersome pouf made it impossible to navigate the room without falling over. It's as if they filled a small japanese apartment with furniture from a huge texan ranch. the only thing i did like was the safe that could accommodate a laptop. I got a deal on priceline. but a week later (when passing through miami again) i paid the same rate on priceline and got the hyatt miami....MUCH bigger rooms.....even though they weren't that clean...

Reviews.Title: “We stayed 2 nights in room with beautiful view of bay and very good beds at extreme value.”
Reviews.Author: jawjajoneses
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a couple of days befor our cruise(another story) to tour Miami. I found Mariott Biscayne Bay online for a deal because of the multi-million $ renovation they are undergoing during the day time hours only. $89.00 + tax /nt. Staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good”
Reviews.Author: HME37
Reviews.Content: Going through a face lift when we were there, but still had a very good service and standard. Central location. Very close to Omni rail station, from where you reach everything downtown miami. Nice rooms. Good pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise option”
Reviews.Author: Dmctimm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Carnival cruise in July 2010. Great location in terms of - view, accessibility to free public transportation to the Bayside Marketplace and ease of getting to the cruise pier. The room was decent for the cost, especially considering it is in Miami. At the time we were there, the lobby was under renovation so all traffic was filtered through another area, which created some issues, but that is temporary. We enjoyed the pool area as it was open later, which was very welcomed after returning from the marketplace late in the evening. The negative - We were looking for breakfast on the Saturday morning and the buffet offering was far too costly, especially considering how little our kids eat. The problem is - there are not breakfast options right in the area outside of the hotel. We decided to board the cruise ship earlier and eat for free. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovations - who knew??”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: I recently met with the charming Bertha Galindo and Miguel Pirela from the catering department @ Biscayne Bay Marriott to discuss an upcoming wedding. I was fully aware of the renovations that the hotel is undergoing but wanted to experience it for myself and my clientâ€™s peace of mind. When I arrived at the hotel, I was promptly greeted by the valet officers. The lobby "front desk area" has now been moved to the 3rd floor which is where the ballrooms are currently located. There is a small sitting area for the guests to wait while checking in along with a well kept water station. The restaurant has temporarily moved to the same level and has a great view to the bay and marina. Both Bertha and Miguel gave me a tour of the familiar property as if I were a guest attending an event. They had previously assured me that the hotel guests did not intervene with the guests attending the event and it proved to be correct. Having previously stayed here before, I revisited the newly renovated guestsâ€™ rooms which are absolutely stunning. The view of the calm bay gives it a serene resort feel without having to get your feet in the sand. The rooms are spacious and the bed is comfy. I took some pictures of the common areas so that you can see for yourself that the hotel is not as obstructed as some others may have commented. I also noticed that when logging on to www.Marriott.com, www.hotels.com and www.orbitz.com and selecting this hotel, it is clearly advised throughout the site that the hotel is in fact undergoing renovations, therefore should not be a surprise to anyone upon arrival. I trust that this review will comfort your concerns on your future stays at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Nice--Parking Ludicrous”
Reviews.Author: drdrfaulkner
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel except that we Florida residents who drove down from the Cocoa area had to pay for parking. I always considered parking to be an amenity. I am both a Marriott Rewards member and AAA Auto Club South member, but was highly miffed that I had to pay $22 per day for parking. We were referred to a parking garage next door which they said charged $30 or more. Yes, there is something on some related websites about the charges, but we did not notice it on the one we used. I am not certain that, even if there was no construction, there would have been enough parking places for all guests in the hotel. Parking is poorly planned, and I will not stay at this hotel again because of the added costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice....one problem”
Reviews.Author: OurTripTip4U
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice to stay. We had just come back from our cruise and stayed here for the 5 days were we extend our vacation in Miami. We had friends with teens and young children who stayed at the four seasons - great if you only love the beach, and The Shelly- good for a over dressed room on the beach and fine shopping areas. we went with what we know...a Marriott!!! The Biscayne Bay was * close to the People movers ( free train) wonderful! can get around without a car or taxi * close enough to south beach- 5-10 min ride in taxi or 20- min ride on public trans * close to Bayside- a great place for families with "teens", great shopping ( with any budget) food places were great!...Gotta go to Bubba Gumps! the mgr Aubrey and waiter Dan were awesome!!! nightly entertainment...and good ice cream spots for those hot nights! * close to the American Arena- Go Miami Heat!!- D Wade, and Labrone!!! and yeah Bosh too!!!! Ok, Ok,...so back to the hotel; the info above was free info for ya!....lol so the hotel was clean and the service was good. Pool was clean, rather small but it seem to work out everyday for the young and old. houskeeping was a little slow on days but, hey...Im on vacation! .....BUT there was ONE thing....they never mentioned the hotel was going to be under construction when we booked!!!!!!!!!!! not too much nosie or real problems...but you would think that they would let you know and once there....give you a perk...like contin breakfast during the week or something....at any rate the breakfast was a little pricey ($18pp) so we found the cute little mall under the hotel which connects the Maririott to the Double tree ( another great hotel- a conversation for another blog...lol) There we found a variety of stores and food places ( a wonderful Argentine and Uruguay spot) IMPORTANT*****The guys who are working the golf carts at the Marriott Biscayne Bay -they transport you to the lower levels and do bagagge; due to the construction they are really helpful!!! and a better deal than the city tour guides They were AWESOME!!! (Thanks guys!!!) *** OVER ALL *** Great plcae and location to see ALL of miami. Beach, Malls, and other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction from now on until the end of 2010”
Reviews.Author: VeroArgentinaJapon
Reviews.Content: As other members have mentioned, the hotel is going under construction so try to avoid going there until the end of this year, when it is supposed to be finished. Or, just bear in mind you will find a noisy, messy, not very clean environment right now. On the other side, the location is good, the view is nice ( I got a room with a view to the bay).

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina83
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about staying there, even though for 1 night only. The restaurant food is delicious! the view was great even standard. minus: no free internet and fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dawnm515
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Stayed on a higher floor so construction noise was not a factor. Beds were comfortable, kids enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “We thought this would have been the...”
Reviews.Author: Jester6487
Reviews.Content: We thought this would have been the perfect hotel pre cruise we chose to stay one night.... What a disaster the only nice thing I can say is that ugraded our because it was our honeymoon. With the package we booked we got breakfast which was buffet it was ok but we only saw our server one time. I had to go get her so we could pay the bill and they when she gave it me she explains to me how to read her tip chart and she is entitled to 7.62 or so.... Are you kidding you brought me one cup of coffee and the rest was buffet.... After settling our bill we returned to our room the elevator were busy so we wanted to take the stairs we asked an employee who told us point blank she didn't know where the stairs were today good thing there wasn't a fire. Finally the courtesy shuttle or should I say what shuttle. We asked were to pick it as it was part of the package we paid for no one knew. Finally a gentleman said to go into the parking garge take the elevator down you will see van 36 waiting...ok. Guess what no van and no one directing anyone so long story short take a cab it was only 8.50 and forget the Marriott very poor!!!

Reviews.Title: “Guests are an Anoyance to the Management of Marriott Biscayne Bay”
Reviews.Author: williams0780
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay for a convention business trip. I am a Gold Elite member of Marriott and truly rely on Marriott to make my frequent travels more bearable. However, this does not seem to be the case with the Biscayne Bay Marriott location. I stay at this Marriott every time I visit Miami. I have always looked forward to the quality of service I have experienced at this hotel. Even times that I have been there for weeks at a time, it was never a chore coming back to the hotel after a long day of conferences or working the docks for hours on end during the Miami Boat Show. A few years ago they began a much needed renovation on the rooms, which has been very nice. The lobby and restaurant areas are now under renovation and I fully understand that these upgrades are needed as the years pass. I state this because I could not get the management to understand that the renovation was not the problem, with the exception of the low floor level, on my latest stay, it was their lack of concern about the customer. Upon check in, the majority of my room preferences listed in my Marriott profile were ignored. My profile requests a high level floor. I was given a low level floor with a very poor view that suffered greatly from vibration and noise from the renovation construction. This became extremely distracting while trying to conduct business remotely and develop presentations for the conference. Because the lobby was under construction cabs were forced to navigate a parking garage that is obviously navigable by valets. When I would return from a meeting, I would have the cab stop outside so that I could enter the hotel on my terms not theirs. Security constantly yelled at the cab driver for following my instructions and when I would try to explain that they were simply following my wishes they would then aim their tirade at me. I finally gave up and told the cabs to drop me at the Double Tree next door to avoid confrontations. I checked about changing rooms and was told that I would not get the same type of room if I moved up to a higher level. I checked about changing to the Marriott on Miami Beach and was told that the Biscayne manager was unable to talk with the manager at the Miami Beach Marriott. So I decided to stay put and deal with the noise. However, upon trying to find a new hotel, I discovered that my current hotel had a better rate for Marriott Rewards Elite members and subsequently requested that rate, to which I was told no problem. Upon receiving the bill which had myriad of charges for internet services that were free to Gold Elite members, I found the rate had not been changed to the Elite rate. I promptly called the front desk and requested the front desk manager. The person who answered, I asked if I was speaking to the manager and he answered yes. I inquired about why my rate had not been changed and he stated that only a manager can change a rate. I stated to him that he identified himself as a manager to which he replied â€œI cannot change your rateâ€�. Once I finally got a real manager on the phone, I was told that the convention host had given instruction to the Biscayne Marriott not to change rates for Elite members. Apparently, I was not the only one who discovered this Elite rate. This is the point at which Miami Biscayne Marriott told me that conventions bring them a lot of business and they do not want to upset the convention planners. I promptly informed her that the convention doesnâ€™t care where the people stay because their competitor next door was also a preferred hotel and who they had upset were loyal customers that stay at Marriotts all over the world. She apologized and offered my bonus reward points, which I gladly accepted and informed her that I would use at the Marriott World Center in Orlando, which their hotel could take some pointers from. Ironically, she disclosed that World Center is the hotel that Marriott Corporate uses as a training example for their other locations, but I digress. What would now seem an end to a horrific stay in Miami simply refused to end. Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay would not send me my e-folio (e-statement), since I have chosen to go paperless and consequently could not submit to my company for reimbursement. They also would not acknowledge my stay in the rewards program for Marriott Rewards nights and points. I repeatedly called the hotel requesting the e-folio and nights credited for the stay. I always requested to speak with a manager and was always told that they were unavailable, but that they could see where I had stayed with them and they would correct the matter and have a manager call me to discuss the situation. In short, no manager ever called back. After 10 days of fighting this, I called Marriott Rewards Customer Service. They were able to verify my stay and within 20 minutes I had an e-folio sent to my account and within 12 hours had reward points and nights credited for my stay. This is the type of service that Marriott Rewardâ€™s members have come to highly respect about Marriott Hotels. I will continue to stay with Marriott, but the next time I need to be in Miami, I will stay at the Miami Beach Marriott or if I need access to the Miami Boat Show docks, I will stay at their competitor next door the Double Tree Hotel. I would like to thank Marriott Rewardâ€™s Corporate Customer Service for your quick resolution to Biscayneâ€™s ineptness and I look very forward to my next stay at Marriottâ€™s World Center in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ver good, fine and good service”
Reviews.Author: MikeNewYork80
Reviews.Content: I travel to Miami two times a year and I booked the Miami Marriot for the first time and I must say that I was very happy with my room and service of all the staff. I could not enjoy all the hotel because I was very bussy with my clients but I hope next time to enjoy it better. Mike New York

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: jingis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many many Marriotts - as I have worked in the hospitality industry for many years. Marriott as an organization should be embarrassed by this hotel. While the upgraded room was nice - that was all that was good. The level of service from the employees was deplorable. I felt like I was at a motel. I had received an email saying the hotel would be under construction for the next 6 months so upon arriving I was aware that this would be the case. But that is in NO WAY an excuse for how my boyfriend and I were treated. In fact, because of this, you would think they would go above and beyond to accommodate their guests. While staying there, we saw at least 4 couples leave the hotel to find another one in the area. The first morning we were there was cloudy and apparently the pool bartender called out sick - side note - the pool area is not shown on the website because it is horrendous. Smart move not putting that on the site Marriott. In any case - the manager on duty that day decided since it was cloudy nobody would be at the pool so they didn't find someone to replace the bartender. Smart move, Miami weather never changes right? Even I know this and I live in New York. An hour later it was sunny and beautiful, but no pool bar or food at the pool. When we decided we wanted a cocktail, the front desk made us go all the way up to our room to call for room service and they would bring it down to the pool. 50 minutes later, the drinks arrived wrong. Last I checked, the front desk at a hotel is very capable of calling for room service and in this situation, with the hotel under construction and very poor judgment by the manager to not replace the bartender, you would think they would call for us. But no. Motel service. When asked about a gift shop the front desk lady said there wasn't one - however there is an ENTIRE mall under the hotel which she never mentioned, separating the Marriott from the Double Tree - STAY AT THE DOUBLE TREE. It looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Construction woes”
Reviews.Author: Dandyone
Reviews.Content: As the title indicates, this hotel is undergoing sinificant lobby renovations. The "lobby" has been moved to the 3rd floor as has the drop off area and "front desk". The drop off area is now quite small and extremely chaotic. Needless to say, hot as well as it is in the parking lot. Front desk check in can only accomodate 3 check in staff and the line goes out into the hall. Due to the renovations, the restaurant is also closed. They have installed a "restaurant" in a lobby area on the 3rd floor near the elevators. It holds all of about 40 people. Probably ok for lunch or dinner, but if you weant to eat breakfast here, you better get up early as the lines are LONG. You can pass on this and get the free continental breakfast at the other end of the hall. This consists of coffee and some pieces of muffin and pastry. As a disgruntled guest wrote on a napkin, Motel 5 continental breakfast. You could try the Burger King about two blocks away or the S&S Diner an additional block away. The rooms are quite nice and bedding is very good. We had a bay view which offers a great view of the bay and cruise ships coming and going. When construction is over, this will be a great hotel again, But I would stay elsewhere until it is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: gammaalpha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a lobby renovation and it is a mess. Very dusty and noisy. One of the workers told me the whole lobby is being gutted and it will take the next six months at least. Not my idea of a relaxing Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: NeedaGetawayNO
Reviews.Content: I stayed pre-cruise and post. We had room 1026 and I can't remember the other. From 1026, you can see the cruise ships at the port in the distance. The immediate view is a dirty old tennis court though. The staff was helpful with directions and changing money. The bellhops were especially friendly and prompt. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms were clean though so small that the bathroom door nearly hits the toilet. They hide the coffee machine in a drawer near the desk which is unusual. There is a little shopping center attached where you can have a decent breakfast for about $9 bucks. Overall, a very good experience. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: Stepjarsteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this through PRICELINE for $60!!! The best hotel ever... Very clean and nice people. Just parking sucks its $30 park overnight. But oh well cant' say anything bad about this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent downtown and ocean and southbeach view”
Reviews.Author: drleo66
Reviews.Content: Front desk is very ok, and thanks for all , we have a room at 26th floor , ocean, downtown everywhere view, rooms are small but renovated, everything is nice, i use someone s wireless i think they havent at rooms, and they havent free bussines room . You'll try this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel - Amazing Beds”
Reviews.Author: Casper0800
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 1 night prior to leaving for a cruise. We booked our room through Priceline and had no problems whats so ever to check in, and they even allowed us to check in early, very nice. The room was a balcony room on the 30th floor, it was clean and nice. The 1 issue, I had is that being from Ohio wireless internet is free in most hotels, here they want to charge you in room for that. But they do offer free in the lounge. The view was great and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever stayed on. The pillows are great as well. The pool and hot tub was relaxing and the service and food at the hotel was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Decline Continues...”
Reviews.Author: Kartvelebi
Reviews.Content: If you read any reviews here about how this is a mediocre hotel with indifferent service, I concur. The night before we came here we stayed at the Coral Gables Hyatt. It was like night and day. This is a very large, boring, "cookie cutter" hotel with no sense of style. We found stray hairs in the bed and the sink. We had to wait for an hour and fifteen minutes to get a different room. They had no slippers. The bathrooms are tiny. The room service menu is lackluster. The parking is $26 a night (vs. $16 in Coral Gables). There's free wireless in the lobby. But in the room, it's your typical outrageous big hotel price. We got a good deal through Priceline, but if I had other options, I wouldn't choose this hotel. You won't have a bad night here, but you won't have a great one, either. The views were simply stunning, though.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards :-(”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPls
Reviews.Content: It was my 50th birthday celebration and I was traveling with a group of 9 ladies. We had an overnight stay prior to our cruise that took place the very next day. Around 3:30 p.m. we arrived at the hotel. The front entrance to the hotel is the smoking area so be prepared to walk through any smoke or smoke residue before you even enter the hotel. Itâ€™s simply not the best way to greet guest. At check in we were serviced by the front desk supervisor who spoke so loudly that her very voice became annoying. Once done with checking in, no one offered to take our bags to our room, although there was a bellhop. My room was on the 10th floor and had a great view of the bay along with the yachts that docked in the bay! Unfortunately though, that was about the best thing going for the room. The bathroom was poorly designed. It was very congested, had no towel bars and very poor lighting. The beds were simply ok, a place to rest your head for one night basically. However, we werenâ€™t going to allow this not so impressive first impression destroy our festive mood. We decided to get the party started and went to the dining room for lunch. The wait staff was nice enough, but I had one small bowl of lobster bisque and one glass of wine â€“ the bill was $24.00! I have had way better lobster bisque, a salad and a glass of wine and my bill still wasnâ€™t $24.00. As the remainder of the my guest arrived later that night the weather took a turn for the worst and it began to storm, so needless to say we were left to dine at the hotel. Once again, sadly, the food served was below average, but for bartender kudos to her, because the ladies gave the cocktails 2 thumbs up! The following morning we checked out, which went way smoother than the check-in, vowing never to stay at this particular Marriott hotel again! For anyone taking a cruise and if you are not picky about where you stay, then the location of this hotel is ideal. However, I would advise that you reconsider and look into other hotels that will offer great location, great food and a great staff. Don't go for this hotel thinking that it is up to Marriott standards because it really falls short. I give it a 2 on a scale of 1 to 5. With 5 being the highest. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - BAD front desk - Make sure you room category is guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: TamiLynnM
Reviews.Content: Made our reservation 4 weeks in advance through Continental.com and booked for 2 adults and 2 children...total of 4 people.. Got a great price..confirmed room for 4.. I called the Marriott direct one week before our arrival.. Just to confirm our reservation and make sure that there was nothing else that we needed to do because we were arriving late the night of our arrival..they said we were confirmed and our room has been paid for already so there would be no problems. WELL THEY WERE WRONG ! Upon arrival the front desk nicely said that they had upgraded us to a bay view room with one king bed- well we had 4 people and I thanked them, but said that would not work for the 4 of us..they offered one roll away, but said that they were completely booked and because we had not got a guaranteed bedding they would not do anything for us - but give us ONE King Bed and one twin roll away... I asked to speak to the front desk manager - again she told us that we had a reservation for 4 people in one room - but that does not guarantee the bedding arrangements... COME ON they will charge us for 4 people, but only give us 3 beds? After 15 minutes of going back and forth - the manager finally upgraded us to "The last suite" it had one king bed and a queen sofa sleeper..The room was beautiful.. I have worked in the travel industry for over 25 years and have never ran into this situation at any hotel from motel 6 to The Ritz....Marriott better change their policy -- there are a lot of other hotels out there !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting, but...”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutTripster
Reviews.Content: I was told that the hotel itself was "beautiful" and should have been told the location and views were beautiful. The hotel lobby is old and worn as are the bars and restaurant and all have a musty smell. The rooms have been done over and are beautiful, have comfortable beds, big screen TVs and great bathrooms but again, there is a musty smell. If you are looking for a reasonable price, need to be near the cruise ships and don't mind the must, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliekid
Reviews.Content: This rooms looked and felt brand new. Our room looked out over the bay and we had a fantastic view of the cruise ships at the dock. We even saw our coming in on the morning, so ask for room with a view if you are heading out on a cruise. Swimming pool areas was good and had table tennis and lots of chairs and towels. Breakfast was excellent if included in your rate, but theycharge full price for children if not included. Plenty of options for food in the Double Tree, which is attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay! I Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: FNOBRAZIL
Reviews.Content: After a Cruise, we spent a week at this hotel, and we had a great experience. Clean, comfortable, spacious and friendly staff. We do not used hotel facilities (restaurant, breakfast...). Depending on room, you will we have a nice view from Biscayne Bay. There is a good Deli/grocery store close to hotel (only a door separating), restaurants and some stores. A block away there is only two fast-food restaurants. If you need more options, you have to get a car. There is a Metromover Station (FREE) that you can reach some Miami Downtown attractions (Bayside MarketPlace, AA Arena, Museums). At night, hotel area seems not safe (although there is a College nearby hotel), but i did not see anything. One complaint: parking is very expensive (almost US$30 a day) We would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not bad!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: liloleman
Reviews.Content: had a great time staying here,staff was great!! breakfast was the best. have stayed 4 times to catch cruise ships.will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, a blah place.”
Reviews.Author: cf54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott and found it very basic. Bed was comfortable but the bathroom was extremely tiny and uncomfortable. The carpet in the room was stained. The pool area was depressing, but the view is pretty as the hotel is right on the intracoastal although there is a constant flow of planes approaching the airport. Service is ok, but when we asked if we could have a late check out we were told we could not. The "beauty parlor" was old fashioned and empty. The food at the restaurant was fine, but overall I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property--one of the nicer places I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Milbs_40
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here before heading out on a cruise the next morning. I had read the reviews that mentioned the place had undergone a serious remodeling/upgrade in the previous few months. I was pleasantly surprised by this property--fabulous furnishings. We stayed just at the end of a huge tennis event in the Miami area. So the hotel was hopping with folks from the tennis event. But that did nothing to deter our stay. Check-in was a breeze. We did get a slight upgrade to a waterfront view because of my Marriott Rewards status. Because we checked in at night, we didn't get the full view until the next morning. Amazing view. I think we were on the 23rd floor. Once the sun rose, a great view of the bay/port and all of the cruise ships getting ready to head out. View was very impressive. Room had definitely seen a recent upgrade in bedding. Probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept on in quite a while. I do travel fairly regularly. So I get my share of hotel stays. This bed was extremely comfortable. Room was a decent size. We had king--with a small chair and foot stool on the window side of room. Also had an adequate desk area if you need space for laptop and some work space. TV was flat-panel with HD channels. Ordered room service and food was good--no issues. Also able to go down the hall and get a soda for $1 out of machine. Didn't know there were any $1 vending machines left in the world?? Only downside to room was shower/tub. This area is getting old and outdated. Not a lot of room in shower compared to most nicer properties. One plus was the lighting in bathroom. Did have light that encircled the vanity mirror. My wife loved this aspect when it came to fixing her hair and putting on makeup--loved the great lighting. All in all, this is great property. When it came time to leave in the morning, we told a bellman that we needed a cab to the port of Miami and he immediately got us taken care of and on our way. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this property. Two Thumbs way up!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right For A Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: visualgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night prior to a cruise along with a huge contingent going on the same cruise, but we weren't booked as a group. Needless to say, we all started showing up around the same time. We also all booked via Priceline and got a terrific rate. The staff handled the crowd very, very well. From the baggage handlers to reception, everyone was polite and had a smile. We were through check in and up to our room in no time. We did ask for a lower floor with a view, which we got but it was directly across from the vending/ice machines which is a huge no-no in my book, but decided to overlook it this time. Turned out to be a small deal but not a big one regarding noise. The room was quite comfortable and clean - we slept great. The shower had amazing water pressure - it was the best part of the stay!! We hadn't eaten all day so decided on an early dinner in the hotel restaurant. It was practically empty during the early bird time we went. We were seated at a banquette with a lovely view of the marina. Service was prompt and courteous. The food? Meh. Some was good, some was really not worthy of the expense. And expensive it was. $100 for 2 with just having 2 drinks, soups, salad and one entree. But we were in warm Miami, relaxed and being served well, so whatever. We all met at the bar that night, maybe about 80 or so people and the bar service was just fine - very nice bartenders and no one was left holding an empty glass for long. The next day, we took a walk around the property along the water and part way across the causeway. For breakfast, we did go to the food court for eggs and such. There's a store for any incidentals one might have forgotten and snacks and things if you want to buy that before the cruise. We stocked up on waters, energy bars, aloe, etc. Again, everyone checked out around the same time and all were looking for taxis to the marina. There was a huge crowd that was dispatched efficiently and without drama. We were on our way with an acceptable wait time. Seems like they are pros at moving the cruise crowds along. There was only one woman at the front desk that morning who wasn't exactly Miss Personality, but even she was helpful (I asked her to make a copy for me because there was no paper in the copier in the business center), if not the most pleasant. All in all? Just right for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: RiverTraveler
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that I got this on Priceline for under half of what they were asking for the weekend I was there. So that colors my image a bit - all hotels were ridiculously expensive that weekend and I probably wouldn't have been happy with any for the asking rate! We stayed here for two nights before a cruise. We stayed at the Hyatt the night after the cruise and I'll write a review for that as well. (Which would I choose? They both had good and bad - I'd take whichever gave me a better deal but I thought the Hyatt had a bad pool/fitness room but a better location.) That said, getting there was easy - about $25 cab from the airport. The room was nice - we had a small balcony that overlooked the bay and the Doubletree pool area next door. Two chairs and a small table - I doubt more than two people would be comfortable out there, though - it was tiny! The room was decent sized, had a nice closet and an OK bathroom/sink area. Toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion) were by Bath and Body Works. There was not a fridge in the room. And no full-length mirror - what's with that??? It was the same at the Hyatt! There was a small "mall" between the two hotels (Marriott and Doubletree) where you could get something to eat and there were a few shops there. The hotel lounge was nice and the service was good but of course it was very expensive as with any hotel food. (Tip - the food was the same price in the lounge as it was from room service, though you probably had to pay a delivery and/or service fee for room service. But it you really prefer room service it's probably worth it. We figured the prices would be a bit cheaper downstairs but they were not.) Tip about Miami in general that I read specifically about South Beach - some (most?) restaurants will add gratuity to the bill right away - so check that before you decide how much to tip! The lounge didn't do this but we ate at Tradewinds at Bayside and they did add 15% to the bill. We did not use the pool but we could see it from our room and walked down there one day. It was OK but the pool at the Doubletree looked nicer. There was also a hottub and they had a ping pong table set up down there. It was a nice big area so if you wanted to just lay in the sun or shade there were plenty of areas to do so. You could also get down to the waterfront easily from the lobby area and it was nice to stroll along the sidewalk along the water - there are lots of boats at the marina right there. The fitness room was quite good - several weight machines (sorry - don't belong to a gym so I can't say if they were diverse enough but they looked pretty new) and several treadmills, ellipticals and bikes. They all had a TV but I found the sound and TV to be hit or miss on them. One I couldn't turn the channel and another I couldn't get any sound. The other one I used had sound SOMETIMES so if being entertained while running/elliptical/biking is important, bring your I-pod - they all had a connection for that. They did have headphones available in the fitness center for the machines, which was nice. The best thing about the fitness room is that you could easily see the cruise port from the room. Nice view! The hotel is not really near much as far as walking distance but the metromover is just at the end of the street (not even a full block) and it's free so it was very easy to get to Bayside Market where they have stores and lots of restaurants. It was a really fun place. Getting back was far more difficult for us as we kept thinking we were going the wrong way and we'd get off, examine the maps, get on the next train and find the same problem again. I'm sure someone more experienced in public transportation would fare better. (We did finally get back but we switched trains several times!) The people on the metromover were OK but I wouldn't ride it alone (as a woman) and I would either be back to the hotel before dark (the area around the hotel was OK but it wasn't super well-lit and there were few people around) or take a cab - I imagine it's not more than $10 from Bayside. We did the Island Queen boat tour at Bayside (there are lots of boat tours and I imagine they're all about the same). They leave often so you should be able to find one that suits your timeframe. Island Queen also had a lot of other tours with discounts if you paired things (i.e. boat tour and a hop-on-hop-off city tour, Everglades tour, etc.) We took a taxi to the cruise port, which was $9.30 before tip and took only 10 minutes or so. Pretty easy. We tried to do self-checkout on the TV before we left but when I checked the bill I found that they'd charged us for one night of parking (over $20 but I don't recall how much) so we had to go to the desk to get that charge removed. They were very friendly and easy to deal with both at check in and check out. I would definitely stay here again - if you really want to be close to action, I'd choose either something closer to Bayside or someone in South Beach but this was perfect for two nights and essentially one day in Miami before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All Impressed”
Reviews.Author: DurhamFossil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in February. We were not at all impressed. I suppose we could have put up with the rust stains in the tub, having to pay for a refridgerator in my room and the filthy bathrooms in the lobby but I have a problem with not having a concierge. We were told that 'everyone in the lobby is a concierge.' That's just not so. Earlier in the week we had stayed at the Hollywood Beach Marriott and they had two full-time professional concierges. Not so here. The bellmen and front desk clerks did what they could but they are not professional concierges. If Marriott isn't going to provide adequate travel support then provide free access to a computer and I'll do it myself. We won't return to this hotel. We'll stay at one of the Art Deco beauties on South Beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: k1mers
Reviews.Content: We requested early check-in and our room was ready when we arrived. We were upgraded to a balcony, water view room due to joining Marriott rewards. The room was very nice, the bed was awesome! The hotel was close to the Port and only took a 10 min. cab ride. We checked out via phone and the were no surprises. There is a great deli attached to the hotel with a few shops too. Overall, nice one night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: Tigra86
Reviews.Content: Miami is a fantastic place, and no hotel can spoil it. Anyway, we were satisfied with ours. It wasn't fancy, it wasn't chic, but it was just what we needed for our family vacation. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Stay”
Reviews.Author: patszplace
Reviews.Content: The best Flan ever....homemade every day in the litle store downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the hotel - rather typical Marriott. Rooms and overall hotel were clean. Staff was fine but very slow at check-in. Even though there were not many people in the lobby there was still a delay during check-in. The room was clean and comfortable, (another in my party had a slightly larger room with a nice view overlooking the city which was nicer than my room). The valet parking was quick to retieve the car from the hold but when I would bring the car back in to be parked I had to go looking for them to give them the keys. This hotel is a loooong two or three miles from South Beach and the drive back and forth became tedious becuase of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: MaharajTrekker
Reviews.Content: Good service from staff. Located adjacent to a mall with restaurants. Room was excellent. Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely improved over several years ago”
Reviews.Author: lindy1991
Reviews.Content: Was delighted with quietness of room, helpfulness of staff, perfectly cooked poached eggs for eggs benedict! Air conditoning soundless- not often the case. Have stayed many times over the past ten years and the new decor etc made it very a pleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “You might get a terrible room if you are going with a cruise with NCL”
Reviews.Author: Sea-Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: We made reservations through a Swedish travel-agency for a cruise with Norwegian Cruise Line/Norwegian Jewel. We decided to have a hotel-package which included transfer to the ship and were at first supposed to stay att Holiday Inn in South Beach. But it was fullybooked so NCL made a reservation for us at Marriott Biscayne Bay. When we arrived we were totally exhausted, we had a plane from Stockholm leaving early in the morning for New York, there we had to wait for the plane to Fort Lauderdale and then grab a cab to the hotel. We arrived at 8 in the evening at the hotel but our time back home was already 5 in the morning, so you can imagine... We got a room on the 10th floor, at last some sleeping we thought. But no... They had placed us in a room next to the elevators so that we had the elevator-sound on one side of the bed and from the other side there was a terrible noise from some fan-outlet in the yard. But we were too tired to get dressed again and change the room, so we slept restlessly some hours. The bathroom was not clean, a lot of hair lying around on the floor and in the bath-tub. The only positive thing was that the beds were comfortable and they had tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We had a small balcony, a huge building in front of us but if you looked between these two buildings you could see the sea. But not anyone would like to sit on that balcony without ear-plugs, because of the noise coming from the ground. My guess is that the NCL-cruiseline does not pay very much for the hotel-rooms they have and so the guests end up having the worst rooms in the hotel. This time it did not help any to present our Marriott Rewards card, usually you get a better room with that. The price did not include breakfast, so we had to pay separately for that one. Please also note that the price on the menu is without the service fee, which you must add yourself when you sign the bill. The lobby was very noisy, and our transfer to the ship was late, without any kind of organisation, but that was NCL:s responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mozzyback
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and I had a good stay. The view on the back side was great (24th floor) and even better from the concierge room. The gym was nice with many machines and free weights. The cons: check in took a while in a short line and it took 20 minutes to get my car from valet even though there was no line.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: traveling_cj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Marriott Biscayne Bay during 4 days in August. We got the room on one of higher floors with spectacular views to the bay and the bridge that goes to Miami Beach. If you are party beast you will rather prefer to stay in Miami Beach where all the buzz is taking place. But I was really happy we decided to stay outside Miami Beach as it was quite and still very convenient (we hated the traffic jams and no parking space in Beach area). You will definately need a car to get around (cabs can cost you more than car rental) but the hotel location is perfect - 5 minutes to Miami Beach, 5 minutes to highways entrance that will get you to the Keys or Miami downtown and 5 minutes to Miami Bayside Marketplace (while in Miami you really cannot miss Miami Thriller Powerboat adventure!). The room was spacious and very clean. The bed was large and comfortable. And I loved to end up each night on the little balcony watching the bay and Miami skyscrapers. We tried the restaurant located on the 1st floor of the hotel and found it quite nice - the hamburgers and salads are much better than most of stuff offered at Ocean Drive. There are many shops and little bars on the hotel's ground floor where you can buy food, drinks, magazines, etc. We tried the breakfast for the first day but were not satisfied with it (for the price you pay could be better) but it was no problem for us because there is a nice bar in the lobby with Starbucks coffee and bagels. I tried the swimming pool the other day but it is quite small and crowded (it was the middle of the summer). The only problem I had was the telephone calls charge - we tried to ask for estimated cost of such a call to Europe and nobody could help us , even the operator did not know the answer. They ensured us that the fee is quite standard so the big surprise was at the checkout - for each minute of phonecall to Europe they charged us 20 dollars! It is double the price you pay while calling from satellite phone in the plane! They explained that they are not responsible for those prices as they use some external provider. The only good thing was that we have not made a lot of calls and did not end up paying the fortune. Anyway the overall experience was very good and I would stay there again while visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with top-rate service”
Reviews.Author: rolub
Reviews.Content: No travel itinerary would have put us back home from our honeymoon on the same day we left, so we chose Miami as our layover city and stayed at this Marriott. The rate was very reasonable, and as a Marriott Rewards Member, we were instantly upgraded to a room with a better view (14th floor with partial view of the bay and downtown). The bed was possibly the most comfortable I had ever slept on, but not surprisingly as Marriott does have a reputation for that. The view, as mentioned, was spectacular and a plasma TV with HD service was included. The lone complaint was that a free wifi connection was not included (internet access could be bought on an hourly or daily basis). The highest compliment goes to the front desk service rep who was more than helpful in giving us a dining recommendation. They just as easily could have directed us to one of the hotel's dining options, but provided a list of nearby restaurants. Looking for some Cuban fare, she recommended the Latin Cafe 2000, which was a 10-minute walk away. The food was outstanding and at a very reasonable price. Anyone in need of a one-night stay in Miami without being in the middle of the nightlife would be well off to select this Marriott location.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jade2334
Reviews.Content: First of all its a Marriott. For the most part I like staying at Marriott's, because I love their beds and there rooms are always nice. This hotel was in a good location. Just a train ride away to Bayside Market place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mastcfw
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute for a one night stay. Wonderful hotel. Large spacious room. Wonderful view of the bay. Hotel staff checked us in fast and was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Intolerable Whistle Noise!”
Reviews.Author: bbalak
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott hotels all the time. It really hurts me to write this review, since the hotel is great in every aspect except one - When the wind blows hard, there is a very loud whistling noise that makes falling alseep almost impossible. I don't know if it has something to do with the buildings archetecture, or nearby buildings, but the whistle noise quickly becomes annoying. I stayed for two nights on the 23rd floor while I was at the hotel. I had a wonderful view of the marina from my room. I ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. The food was top notch. I highly recommend the gulf grouper if you decide to eat there. The rooms are very nice and appear to be newly renovated. The iPod alarm clock was a wonderful plus. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows of differing firmness and size. Plenty of outlets for charging phones, laptops, etc. I had no issues with maid service. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to sleep very well due to the whistle. I wish I would have read some of the reviews here prior to staying at the hotel, as I'm not the first to bring up the whistle issue. The bottom line is, the hotel is great, but you won't be able to sleep if the winds are blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Syrigos
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect: It is very conveniently located just across south beach (where most of the action is -just a 5-7' drive), yet you don't have to pay the prices of a South Beach hotel, just because of their location (although personally I think tha Biscayne Bay hotels have a better view, because you can see the South Beach skyline and the bridges). The rooms are very comfortable, with all the amenities, basically anything you'd expect from a Marriott room. Get a room with a bay view, the view is fantastic. The service was immaculate. Anything we wanted, we'd get within minutes! What made our stay exceptional however, was the friendly staff, and especially the Front Desk Manager, Mr. Sergio Lara, a perfect example of everything that Marriott hospitality stands for. He made us feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: travelwitme
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location for us as we did not rent a car. It was close to transportation and to the cruise port. We got around Miami by way of the free people mover tram. It stop at most location downtown Miami you can get a bus to south beach. From the airport MIA a taxi cost about $23 and to the port $10. The hotel was nice, clean the rooms were updated and clean. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The Bay View Grill was not a bad place to eat. If you are going on a cruise and need some last minute things you can shop downtown Miami. There are many places to shop, there is a Macy's, a Marshalls many Walgreen's and cvs's,and Ross and the Bayside Marketplace

Reviews.Title: “Depressing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neutralizer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three nights and enjoyed the beautiful bay view. However, the last night after returning from a long day of work, I turned on the lights and saw a gigantic ROACH on the wall. I called front desk and the agent was in disbelief, she immediately changed me to another room, which was a suite with an incredible 180 degree bay view. I was very impressed with the empowerment given to employees to resolve guest's issues. That is what makes Marriott a safe travel bet. My biggest complain is the hotel charges for everyhing. No free wireless in rooms, no complimentary business center (at least internet usage) and pool was outdated. I prefer the JW Marriott for my future business trips, cleaner and nicer too (plus I get free in room wireless internet). My rate included free breakfast, which was outstanding. I guess I can't complain too much, but I disliked the location of the hotel. and a roach in my room is unacceptable. Need to CHANGE your extermination company.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views - Tough Location”
Reviews.Author: RayPays
Reviews.Content: We only overnighted here. Got in just in time to get some food at the bar and up early after a capaccino in the coffee shop. The rooms were comfortable like you would expect from a Marriott. The place seemed empty as did the convention center it was near. We booked because of price and we loved the night view of the city from our high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: TheSoon2BTraveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Miami for a 2 day stay prior to our cruise boarding at the Miami port. We actually made a reservation at the Eden Roc at Miami Beach for our 2 nights stay prior to the trip. We got to Eden Roc on Saturday, Jun 6, hoping to get a great beach/ocean view in this hotel. Unfortunately, Miami Beach was hit by a severe thunderstorm on the day before this Saturday and the disaster flooded Eden Roc's parking lot. The hotel sent us to Marriott Biscayne Bay downtown for relocation. I was very upset since I wanted to stay in the Miami Beach area. When we got to Marriott Biscayne Bay, the service desk was very friendly and helpful. We told the frontdesk lady about our situation and she took care of us immediately. She was very kind and offered us an ocean view as well as some coupons to use for their dining. Our room was on the 18th floor with an ocean view. We could actually see our Cruise and the Port from where we were! The room was very clean. It had a 37inch LCD TV. The bathroom had a very luxury design on the mirror. They also offered bath and body works shampoo , conditioner as well as body lotion.The gym and the pool was also very nice. Internet is an additional charge though (do not know how much) The location of the hotel wasn't bad either. It was relatively close to a bus station (a 2 - 5 min walk from the lobby) that took us to Miami beach area. The bus ride from there to Miami Beach area (south beach area) was about a 10 - 15 min ride with a bus fare of 2 dollars per person. (We didn't have a car). So the location wasn't bad at all for us since we wanted to spent the 2 days at Miami Beach area anyway. Overall, I loved this hotel and If I were to go to Miami again, I may consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATL23
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this Miami Marriott Hotel. Got a great rate and upon check-in was immediately upgraded to a Corner suite Bay-View room on the 29th floor. The view was amazing! The room was also one of the largest of any Marriott I've stayed at and perfectly clean. Every staff member I encountered was polite and very helpful. The Concierge Lounge on the 31st floor had equally amazing views and a descent food selection. My only complaint with the hotel was the elevator leading to the parking garage. It is very outdated (80's) and makes you feel like you are going to get trapped in it every time. On a couple of occasions I would enter it, the door would close, and it would do nothing. Took several times to get it to move. On another occasion, it got to the Lobby level and the doors rattled for over a minute before finally opening. If you self-park, riding it is your only option, since there are no stairs. I think it is their way of convincing you to pay the extra $$ to valet. For $26 a day / person to self-park, you think they could afford a better elevator by now.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room, fabulous lobby and restaurant; slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: MelissaRaceRunner
Reviews.Content: What we loved the most was the location and the atmosphere at this hotel. We came for a marathon taking place in the city, and also right around the time of the Superbowl, so there was a lot of excitement. - The lobby was very large and open, but easily accessible. The hotel is attached to some shopping and restaurants - we really loved one of the restaurants that was attached - a small steak restaurant. Very cozy and intimate. - The location is ideal for business or getting around downtown. We walked a lot to some local shopping, and then took a bus back. - Our room had a beautiful view, and it was clean and ultra-comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: Jodi_WHL
Reviews.Content: Really nice rooms and a really nice gym - was comfortable place to stay for a longer stay and we got a really good deal. Only problems (and this is why I gave service a low score but general helpfulness and staff friendliness was great) was their lack of sustainable practices - I would have liked to see more effort with recycling bins on each floor....or even in each room and encourage the housekeepers to deal with it separate from trash - there was only one bin at bottom floor in the back, near the cafe where nobody would ever find or see it! Plus, they said they wouldn't replace towels everyday if we hung up our towels (to conserve water) but they replaced them everyday anyway. Suggest anyone staying anywhere pay attention to this and fill out those comment cards! Oh, and Internet pretty expensive and wire only - why can't Marriott install free wireless in all their chains?

Reviews.Title: “Large Comfortable Room and Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: karenyvonne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days during a business trip recently. When I made the reservation I was told that there was no king bed or bayview available. I put in an online request for those if they became available. By the time I got to the hotel I was so exhausted after my lugguage was late and a hour wait to get my reserved rental car that I did not care about the requests I just wanted my room. I was suprised to find out that I did have a room with a huge king bed and a bayview with a lovely balcony with two chairs and a table. Plus as a Marriott Rewards member I also got an arrival gift of my choice (1 beverage & 1 food item or 500 Bonus points). The room was very large, with a chair ottoman, large work desk, small refrigerator (which I'd also requested). The room had many windows was very clean, well decorated and comfortable. I received a complementay breakfast buffet as well which was excellent. The buffet had made to order omelets and waffles, a large variety of fresh fruit, cheeses, breakfast potatoes, hot and cold cereal, granola, yogurt and milk etc. The fitness center was large with plenty of equipment. My only complaint is they did not have 10lb weights. However the hotel did provide fitness equipment for use in my room at my request. The hotel staff was helpful with directions and other questions I had. Overall it was an excellent expeience and I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I am in Miami for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are complete and hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: cory34567
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a pre-cruise stay and couldn't have been more pleased with my choice of hotel. This property was recently renovated and looks fantastic and brand new. I paid over $200 for the night but it was well worth it and would recommend this hotel to any of my closest friends.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel complete, Looking great!”
Reviews.Author: elkameno59
Reviews.Content: Check in to check out- No problems at all. Rooms are all complete and remodeled, all construction is done. A little work being done around the pool area but that looks like they are wrapping that up in a day or so. Problems may have existed during construction but not now. Trip was business. Stay was 4 days. Walking around the hotel is safe and worry free. Walk to train station is less than 2 minutes, walk to street make left and first right and you're at the train/bus stop. Train is free and above ground and will take you most places you need to see or go to. Bus is $2.00 and will take you to Collins ave in south beach. Rooms with a "bay view" are nice for the added price and if you like that bonus- go for it. Rooms that I saw that had the "city view" were nice too, the lights of the city are so nice at night if you are in a room above the 15th floor. You can look at your room if you wish to see what you are getting if needed ( I asked the desk mgr.) No problem with the very attentive staff, especially the guys who work the bellman and cab starter positions, these guys are all over you and your luggage to get you a cab or up to your room. Oh well they need the tips too. Bathroom area is good size but nothing like a "residence inn" but roomy enough, King size bed room is fine with a chair at desk and a reading chair with a ottoman to rest your legs on. TV was a 40 inch or so wide screen HDTV and a great selection of channels to watch. Go to the Bayside shopping area is a great idea for food and tourist shops. Bubba Gump, Hooters, and Hard Rock are the chain food places. A very nice Italian place looked good and of course bars galore with bar food and snacks right at the waters edge, perfect to watch the boats coming and going from the harbor. Very safe here too- many plainclothes officers and uniformed cops all over the place. We were told " do not go west of there" OK we did not and were fine. Panhandlers were few and of course a cop was shagging them out. Walk to the train station is about two blocks and safe for the walkers or catch a cab. We knew a few couples who walked to bayside and took the train back to the hotel, You can see the hotel from the street so it's about 20 minute walk or so. If you want to be in the "action" stay elsewhere on south beach but if you happen to get booked here - its just fine and dandy. We in our group of 200 had hardly any problems to speak of. Internet access in room is 12.95 a day noon to noon and you may have problems with cell phones in the meeting rooms, it was like a cell phone dead zone for some. If I go back to Miami I would consider this hotel again or I'll stay at a Marriott on south beach if there is one because - the beach and night clubs we missed out this trip on.

Reviews.Title: “Disagree with some of the previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: hebnerdo
Reviews.Content: When I found out that we would be staying at this Marriott for a business meeting, I of course, looked at Trip Advisor. I was quite concerned about the reviews I read. We have had no problems...no noise...rooms are on the smaller side but well appointed. From our room we can see the harbor and the bay and when it is clear, actually the ocean. maid service has been good...I wasn't too keen on dinner at the hotel the first night we were there and since have eaten other places. Nemo's and Lario's. Tonight we will eat at Texas de Brazil. Breakfast each morning has been very good. There is a Starbucks on site if you are into that. So all in all our stay has been good. The staff as been attentive. We do have a car in the garage. So cannot speak to that issue. Pool is nice with food service offered. The gym is well equipped. So I am sorry that the other people before me had some issues...we so far have not had any. We have been here 4 days with 3 more to go. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a lot of help...”
Reviews.Author: hotelczar
Reviews.Content: I am from the DC area, and people here are very familiar with Marriott brand. They're headquartered just outside the city in Maryland. Many years ago I worked there, and many years before that my father worked side-by-side with J.W. Marriott Sr. flipping hamburgers at one of their early restaurants. So I have a great fondness for Marriott hotels. Unfortunately, I have to say that this hotel needs a lot of work before it can live up to the Marriott name. Be forewarned that they are in the midst of a renovation at this hotel. All the rooms have been nicely redecorated, but the work continues on the rest of the building. Sadly, I paid extra for a bay view room, but I was never told about the construction when I reserved the room for the New Years holiday. Because of the construction, the sliding glass doors in all the rooms on the bayside have been bolted shut and are inoperable. So there are no bay air breezes. In our room the windows were extremely dirty and so poorly sealed that when the winds picked up, there was a high-pitched whistle that was intolerable. Also, the maid failed to clean the room after my first night's stay. I'm not sure how that happens. The elevators were slow and crowded. So expect long waits. The doors in one elevator car wouldn't even shut with out some manual assistance. Also, the elevator to and from the garage is very dirty and malodorous. My kid insisted on holding his breath every time we got in it. It was somewhat pathetic. When I pay over $300 a night for a room, I expect a better class of accommodations. I don't think what I received was worth more than $200. While the front desk staff were professional, helpful and good natured, the management was not overly generous when it came to restitution. In their defense, they did move us to a room on the poolside of the hotel and agreed to knock off $50 from the first night's stay, but it took a few of trips to the front desk to get it all straightened out. I suspect that once the construction is completed, this will be a very nice hotel and once again worthy of Marriott name, but until then, I would advise you to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location for cruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: iowa24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a pre night of a cruise leaving from the Port of Miami. This hotel is very close to the port and also is walking distance to Bayside (shopping/restaurant area near port). The room we had was recently renovated and the only thing I noticed that was NOT done yet in the renovations was the painting outside which meant ladders and ropes in front of some windows. All room decor is new and very nice, also new flat screen tvs. Coffee maker in room, excellent fitness room with a wide variety of equipment. Self parking was $26 a day. Mr Marriott made a visit while we were there so I am sure the place was looking it's best! I would stay there again for sure when needing a dowtown Miami or pre night cruise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great beds - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ustwoDevon
Reviews.Content: we had a 1 night stay here before boarding QM2 for a cruise. after a long flight it was great to crawl into the most comfortable bed i have slept in!!! lovely room overlooking the harbour. fantastic. lovely staff. very very clean. would stay here again - even for just a good nights sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: DylanThomas71
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a very underwhelming experience for a Marriott. The hotel is undergoing a significant refit internally and externally and there is constant noise and drilling from 9 to 5 Monday through to Saturday. There is no warning of this on the hotel's website and it came as a shock upon arrival. Got a nice room on a high floor only to discover that due to the construction the window was covered in muck and a struggle to see out across the bay. The restaurant service was poor and abrupt. This again was a disappointment compared to the many Marriotts that I have stayed in. The lounge is small and not anything special. The only redeeming point was the location, the comfortable rooms and a nice pool area with quiet areas to relax (but only on a Sunday). However overall this place is one to avoid for the next few months until the work has finished.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall, a few hangups..”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraPHL
Reviews.Content: Well, my bf is really good at getting hotel room upgrades. We were scheduled to have a suite, however as he came back with the news that we had been upgraded to thePresidential Suite it got even better! The hotel overall was a bit dated including the pool area, however the views are out of this world & it's only a short taxi ride over to South Beach. Service across the board was friendly & efficient. Everything was super clean, bed was awesome blah blah... typical nice experience stuff. The only bad parts were that they don't offer 24 hour room service & after reading all the pizza hut pizza options to be delivered before 11pm via room service it turned into torture! In addition, the balcony railing was to say the least not secure. Also we had a mishap with the concierge, they assured us they would send out a package to arrive in PHL next day, however they never called to have the box picked up!

Reviews.Title: “I probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: KarmelDST
Reviews.Content: Before going to Miami, I read just about every review about this hotel that I could get my hands on. None of them were favorable, however, our friends were also staying at this hotel and we all wanted to stay together. I won't be going back to this hotel. The room was old and outdated. It also had a sliding door leading outside that didn't work, and an extremely small bathroom. In spite of the room, the hotel staff were all very nice and helpful. The best part of the hotel was that it was connected to some small shops and small restaurants. Unfortunately, they all closed at the same time and I missed dinner one night because of it.

Reviews.Title: “My head still ringing from the construction noise”
Reviews.Author: winebot
Reviews.Content: Was definitely underwhelmed. Choose this place if you like a) construction noise, including a drill that started up in the room directly above us, b) cheesy decor, c) disinterested staff, and d) lame location in a city with so much to offer. My wife and I switched to the Palms in South Beach and only then felt like our vacation had actually begin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for two nights and was quite happy with that stay. The room was nicely renovated with the very comfortable Marriott bedding package, new furnishings and a huge flat screen TV with the new plug-in panel. Very nice idea Marriott came up with there - making it easy to connect your MP3 to the TV to enjoy your own music. The room offered a small balcony and some good though partial views of the Biscayne Bay. Service seemed efficient and up to Marriott standards. Easy check-in and check-out with friendly staff. I did not try the restaurant on site - but there is one if you need it. There also is a very nice little Deli with good take-away right next door in the Doubletree hotel - directly connected to the Marriott. Otherwise the public areas seemed rather unimpressive. The location was very good - only a short cab ride or drive from downtown and bayside as well as Miami Beach. The area directly around the hotel though I found to be rather drab and nowhere I would really like to walk around. Overall quite nice with nicely renovated rooms and not far from anything but certainly not directly in the best neighbourhood so that you need to drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: DeanWinchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, and found it very comfortable. The view from the window was stunning, as it looked out over the bay; no balcony (although I hear there are balconies on the other side of the building). We stayed 4 to a room, and found that we were not too over-crowded as the room was large and had two double beds as well as chairs, desk etc. Bathroom was clean, and it was all tidied daily. The food was adequate; despite having to pay extra for it. It was not the cheapest I've ever had but it was nice food. The waiter service was poor; we were left waiting to order for a long time each morning. The location is fine - closer to the centre would be nice, but we had a hire car so it did not matter to us. However, the cost of parking there is ridiculously high. If you go without a car, apparently there is a good train system nearby which can get you anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: csokey
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Marriott Hotel for our pre-cruise stay, the service was GREAT... Starting with the bellman, ready to provide service and making sure our bags were delivered to our room right away. The clerk at the service desk provided excellent service. Our room was located on the 30th floor; the derco was very inviting, the flat screen TV and bathroom, made the stay more pleasurable. And the VIEW from the sliding door balcony, over looked the bay, Port of Miami was more that we expected. We had a clear view of the cruise ships and all of Downtown/ South Beach area. We wanted steak for lunch and the bellman suggested a great resturant in the strip maill on the first floor near the Doubletree hotel. THe FREE train rail system was a block away, which took us all over miami... Only small issue was the moring noise from the construction work on site., very minor... We enjoyed our stay and will return if in Miami again. C. Moore Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ellenbrook
Reviews.Content: An excellent pre cruise stay of three nights. Excellent location overlooking the cruise port with a small marina infornt of the hotel courtyard.
