The hotel was clean and the staff helpful and polite. Hotel room was large and comfortable and once again very clean. A small pool area with hot tubm with adequate sun deck. A small shopping mall located under cover between the Doubletree Hotel and Marriott was a great bonus with a small number of restayurants and bars offering a choice of good food options. Would recommend the hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: bushmustgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon and were very pleasantly surprised. The young lady in registration kindly upgraded us to the concierge level with its spectacular views of Miami Beach. The room itself was average and the $24 parking fee absurd. But the exhibitionist woman in the hi-rise condo across the street more than made up for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Decently close to Cruise Ships, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: TravelsUnlimited
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a major renovation. We stayed in room 404 which was completed. The room was very clean and decorated in soft colors. The room had a sliding door, but no balcony to speak of since it was about a six inch ledge; but it was good to open the door and see the marina. The flat screen TV was really nice and the beds extremely soft. There are not a lot of options for dining in the close proximity. There are a few options in the adjoining Doubletree Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate Marriott”
Reviews.Author: pipeman28
Reviews.Content: While not the best Marriott I've ever stayed at, this hotel is perfectly adequate. The staff was great. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good, but I can't recomend lunch or dinner there. Unfortunately there aren't many other options for food in the vicinity. That said, there is a free elevated rail service that can take you to most anywhere downtown town for other dining options. The location is fine for downtown business, and the bus to South Beach (and other environs) is very close and convenient. A caution: As of this writing (7/08) there is significant renovation happening at the hotel. Make sure you get a room away from the construction. Our room was fine, but we had friends staying in other rooms that complained of the noise and inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: dbgal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel...clean and in a great location...felt safe and nice to watch the boats in the marina and the cruise ships docking. Pool was on the small side but ok. Rooms themselves could use some work...a bit outdated and small. The "balcony" is just a ledge overlooking the water on the bay side. The rooms on the side of the building have real balconies. Plenty of restaurants nearby and some shopping The Deli downstairs was wonderful!!! Overall we were pleased. Nice for one or two nights while waiting for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayvee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of Marriott points. This hotel is below the standards of what a Marriott should be. The rooms are old, the carpet smells and so do many of the floors we were on. The bathroom is out-dated, no little extras like Q-tips, hair net for the shower, no exhaust fan and old fixtures. Garbage pails are plastic with no liners, restaurants were terrible - fruit was not ripe but served anyway and meats/fish were dry, overcooked and overpriced. Service was slow, cleaning people did only the basic-but they were very fast to open your car door and wait for a tip. We were so very dissapointed in this hotel and I would never stay there again. Big mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Just a nice location”
Reviews.Author: ichaves25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the second week of april due to a conference that was taking place here. I must say the hotel has a great location specially if you are not renting a car, itÂ´s just in front of the Onmi terminal and from there you can have access to pretty much anywhere in Miami. However the hotel is a little overpriced. The rooms look kind of old, and the carpet was terribly dirty. Bed was comfortably and the view I got was excellent, partial bay view and partial city view. The service was not good at all, from the mess up check in until the 40 minutes waiting for a band aid to get to my room.... IÂ´m coming to Miami on november again and I will definitely not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: This is an 'average' Marriott, so still more than acceptable, even if not likely to be the best expereince in your life. The hotel interior looks a little dated (lobby, corridors etc.) but the rooms were decorated to usual marriott standard. Managed to get a move to a room facing the bay on 26th floor and the views were of course amazing. Staff were friendly enough though I found that the restaurant staff were very obsessed with making sure they got the 'right' gratuity. I know gratuities are important n the US but here they seemed overly concerned with this. We used the pool once as well and it was fine, though a little cold. I was a bit annoyed that over the weekend they closed the club lounge (I'm a Marriott elite member so this provides me and my family with free breakfast/snacks). This struck me as an unnecessarily cheap thing to do. When I complained I was give some breakfast vouchers but had I not done so I wouldnt have had any. Didnt expect to have to pay 25 USD to park per day (actually I paid 28 for lobby parking) but there is little in the way of competeng parking nearby and that which is available is same price. So overall it was fine - Marriott's usually are - and it wouldnt be a disaster to stay there again with my familly - but i'd probably look elsewhere first

Reviews.Title: “Great for night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl019
Reviews.Content: Clean room , upgraded bedding, with excellent view of the bay. We had booked with a special AAA rate of $130 per night, I can't imagine paying the online rate for this hotel, it was nice, but not up to the price listed for the room. The mall area between the Marriott and The Doubletree had several shops for items you may have forgotten and a nice deli/bakery.The front desk staff was exceptional in giving us info for visiting South Beach for dinner. I would enjoy staying here again before a cruise. We checked out, grabbed a cab and were at the port in about 15 minutes total.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms!!! Horrible Restaurant and Room Service”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for Pre/Post Cruise from the Port of Miami. It is about 2 miles from the port. The lobby and front reception area is very clean and well cared for. Valet and baggage assistance is hit or miss but efficient overall. Rooms: Rooms are very nice and I recommend you ask for a room with a balcony facing the cruise port. Allthough most of the rooms have side views of Biscayne Bay on both sides of the hotel you have either high rise residential condos or the doubletree on the north side. Some of the rooms have the strange entry configuration and the bathrooms are small for Marriott standards. Room Service/Restaurant: Geez what can I say? This department is incredibly lacking in both efficiency and anything else for that matter. Ordered 2 Cuban Sandwiches and 2 orders of Fried Plaintains. Took 1 hour 20 minutes. Cuban Sandwiches are pretty simple to make and authentic cuban sandwiches even don't take over an hour to make. When she finally arrived she practically wiped out my laptop and just wisked passport and papers right off the table to make room for the tray. (Another one of those Marriotts that don't believe in leaving the guests anything to eat off except those ackward trays. She was pretty taken back about my discontent about my documents and my laptop being whisked off the table like it was no problem to just disconnect my laptop from the internet without even asking or even providing a response to my 3 repeated requests for the table to eat on. I spoke to another guest in the elevator on the way up from the lobby and they said that they had pretty horrible service in the restaurant. At the time of the review I ordered 2 Cookies and Creams Ice Creams over 40 minutes ago!!! Definetly up to the Marriott standard of service in regards to the Food and Beverage Department. Would I stay here again? Probably not, unless going out of the port of miami again on another cruise, and even then I would eat out somewhere instead of trusting this hotel to ever deliver what the Marriott name has come to mean to a Marriott loyalist.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here ... there are much better hotels in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatl
Reviews.Content: Second to none??? Yeah ... I haven't stayed at such a bad hotel in ages. Standing in the lobby some papers I was reviewing got wet ... condensation dripping from the ceiling. Internet technology so outdated that the technician had to come each of the two days I stayed to fix the box and get me connected (a colleague had the same issue). As a bonus, I had to re-start my computer three times ... just what a business traveler wants. Staff not helpful. Asking for a drug store, the concierge sent me blocks away in a taxi, only to later find out that there is a pharmacy in the shopping area attached to the hotel. The room ... standard, but my non-smoking room had been smoked in and I ran out of toilet paper. Used the laundry service, and got my underwear back squished into a ball, all rumpled and still damp. And the caper ... I watched a movie, or tried to. Halfway through, I used the pause function. After a short while, the movie disappeared from my screen, and I was given these choices: Start over, or let it be and get a 10% discount. Ah, after protesting, I also got an apology and the discount was increased to 20%. This place isn't worthy of the Marriott name.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're here before or after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: knoxvillegranny
Reviews.Content: lower level Marriott. Fine if you are here before or after a cruise. Otherwise go across the bay to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott quality - terrible neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PAtrip
Reviews.Content: Full Service Marriott in the middle of no where - if that is possible in a major city. It looks like this area had great plans, there is a Hilton and Doubletree near by. But the closed down mall, lack of restaurants, no shopping make you feel silly being in Miami with nothing around. Stay here on business to get your points and plan on eating in the hotel or taking a cab everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Well this is supposed to be a full service Marriott (with prices to match). I stayed for 3 nights with a convention. Notes: 1. Location is not great. Its nice on the bay but there is very little in walking distance. 2. Pool area is not particularly pleasant. Its kind of squashed in and the Doubletree next door looked much nicer. 3. The gym is small pokey and on three floors and, for the 1st time in many years, I opted to go jogging rather than use the gym. My knees still hurt! 4. The Internet didn't work in my initial room. It took a couple of hours messing around to get to the point. The hotel changed my room efficiently but it was hassle. 5. My new room had some stuff wrong but I couldn't be bothered to report it. Its fine for a conference or a quick stay but its not up to normal Marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards!”
Reviews.Author: se2121
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott snob and I was highly disappointed by this hotel. My wife and I stayed here February 22-24, 2008 because we were in town for the South Beach Wine & Food Fest. We try to stay at Marriott's whenever we travel based on our past positive experiences and their reputation. This was the worst Marriott we have ever stayed at. As we arrived, we entered the parking garage which was disgusting. I know it's a parking garage but it smelled like it belonged in NYC (no offense). The parking garaged was disgustingly dirty. I know it's a parking garage but at least paint the walls so they don't look so gross. The elevator and it's fixtures were also outdated, smelled, and were dirty. The lobby seemed nice, the hotel appears to be a layover hotel for cruise guests, airline employees, or business persons for conferences at the hotel. I couldn't imagine anyone staying here for vacation. The check-in was quick and we were upgraded to a bay view from a city view. The bay view was gorgeous however I don't quite understand why all other rooms that were not bay view rooms had a nice little deck. The bay view rooms have a sliding glass door that leads out to a 3 inch faux balcony. This was kinda disappointing. The room was also pretty nasty. The carpet was old and crusty and I actually walked around with sandals on which I never do. The television was outdated, no flatscreen here. The walls probably got pained over a couple years ago and look fine. There was nice crown molding by the sliding doors which was a nice touch. Now comes the bathroom from the 70's. The tile was old and not very nice. The bathroom and tub were also not very nice. Pool was nice and heated, hot tub was good too. I'm sorry but not a nice Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre/Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonymoco
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed being able to see the cruise ships come and go from my room before my cruise. It really got me psyched and also a bit more prepared. My room request recommendation would be for a room WITH a full balcony (w/table and chairs) on the cruise terminal side of the hotel as close to the water as possible on a high floor. Note: the rooms with the most expansive bay views - - which the hotel charges more for -- do NOT have balconies....although they have a sliding glass door opening onto a tiny railed-in ledge and those views are indeed the best. The hotel was very accomodating to my need for any early check-in (10am) after my cruise, and a staff member told me that they try to be very responsive to this. Finally, they have a self serve laundry for guests and a business center with pay internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but restaruant....”
Reviews.Author: StephM76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel is located right by the port and the transportation to the port the following morning was easy. The guest rooms were nice and our room overlooked the bay/ports. Bed was comfortable. I really enjoyed watching the sunrise in the morning. We also ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel and found the service to be lacking and the food was average (it was dead that night). Went again for breakfast and found that the service was a better and food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in December for one night prior to a cruise. The room was very nice and very clean. Yes, the rooms were a little outdated, however, they were very clean and the staff at the front desk and restaurant were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: RaCoLo
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Biscayne Bay Marriott after renting a car at the airport. Beware of the bill for parking and telephone, be sure to ask what each individual call would cost!! I ended up paying $70 for a 2 minute long distance phone call!! Hotel is located in a nice area near bayside mall and the american airlines arena with good access to all areas of Miami. Hotel is about a 25 minute ride from the airport with about $20-$25. Room Service food was average and the bathroom looks a little outdated. Great front desk staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: austraveller29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night post cruise and found it more than adquate. Upon check in a lovely staff member took it upon himself to ensure we had a port view which was awesome and really got us excited for the next day. All the staff were friendly and answered any queries. Went to Bayside for dinner which was fun but didn't use hotel restuarants at all so comment. After a great nights sleep we checked out at 10.30 and caught a taxi to the port. We were sitting down to lunch on the ship and 12.15pm. Very convenient and more than adequate for a pre-cruise night. Warning we had to return a hire care and ended up in some pretty scary neighbourhoods where we had to fill up with petrol. Would not stray to far from port area or hotel at this end of town but as I said we just wanted a good comfortable nights rest before boarding the ship. Would recommend this hotel for cruisers. Having travelled through USA for a few weeks this was definitely one of the better hotels as far as decor not nearly as bad as people try to make you think.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is great”
Reviews.Author: Aussie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Biscayne Bay on Jan 8th for two nights. We had two rooms as we are a family with four teenagers. We had come from orlando ( theme parks etc ) and the comfortable beds of the Marriott were very welcoming. The location is very easy for South Beach and the Bayside area very near the hotel was great. Bayside has all the chain eateries inc chilis, bubba's and hard rock cafe, to name but a few. We have stayed at this hotel before and we would stay here again. Ok it may be getting a little tired but the comfort and staff certainly make up for that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: I truly cannot understand what in the world people are complaining about. I can tell you that I was told that the hotel is going to undergo a major renovation in the next few months for all of you who have complained about the decor. We stayed here pre and post cruise. We had a very, very comfortable stay. The bed was plush. The bathroom is definitely small and looked old, but it was nothing that concerned us. Each morning we woke up to this incredible view of the harbor and port. I cannot even begin to explain how beautiful this view is. There is one restaurant on property. We had dinner there and thought that the food was very good. We also ordered room service and it was promptly delivered and tasted delicious. We had concierge access which is on the 26th floor. The view from this room is also incredible and panoramic. The balcony in our room on both occasions opened up. You cannot sit out there, but at least you can open it up for fresh air. Every staff member from the bellmen to the front desk to housekeeping and everyone else in between were so nice and polite. Across from the hotel is the old omni mall which was shut down about 10 yrs ago. There are huge plans to reopen the mall with target and other stores. The amount of building going on in the area is astounding. The hotel is right next to a doubletree, so it is easy to get it confused if you are driving from the airport. The signage from the street is not very clear. At one point our taxi driver when we returned from our cruise wasn't even sure if it was the right driveway. You will see what i mean if you go.... Make sure you get exact directions written down from the internet and take them with you before you get behind that wheel. I am really good with directions and actually ended up lost for a few minutes because i forgot my internet directions from the hotel's website and was relying on what the hotel was trying to explain to me. They were explaining correctly, but i was on a long flight and got turned around. The hotel's interior did look older, but that did not distract from us from having a very relaxing, quiet and uneventful stay. The bed itself was extremely comfortable. The hotel is on a small dock at the marina. It is nice walking out there. There are also tables to sit and enjoy the view. There is also a little place downstairs that sells quick food items. We did take a look at the pool and spa. They both looked nice, but we did not have time to use them. I am sure that if you got a room and it smelled, the hotel would change your room. Plus, you can open the balcony door for fresh air which i thought was great. I would recommend this hotel in a second. I cruise a lot out of miami and will definitely return when i am there again.

Reviews.Title: “Something(s) very wrong”
Reviews.Author: LurkerBR
Reviews.Content: I'm wondering how and why people love this place so much. It is a huge hotel, staff really is friendly but: - Decoration sucks. Seems like if you are in an Orlando Hotel in the 60's. Rooms also smell old. - The restaurant emploees had dirty uniforms and a quick carefull look at place allows anyone to notice how much dirt there is. Check under the lamps for youself.... - The "gym" is old, equipments are cracking and many of the free weights missing. It really seemed very strange to me for this hotel to have so many 4+ stars reviews. That' was the reason why I booked it. It was a huge disapointment.. That's why I decided to write this.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: As others have noted the hotel is beginning to show some age, I'm not opposed to the one reviewer's comments stating they could use a renovation. The hotel is downtown, and has great access to the roads leading to both South Beach and MIA airport (I of course flew into FLL). The hotel itself seemed safe, but I wouldn't go venturing out unarmed and on foot after dark. My stay was average at best. I arrived to find a cruise line group checking in. The line was out the door, and I followed a co-worker that lied and said we were Marriott Rewards Platinums at check-in. Otherwise, judging from the length of the line, he and I would have missed our company's dinner meeting. A true test of a hotel's age seems to be its elevator cabins, and yes you can tell this hotel has been there a while. Though in saying that they've made great efforts at keeping things clean. The guestroom was on the average to small side, but my 26th floor room had a door that opened up. Though lacked a balcony. The door just opened to a railing. So it was nice to get some fresh, humid air. The bed was comfortable and had quality linens. The bathroom was functional, but seemed really old. I was not impressed with the shower head. Parking was a pain, and having come back late from dinner their small self park garage was filled to near capacity. I was alarmed to find on the 4/5th floor of the parking garage an area with old carpet. I could only imagine the mold growing there and wondered why the hotel would be storing this. The staff was courteous at check-in and check-out, but as with the cruise group and a sports team checking in, be prepared to wait if they're overwhelmed. I did not eat at the hotel this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came down to Miami for a night for some personal business. Have always enjoyed staying at Marriotts, feel they are generally well-located, nicely-maintained, hubs of activity. Compared to others, this Marriott needs a redo. Thought the location was fine, on the bay in the Omni district, but the lobby, guestroom corridors, and guestroom itself looked tired and old. The room did have the new Marriott Revive bed, which was totally comfortable, but the room's other furniture needs to be replaced. Hotel didn't have wifi (need to use a cable wire provided in a bag in the closet) so I instead used the hotel's business center. which which was 24-hour (accessed with a room key). This was a good amenity, as i needed to be up late working on some items. Grabbed a bite in a market located in one of the adjacent condo towers, food was pretty good, although they were closing, so i ate in the business center. Ordered early room service the next morning which came on time but was awful (the pecan french toast) and super-overpriced. All in all, a decent stay, but hotel definately needs some freshening.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Stayed here for pre and post cruise.”
Reviews.Author: honey40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before driving up to Orlando then another night before going on a cruise. The hotel was very busy with plenty of people coming and going. The staff were very friendly and helped with any questions we had. We had a room for a family of 4 which had 2 double beds and it cost Â£74 each night which I thought was excellent value for money. If you have your own car with you then BEWARE, they charge $24 per day for parking which I did think was pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: nrh
Reviews.Content: We booked this property for a one night stay prior to a cruise because it had gotten above average reviews here on Trip Advisor. I had reserved two rooms. One for myself and my husband (king) and one for my two teenage boys (doubles). Their internet reservation system did not allow me to put my kids in a room without an adult. I was concerned that the front desk was going to give me an issue about it too and we would have to play the "key switch game". They didn't give us any grief at check in at all. They even moved our rooms to be a little closer together. (They did not have anything adjoining, but at least they got us on the same floor.) Our rooms were a little small, but they were clean and had lovely linens and comfy beds. Both of the rooms had a nice view, but the boys really scored with a view of the cruise ships. I enjoyed being able to sit out on my balcony and do my nails and watch people swimming in the pool while my husband took a quick nap. We ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant. I can't remember what it was called, but it had a nice view of their marina and the food was passable hotel food. I had a good salad and my husband enjoyed his burger. Any time he can get one that's not burnt to a crisp, he's happy. My older son had pasta and thought it was good. I can't remember what my younger son ate, but he would have complained - loudly - if it had been bad. The bell manager was also greatly helpful in tracking down the suitcase that Continental had sent off to Denver or some such nonsense. He stayed on top of things until it was delivered to the hotel... finally calling my room (as I'd requested) at 3 a.m. to let me know it had arrived safely. We ate breakfast at the hotel again. Similar food quality. I can't speak for the buffet. I don't like them. Too germy. :) We bipassed the enormous throngs of cruise passengers waiting for busses, had one of the valet staff hail us a taxi, and went merrily on our way to the port. We will use this hotel again the next time we're in Miami for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great views...but there were issues...”
Reviews.Author: YzGi
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 recently stayed 2 nights at the Marriott BB. We were crusing out of Miami so this seemed like a good place to stay from the reviews I read. There was some confusion as to my room rate upon arrival (this was Marrriotts fault) but we did get that straightened out. The vews were great! You could look right off of your "romeo/juliet balcony and see the port. We watched our ship pull in the next morning, it was awesome! We had one dinner and one breakfast at the hotel. The dinner portions were huge and delish. The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey but one of the best I've ever eaten at. There was a very nice coffee bar in the lobby area that was open from around 6 until 1pm that had Starbucks coffee..and some great danishes. The negatives were: our room did NOT hold 4 people comfortably. We felt like sardines! Also, the bathroom had no vent in it so after a shower, you had to wait 30 minutes for the BR to clear up. If you purchased the internet, it was in 24 hr increments so we went down to the business center as we only needed it for a total of 10 minutes. any questions, feel free to email me :) Yzgi

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DFT07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, nice view from the balcony over the bay, the staff were pleasant, the room was of a reasonable size and quite comfortable. As with a lot of hotels in the US you had to pay for everything, parking, internet etc. Location is quite good its close to malls and the bayfront area and a short drive to south beach.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beegeeLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Marriott for 6 days in May with a group of 14. The check-in was a nightmare and our rooms were all over the building and not on one floor as we wanted. The person checking us in was also not prepared to see if this would be possible for later in the week. However, after this experience, things got better. The rooms were a bit small and depending on the lay-out, there was not much room for storing luggage etc. My parents had a corner room which was great with more space and great views. The views were amazing. The staff were extremly helpful througout our stay, whether it was in the restaurant, the bell boys or reception staff, everyone was friendly and asking if we needed anything. The decor of the general areas is a bit dated. Overall, good hotel at great location with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stumbled Early, But Worked Hard To Make Amends”
Reviews.Author: JBF1964
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Rewards members, but normally are in the Fairfield or Courtyard price range. But, we were coming home from a cruise out of the Miami port, and wanted to treat ourselves. We booked online through the Marriott site and my rewards number, finding a package for "pre or post" cruisers which included transportation and breakfast. But, just to be sure, I called the hotel a couple of weeks before the trip to find out how they would pick us up at the port (we were first time cruisers). I had to go through two front desk people who didn't understand that we were staying at the end of the cruise and needed to be picked up at the port before I finally got to a customer service rep, named Julisa, and we got it straightened out. It seems most folks use this package when leaving for a cruise rather than at the end. We also had a minor glitch on the rate. Julisa seemed confused about the rate I had booked, but I informed her about the code and where I saw it on the site. I also reminded her nicely that I was a Marriott Rewards member, but could just as easily "cross the street" to Hilton or somebody else if there was a problem. She said there were some errors in rate codes on the site, but they would glady honor the rate for what we needed. WIth little hesitation, she was able to get things straighted out, let me know how to get transporation from the port (just call and a bellman picked us up) and she said she would arrange to block a room out so we could check in early since our cruise was returning around 8 a.m. There we no problems when we actually arrived in port on July 27. We called as soon as we had our luggage and we had a limo at the curb within 15 min. The bellman who was driving was very helpful and advised us about a 3 hour city tour if we were interested (we were) and he could help arrange it. Once we arrived, we did learn that the room was not quite ready yet, but were offered breakfast if we wanted. We decided instead to take the city tour at 10 am to give them more to get the room prepared. The bellman offered to store the luggage and said he would take it up to the room when it was ready and he did. When Julisa, who was on duty when we checked in, learned I was there, she came over personally, remembered our phone conversation and made sure everything was they way we wanted. We were very satisfied, up to that point, and then went on to the three hour tour which we recommend if you just want a quick view of Miami (South Beach, Little Havana). But, the best was yet to come. When we came back from the tour and checked in, we kept hearing them refer to our room as a "suite." For whatever reason, we got upgraded from a room to a suite, at no additional charge. My wife commented the bathroom was almost as big as the stateroom on our ship. The suite was complete with a sitting area, a dining table, a mini-fridge as well as a comfy queen size bed. We also took advantage of the hotel's poolside bar/lunch service and relaxed and prepared for our flight home the next delay. As a Marriott member, I was also offered a choice of "freebies": one night free internet, one day of parking, or a free movie on pay per view. We chose the movie, and they took it right back off the bill with no problem at check out. The only glitch we had was the keyboard for the internet on tv was not working. But, a quick call to the front desk and the maintaince people were up in a flash and it was repaired ASAP. Also, unlike Fairfield, they don't have a free internet computer in the lobby. They have a business center where you can access the net at .25 a minute and print out pages at $1 each. I guess they figure most of their business comes from people on expense accounts, but we needed to check in for our flight and print boarding passes. Our room was on a high floor, overlooking the bay, so not only did we have a nice room, we had a really great view. I almost regret we didn't have more time to spend in Miami. Without having to go outside, there's a selection of places to eat and pick up a few grocery items next door at the Doubletree. After having dinner at a Chinese fine dining place, we bought some fresh baked desserts and milk to take back to the room and enjoy along with the free movie. The breakfast was good, with a buffet including a variety of hot items. It was nothing fancy, but there was plenty of breakfast meats, eggs, fruits, baked goods, cereal along with juice and coffee. While in the room, I came across a book that I guess Marriott puts in all their rooms with stories about their people and how they make a difference. You can add Julisa to the list. All she had to do was to make sure we had the transporation and the breakfast and of course the room we paid for and we would have been happy. But, if you're trying to bolster brand loyalty, she made all ther right moves.

Reviews.Title: “Super Great Hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gmm13067
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriot Biscayne Bay was fantastic! Every staff member is friendly and overly accomodating. The hotel itself is well kept, clean, and beautiful. The view of the bay is breathtaking, especially at night. The front desk clerk allowed us to view three rooms before we settled on the one we liked best. The valets are extremely helpful and knowledgeable when selecting transportation. The hotel restaurant, Bayside Grill, is wonderful and everything we ordered was delicious and large portioned. An economical but delicious breakfast can be found at the small pastry cafe on the first floor. Overall, this hotel bypassed our expectations by a mile! I can't wait to stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone! Tip: Ask the hotel to get dinner reservations for you at Soprano's Cafe on Lincoln Road. A free limo will pick you up and bring you back. The meal will be great and the people watching is interesting. You can walk aroud and explore Lincoln Road before taking the limo back to the hotel. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Average Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravlinGurl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeklong stay in Miami and have to say that we were not very impressed with this hotel. My boyfriend works for Marriott so we were able to get a room here for a decent rate, but this is the type of hotel that will charge for EVERY little thing you can imagine. There was no free high-speed internet connection, which is pretty standard in nice hotels these days. Instead they were trying to charge something like $15.00 a day for it which we thought was crazy. When looking up the hotel online, I'm pretty sure that the site said a mini fridge was in each room also, and this was nowhere to be found. I agree with others who said the room was incredibly tiny also. The only thing I can say was impressive was the view from the rooms. We stayed on the 22nd floor and although I was scared to step out on the balcony, looking out onto the bay was a great sight.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night for a business function the following day, but my experience was excellent and would lead me to recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to the Miami area. I'm an elite Marriott Rewards member and it can really be hit or miss with the hotels recognizing your elite status. This property gets plenty of kudos for immediately recognizing my status, upgrading me to the concierge level with a room overlooking the Bay and MacArthur Causeway. Conveniently located near the business district, AA Arena, and not far from South Beach or the cruise terminal. Would stay here again next time in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the marriott”
Reviews.Author: alt9171964
Reviews.Content: stayed at the marriott biscayne bay prior to a cruise in may. stayed here the prior year for a cruise and service and amenities are still top notch. stayed on one of the upper floors had a great view of the bay. front desk personnel and restaurant personal were great. decent location rode the people mover to various stops in miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahmarie
Reviews.Content: The price was right so that I cannot complain about. We wanted something that offered a shuttle to the port and that the Marriott did. When we arrived we had a view to the left of the port and couldnt see the ships. It basically was a view of the pools and some yachts. However still nice. The balcony was big and the window was HUGE! No continental breakfast, free internet. There was a restuarant in the hotel and we ate there as soon as we checked in. Our hamburgers were really good but wow, almost $10.00 for one! The bed was the highlight. MOST COMFORTABLE bed I have ever slept in. All down! Amazing. We'd stay again but maybe they can offer a free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swim4speed
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good downtown location, right next to the bay. The bellhop was friendly and volunteered information regarding the hotel and city. The room was nice with two double beds, newer carpeting, newer bedding, and bayside windows. The beds were very comfortable! So comfortable that I looked to see what brand mattress it was. It wasn't a brand I recognized, so I forgot the name already. The gym looked okay, with several different cardio machines and some weights. Of course we all know we cannot expect much from a hotel gym. Overall, we really liked our stay here and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: My job as a travel agent affords me the luxury of being able to stay at different locations throughout the year. On a recent trip, I had the opportunity to stay here. The service was wonderful, the room spotless and spacious and the bed was the most comfortable I've slept on! From my 29th floor balcony I had an amazing view. The pool area was clean and well-kept. There is a variety of restaurants to satisfy everyone. Shopping is just a short taxi ride away. I am going on a cruise in October and have already made reservations to stay here the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Nice Nice”
Reviews.Author: ajjohnson1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Of course its a little costly but its better to stay at a nice place than just anywhere. The staff is very helpful and very friendly. My only problem was that I didnt get the room I paid for. I booked the deluxe bay view on the concierge level/executive level, but was much lower. Other than that, its a great place. The beds are amazing and tooooo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Randy was Great to us”
Reviews.Author: KrnAndJoe
Reviews.Content: We flew a red-eye from Long Beach, CA to Ft Lauderdale, Fl on Jet Blue. We were tired upon early morning arrival and feared we would not be able to check into our hotel, but the Marriot Biscayne Bay gave us an early check it AND they upgraded our room to concierge level w/a gorgeous view of the Bay AND all the breakfast, snacks, coffee and bar items we could want from the Concierge lounge for free! Needless to say we had a great time there! It was clean, comfortable and lovely. Three days later we drove to Key Largo and checked into the Azul Del Mar. We stayed in the Seaview King room which had a kitchen sink, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and dishes/utensils. The bathroom was small, but everything else was clean and spacious. Every morning a basket of warm pastries and yogurt arrived on our doorstep and we enjoyed them in bed or overlooking the ocean. We had dinner at the very busy Hobo's and it was ok. I would not eat at Captain "somethings" Fish and Chips shack--they would not let me bring my bottled water in even though I said I was pregnant and would only be drinking water. The "hostess" said they sold bottled water and I'd have to buy theirs. I wish I could remember the name of this "restaurant" that was promptly left. Tower of Pizza was pretty good. Anyway, after enjoying John Pennekamp state park snorkeling, we drove back to South Beach and stayed at The Standard. That was a DUMP! The spa, pool and dining were nice, but the building and accommodations were not that clean or nice compared to their website. The front desk check-in service was sub par. Prior to flying back on an early flight, we spent one night at the Hilton Ft. Lauderdale Airport. It was affordable, clean, comfortable and convenient. Nice music by the pool, snacks in the lobby area and a 24hr complimentary airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Spacious and Modern”
Reviews.Author: jph948
Reviews.Content: We wanted something close to the water and downtown. After reading other reviews, we booked the Marriott. We had picked up a rental car at MIA and drove the 7 miles to the hotel. The lobby has a small gift shop and there's a 4 level parking garage attached. The room itself was on the sixth floor (out of 31) with a king bed and plenty of room. The views were out to the bay and the city (see attached). We don't do breakfast so we opted for the downstairs grocery store which has everything from hot and cold meals to can goods, a bakery, and sundries. We picked up some bagesl and used the in-room coffeemaker. The next day, we drove the short distance to the Bayside Marketplace for outdoor shopping. On the following days, we hit South Beach, a ten minute drive and finally Key West, 3 and a half hours each way. We ate all our dinners at the Grill and had great seafood entrees, salads, and appetizers. It was reasonable and uncrowded in April. The view was perfect, overlooking the marina. We would recommend this fine hotel to anyone wanting a prime downtown location within walking distance to Carnival Center. But I would rent a car as the public transit is minimal.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfactory Miami hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: shri420
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Biscayne Bay proved to be a very good choice for the two of us during a five day conference stay. The conference venues were both in Miami Beach and in Miami--at the nearby Carnival Center--about a three block walk. (The conference ran shuttles to Miami Beach, but we relied mostly on taxis). From the moment of arrival we were treated well--cordial service with our luggage, check-in was smooth and we found we had a bay view room that was clean and fresh and altogether very satisfactory. Except for one misbehaving elevator, the elevator service was satisfactory for a hotel of this size. The lights in the room were actually bright enough to read by; the housekeeping services were efficient--and when we made a special request, not only was the matter dealt with promptly, there was a follow-up call to make sure all was now ok. Some reviewers have mentioned the location--it is NOT in the center of things, but a block and a half to the north loop of the People Mover gives ready (and free) access to Downtown and on down to Brickell--with a same platform transfer. If there was a downside to the hotel, it was that their restaurant was understaffed. The hotel was pretty much fully booked between our convention and the flow of pre- and post-cruise visitors, but the waitstaff were just overwhelmed. The folks we had wait on our table were great individuals with friendly personalities, but we saw some people leave without ordering because of having a concert to make. At the concierge desk in the lobby there is a dedicated computer for checking in 'online' with airlines. There is an inside passage to a small shopping and food corridor between this hotel and the one next door--useful for inexpensive snacks and small meals, especially when time is a constraint. We had a great time--frankly thought it was one of the best Marriott hotels we'd experienced. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: yacoub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay for two nights early this month while attending a conference across the street. After reading cautionary reviews on this site regarding the nearby hotel where the conference was being held, we chose the Marriott instead since it was still within walking distance of the conference hotel. We were glad we did! Getting a good night's sleep in a clean room (looking out over the Bay toward South Beach no less!) was well worth the added cost. Our decision was reinforced when talking with folks who stayed at the other hotel and reported conditions there much in line with what the reviews said that were posted previously. Minor touches that were nice at the Marriott: *Sliding door in the room that opens so you can get lovely fresh air off the Bay. *Easy to use AC/heat controls *Follow up call anytime you order breakfast to your room, to ensure the meal was to your liking. *Computer in the lobby dedicated to airline online check-in and printing. I've included a couple pics from my (weak) cameraphone. Also was able to see several cruise ships pull into and out of their port location which is just to the right edge of the area in my photos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - just just ok”
Reviews.Author: illinineil
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business. Location is nice of course. Room had a nice view with a sliding door that opened for fresh air. Room appeared to have been somewhat updated - new bed, furniture etc. Bathroom felt old. Public areas were really dated. Lots of shiney gold stuff everywhere. Restaurant felt like it was out of the 60's. Service in the restaurant sucked bad - charged me full price buffet for a small bowl of oatmeal and some fruit - did not have time to fight it. That left me with a bad impression. I might stay here again - or I might not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: ute_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biscayne Bay Marriott in November, 2006, for a one-night pre-cruise stay. The hotel was fine. It was extremely windy the night we were there and we were conscious of quite a bit of noise caused by the wind, but the hotel certainly can't control the weather. Our room was tucked into kind of a corner and was fairly odd shaped and not as large as some of the others we saw when we left the next morning. The bed was very comfortable! The bathroom was laid out in a rather strange fashion. The sink area was located in a small hallway right outside the toilet/tub area. We grabbed a quick bite to eat in one of the lounges, since our flight arrived fairly late in the evening. The food was very good, but the service was extremely slow. We enjoyed going outside the next morning and being able to see our cruise ship right across the way. We ate breakfast in at the buffet and thought it was fine. We thought the hotel was rather expensive compared to most hotels we've stayed in -- but rates in Miami appear to run higher than most other areas we've stayed in. If we choose to cruise from Miami again, we would include this hotel in our list of options.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: zProsperity
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a trip with some friends from college. I upgraded to the suite room and was IMPRESSED! It was cloudy on that weekend but my pictures will show you the nice view you can get from the suites! Pros: - Fast Elevators - Beautiful Rooms - Close promixity to light rail system so you can get around city quickly - Close to airport - Excellent Room service - Excellent shopping & dining beneath hotel! Neato!!! - Extremely close to South Beach - Close to College/Bay street places - Nice staff - ATM onsite - Excellent fruit water as you check in Cons: - Parking at hotel is $19/day at their onsite garage. Cheaper than the valet service at Doubletree (next door) which is $24/day and garage across the street that is $20/day. - Internet is $12.95/day This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. If you can, upgrade to the suite. (I'm a marriott member & it was recommended on my reservation)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CD916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before our cruise. Excellent choice, the room was clean and updated.We loved the comfortable king bed with the luxury linens. We had a simple dinner in the resturant. The portions where great, and the food was good. We also had breakfast in the resturant the next morning. The prices are a little high for breakfast. I opted for the breakfast sandwich, and recommend it highly! Again, the sandwich was huge and very good. My husband had a breakfast quesadilla he said was also very tasty. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only "issue" is that the elevators and escalators could use updating, but I never waited for a elevator because there are plenty. All and all, good place to stay if you are taking a cruise out of Miami. The taxi was $8.00 to the cruiseport.

Reviews.Title: “Roach hotel”
Reviews.Author: xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxox
Reviews.Content: I went for a 4 day buisness trip and saw 5 roaches in that time. I saw 2 my first night, one in the bathroom and one on the curtain not far from the bed. I had already been there all day so I was totally unpacked but I still insisted in swiching rooms. There was a roach in the closet 2 days after that, and the rest I saw in the bathroom. I would have switched hotels in a heartbeat except i was stuck there for a conference. Additionally, the hotel restaurant was not accomodating to my diatary needs. The only upsides were the gym, and that all of the rooms have terraces.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one day before departing on our cruise. The front lobby was decorated with class. The desk service was excellent and very helpful. We ask for a room with a view and they accommadated us with a room on the 24th floor over looking the bay. The room was large with feather bedding and pillows. The room was clean, nice furniture, refrig, nice size tv, and nice size bathroom. Side note: ask for a room away from the elevators because you can hear people come and go. There is a shuttle to Bayside Market Place and to the Port Of Miami. The check-out process was easy. This is a very nice hotel and we would stay again. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: The people make this hotel. The hotel is wonderful, dont get me wrong, great rooms, great view, great location...but the staff is five star. They are wonderful people who always remember you, always take care of you and you genuinely feel they really enjoy what they do. For those of us who travel alot, really a hotel is a hotel...some are nicer then others...but the people always make the biggest difference. Wonderful new beds are in now, the fitness room (3 stories at the top of the hotel) is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Greataunt
Reviews.Content: We stay at Marriott properties often and I would describe this one as average. We were there for the NASDAQ tennis tournament out on Key Biscayne and found the roads around the hotel rather "dug up". After a battle at the front desk to get the Concierge Level room that I had reserved, the experience improved.As others have indicated, the rooms are on the small side. The bed was very comfortable and the linens of a good quality. Michael, the Concierge Lounge attendant, was delightful. We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi. If you're doing the tourist thing the location is not ideal. Overall, there are better places to atay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, my wife and I stayed at the Marriott before and after our cruise and really enjoyed it! The staff was consistently nice and very helpful. We were close to some of the best stores and restaurants, especially the port. We had a great experience and would love to go back. It was a really good value for such wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Meets_World
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay Hotel for one night before going on a Bahamas Cruise. We chose this hotel because of the location to the Port of Miami as well as reviews submitted to Trip Advisor. The customer service was okay. The help desk was friendly. Our flight was an overnight flight so we checked into the hotel about 12:30 a.m., so it was late at night. Room service closed at 1:00 a.m. but they still let us order and we ordered a chicken wrap sandwich that was so delicious! ($20, expensive, but delicious.) Our room was really tiny, but very clean. Probably the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. We paid about $309, and paid a little extra for a "deluxe bayview" room. We did have a spectacular view of Biscayne Bay with a tiny balcony. So we had "all view with little room." The bed was very comfortable so we had a great night sleep. The shower on the other hand was atrocious. Something had happened to the plumbing in our room so the only water choices were "Hot" and "Boiling Hot." And there was no water pressure coming out of the showerhead, which probably was good to avoid being scalded. We did call maintenance to come and fix the shower, but they came so late that we had already gotten dressed and we were ready to check out of the hotel when they finally came. After telling this to one of the managers, even though she was very courteous and polite, they still didn't discount the price of the room at all, which we thought was poor customer service. We did enjoy the location of the hotel and walked a short 5 minute walk to the "Omni Walk" people mover that travels around downtown Miami. It is a FREE service that transports you to where you want to go in that area. The hotel was very helpful in giving us directions and instructions on how to use, get to, etc. We took the Omni Walk to Bayside Marketplace (which is another 5 minute walk from the Omni Station.) Bayside was alot of fun with great places to eat and lots of places to shop. We even booked a short 1 1/2 hour boat bay cruise at Bayside that takes you to show you "Millionaire's Row" where all of the celebrities have their homes in Miami (about $15/person). It was a fun tour and well worth the time and money. Overall, we did like the Miami Marriott. We have always had good experiences at Marriott hotels. The lobby is gorgeous and the hotel is very nice and clean, just like the pictures on Trip Advisor show. You get what you see. And the location of the hotel is in the business district, but right on the bay so you still get the great views. Next time, we'll just ask for a bigger room. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - but you & they could do better”
Reviews.Author: Where to go nextt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean , smart and comfortable. Excellent views over the Bay & the Marina & the staff are all very willing to please . However , the hotel is located in an area of intense buiding work & the nearby Omni Mall is simply awful. The restaurant whilst offering good service , the menu is lacking and on the one time we did eat there in the evening the food was served cold & my companion had their side order delivered half way through their meal !!. All in all given the location I wished I had stayed longer over in South Beach this hotel was not as good as the reviews indicate . I think both you & they could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre-Cruise Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this hotel for a pre-cruise stop (First time May 01) and they seem to get better every time I go. Had the Cruise package with the breakfast and the food was good. View of the Port and the Marine were great Walked the 10mins to the Bayside Marketplace but could have taken the shuttle for $3. Asked staff for a good restuarant for dinner and the gentleman spent 8-10 mins asking what I wanted and gave suggestions and went we choose South Beach, arranged a van taxi for my party of 5. Package came with transfer to the Cruise Port which was just in the Hotel Shuttle Van and the driver was talking to us on the way and was very friendly. The outdoor pool and hot tub on deck 5 is excellent but the pool is a little small. My only concern was that the 11 o'clock checkout was hectic due to a conference in the hotel and we waited over 30 minutes to get an elevator from the 24th floor. I had to walk down to stairs and stand in line for 12 mins to check out and let the Shuttle driver know why we were delayed. Overall, I plan to stay at this hotel every pre-cruise trip out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Super small room with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for New Year's. The property is very nice, the people are friendly and the view is breath taking. The room was super small for the $279 we paid. The bathroom was tiny. the balcony was tiny as well. I read a review before booking stating these same things and I did not believe it until I was there. Extremely small room. We stay in several hotels in Miami/Ft.Lauderdale throughout the year and by far this has been the smallest room I have seen. The bed is very comfortable but again it takes up most of the room. I will not return to this hotel only because I feel I do not get my monies worth.

HotelInfo.Name: Miami Marriott Biscayne Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 1633 North Bayshore Drive, Miami, FL 33132
